eYLmGV8Um37gCdG7ewcIiQ.text: Came here for girls night!! We ordered az88 chicken burger, az88 salad & avocado chicken club.  All were huge & around $10.  Nice affordable option for Scottsdale.   The confetti champagne is a must.  So yum- they pour Chambord & bubbling confetti on top of champs all for $8. The reason we always come here is for the great reasonable food, chic ambiance, convenient garage parking & the bathrooms are super fun!!!   Service is slow but we weren't in hurry so that would have to be my only complaint.   My girl friend ordered the apple Martini (it's organic) & we didn't realize till bill came it was $14-eeek.  So I would stick with the champagne.   Way better deal!!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Confetti Champagne!!!

_ngBNkNrGg9IdRsT5hgfgQ.text: love this place!!! i am never dissatisfied :-)

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

GBxvQLTgBV6XUjkh-nBuXg.text: One of my constant standbys, the Hell's Fire chips are outstanding and can be substituted for fries with the delicious sandwiches for a small addition. Sometimes the service is a bit slow when it gets busy, but it's worth the wait. Try to avoid evenings events are held at SMOCA or other areas of the Civic Center.

Kg4wBVmCgfGs2R_RhmlDeg.text: I can't believe I hadn't been to AZ 88 before. So last weekend, I came for lunch (in the midst of the Scottsdale artfest) with my step mom and her mom. There was a 45 minute wait for patio seating, but we snagged a table inside, but right by the open patio (so pretty much on the patio) right away... nice! We decided to share the cobb salad and the self proclaimed best grilled cheese in the world between the 3 of us. The salad was decent and a large portion. I had mine with the balsamic dressing, which was fairly standard. The grilled cheese was alright, but certainly not the best in the world... not even the best in Phoenix. It was cheesy, but the cheese wasn't really melted (maybe it had sat for a bit before being delivered?). Anyway, it was fine, but nothing special. The fries that came with it were also nothing very special.. just plain waffle fries. The portion was large. The bill was also large... a salad and a sandwich, no drinks... 30$!?!?! whoa. I would possibly go back if I were in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't seek it out.

P-ktvgZU_XwhA_Vx5EeFeA.text: I came here on a date one Friday night and loved it.   All I have to suggest for drinks is the lemon drop martini. Hands down, the best I ever had. Service in here was amazing.  I do have to mention the ladies room because It was like being in some crazy fun house. The bathroom stall was all mirrors.   The food here is very good. I highly recommend for apps to get their water chestnuts which are wrapped in bacon and the galettes which is like a flat bread pizza.   I liked this place so much after my date, I decided to bring one of my friends here and she loved it too. What a fun gem to find!

vZYoRNCXZVLFPfRh6SdekQ.text: This is a staple.. Been around for a long time. Don't come here for haute cuisine, though. This place does burgers, salads and chicken awesomely. I've had the burgers every time and each time it's excellent. Homey food in a upscale, trendy setting. Service can be a little bit spotty at times, but come for the burgers, and stay for their signature overfilled martinis

rJFwK5xipU8f5loY0p3APQ.text: Always fun, and they rotate the art pieces on display. very cool!

WW3ihqKu8GKOg9j0TQqRLA.text: Was skeptical about the dinner menu initially but The Chicken sandwich and the Biggest Mac was delicious! Great ambiance and great people watching!

QtG_PYYoPRyOum866Vx-YA.text: Love, love, love this place. This is my favorite spot to  eat, drink and be seen. From the decor, the interesting mix of people, and the chill vibe, AZ 88 has been my date night spot consistently since  2009 and I love it more and more every year. The drinks are quite amazing to say the least. The martinis are super potent with flavor and alcohol. ..definitely worth every penny. I am obsessed with the Mai Tai as well as the Mojito.   You can tell they dont use the dreaded sour mix, it's mixed with quality ingredients.   Count on it, the drinks will take you there in no time. The food is soooo good. When i used to eat meat,  the AZ88 chicken sandwich was my ish. The food is always seasoned well, hot and just smack yo momma good. I love going to the bathroom to watch myself in the mirrors that are everywhere. It's so much to say about this place, you just have to go and see for yourself. ..your welcome! !

IqJdFOsI6gOJVKfDwC8hOw.text: Great atmosphere for a nice evening out with friends and an excuse to get dressed up, eat and drink.

qGIFmjIsHE7Cw1A3XsThSA.text: I'm torn because I want to give it a 3.5, because at the end of the day it was a posh sandwich joint. BUT, for the ambiance and vibe it gets bumped up to a 4. I had a delicious, huge cheeseburger and my friend had some salad (Mahi or Ahi). My burger was great, but the salad was pretty bland.  Oh yeah, I hurt myself on the golf cart ride over and got a gash in my knee. The waitress was very sweet and went to get me bandaids and alcohol swabs:-)

fXuMO7l2BXug5sDhg9bPPg.text: Very "in crowd" but not overly snotty. The seating is a little on top of each other but the food and drinks make up for it.   They DO NOT take reservations so be prepared for a bit of a wait depending on when you go. Gluten free menu available upon request. They also offer take out if your in a hurry call it in ahead of time.   Tried: Bonfire Chicken - looked amazing Cobb Salad - Worth 14.00 plus! Its HUGE and delicious  Burger Au POIVRE - Yum  All American Grilled Cheese - Perfection  Every single thing was fantastic! I've raved about this place to anyone who will listen.

1rmDMhKzFp0mnZXDzdDZdA.text: AZ88 fantastic food always good.  Fun people watching.  Music is like listening to my favorites play list.  Spectacular salads.  Staff always friendly and accommodating.  Hot wings best in Scottsdale

BJU26SoUV1Zy3LfjdewczA.text: Went here for dinner with girlfriends on Tues. Wasn't blown away.  It was difficult for me to find as there is no signage. I finally had to ask someone after wandering around for 15 mins.   The service was lackluster. Our server gave us the impression we were inconveniencing her more than anything. Not warm or friendly at all.  The menu was mostly sandwiches and salads all of which I wasn't particularly in the mood for. I was expecting more choices. I ended up ordering the Burger Au Poivre II...for $14.50, I was expecting WAY better quality.  I will give them credit for their very extensive cocktail list and the bar is well stocked with every type of quality liquor you can imagine. I had the celebration champagne which was tasty.  Beautiful atmosphere. I'd probably return for drinks at the bar but not the food or service.

jo45sKhQqaE8MhILbE0chg.text: To start off with, it has been at least 10 years since I have been here.  I somewhat had to convince my fiance' to pass up Oregano's to come here.  For some reason, she thought it was going to be some random diner.  I laughed and said "right..."  I was hopeful that it was still the same great lunch that I was used to.  So we decided to try it on Friday afternoon 9/6.    It did not disappoint.  Our server was fantastic.  He was mellow but very good at what he does.  She got the champagne with sugar confetti in it and was very pleased with it.  We started with the Hell's Fire Chips and they were fantastic.  Would get them again for sure.  I then ordered what had previously been my "Go To," for years:  The AZ88 Chicken Sandwich.  Absolute homerun!  She got the 7353 Club and was very happy with it.  At the waiter's suggestion, she opted for the double-decker, not the triple-decker and it was a wise decision because it was plenty of food for her.  The meat was perfect and as my sandwich was, it would be a repeat order for her when we return.   All in all, it was a great experience and we will be back again.  For a city like Phoenix that has hundreds of places that come and go, AZ88 showed exactly why some places can stand the test of time and not only stay consistent but thrive because they do everything well down to even the smallest of details.

Wz3kC2g8FD2EKTLPc1k5Qg.text: Two words: Celebration Champagne.  Start with that and go from there to enjoy a fun night out in Old Town. This place is always hopping with locals who know where to find this hidden hot spot.   The prices for food are really reasonable, and the portions sizes are generous. I would sell my favorite pair of jeans for one of their grilled cheese sandwiches. The waffle fries are also delicious, as are salads, desserts, and the other sandwiches.   I love the rotating art showcased, the sexy bathrooms, and the unique music at AZ88. When the weather is pleasant, sit outside and enjoy views of park and soft breezes.   One complaint might be that it can get loud, but that's because people are drinking celebration champagne (or beers, wines, or just plain water). AZ88 is fun with fantastic food. Go on, celebrate.

NBnQ7CBrrJWmpxCqfBOsDQ.text: Amazing burgers and martinis. The cocktails are boozy and filled to the brim. The burgers are done loosie-juicy style. Try the hell's fire chips, au poivre burgers and the AZ88 chicken sandwich.

hz9myf4v3A5QVYWc1wjmdg.text: Wow what a wonderful place.  Our waiter, John, was amazing!    The food was delicious and the bathrooms are out of this world.  It was a little difficult to find but worth looking far.

s9y00DIOi6nkAfE-_fLILw.text: AZ88 consistently delivers a good vibe and a casual atmosphere for friends and groups. We have frequented 88 for a number of years now, and always go back. The setting is special, and we love sitting outdoors. Will be back soon to get a glimpse of the Christmas tree and have a cheer. We all have our favorites when it comes to food, husbands is Las Brisas burger and mine is any chicken sandwich on the menu. This is the perfect time of year to give this place on the green area a try.

iGIOf09AlfnpY0sVq0a3yg.text: AZ88 Is a cool simple lunch spot. The menu is not complicated but the way the food its put together is divine. I had the Truck Garden Chicken Sandwich - Marinated in fresh lemon juice and peppercorn. The radish and cucumber that accompanied the sandwich balanced it out and made every bite refreshing. I would like to come back and try a burger...and maybe a cocktail too.  .

F6iJp1k1huaZiZTux2HSWA.text: I spent the better part of an hour at AZ88, had a couple drinks at the bar and tried their shrimp ceviche (tasty). It was late on a Thursday night while school was out, the the place was pretty dead, so I can't say much to the clientele.  From my experience though, I'd liked the contemporary look of the venue, the outdoor seating options and the generally spaciousness this lounge offers. The bartenders were polite, conversation light and casual. It's clear that this place has a good following of locals, which means they're obviously doing something right.  While I was there, the owner was displaying some 'diamond dogs' in the center of the room, that were won in an auction...okay. Whatever.  I'd definitely like to come back to this place when its more happenin. I think it'd be a good time.

WPLA9g6vBURulNnhvcgP-A.text: Awesome atmosphere, great food, awesome music and good service!

thxruVpU3USIbiW_BdVn-w.text: Went there on a Saturday night about 7:30ish and got a seat right away (so happy tourist season is over for now!).  Ordered two champagne cocktails - a Kir Royal and the Celebration Champagne - and both were excellent and fairly priced.  My boyfriend got their mint julep which he liked (I took his word for it as bourbon, even the smell of it, makes me want to yak).  For dinner he got one of their chicken sandwiches which was tasty but covered in way too much mayo.  It was good, but I thought it was something that could easily be made at home.  My burger on the other hand - best burger I've had in a LONG time.  It was the Burger Au Poivre II.  Don't bother with I, get the II, as it has the bleu cheese crumbles and bacon, absolutely delicous.  This was my first time eating here, and I would like to try a few other items.  My overall impression of this place is that it's a good starting off point if you are hitting the Scottsdale clubs.  Get some apps, drinks and then get the rest of the night going.  I think next time I'd like to go a little lighter because the burger did put me into a food coma.  Worth it though!

GcWKjNPdEm6201OcekPntQ.text: I am a huge follower of Karl Kopp.  In fact, I live in Chicago and manage to make it up to Elsa's atleast twice a month, which is one of their other locations.  I cannot express enough much my partner and I enjoy going here when in town.  The food RULES and the rotating art installations are breath taking!!!!

y_nvoDeYDQ2yjMbP9GAATQ.text: The decor is great and the restaurant is very cool. But the food is just not good.

Ze7GdbAq6dBt9xfaJCvNSg.text: The best and freshest salad by far.  I love the decor minus the goddy white statue outside with black paint.  A bit morbid for my taste, yet the AZ88 Chicken is my favorite. I always substitute the potato chips for the salad and the mojito is very refreshing.

xHAq0pPaQD2lOknKwcnHyg.text: Came here Saturday night around 9PM, to our surprise it wasn't too busy. While my friend and I waited to be seated, we were lounging on an amazing incline chair that viewed the amazing Phoenix sky.  My friend and I were seated in less than 10 minutes. We were seated outside which was nice, but it felt like we were in the way of everyone's way, but besides that, the place was nice. Our server was ok, nothing too spectacular, I've had better.   The art was neat as well! This place was a good place to be "seen" if you get my drift, but the food was just like everything else. I wouldn't mind coming back here to be "seen" and have a couple of cocktails.

V5tSFU2VxOvsmKnIWH0Phw.text: I went to AZ 88 this past week to meet up with some friends and an out of town friend.  It was close to our friends hotel so we thought lets check it out, I hadn't been in awhile.    The Good:  I've been here several times over the last 12 years of living in Phoenix and one thing I have to say is this restaurant is very consistent with their food.  It's always good, and when you order something you know what you are going to get.  A sandwich I had 4-6 years ago, tastes as good today as it did back then.    The Bad:  It's not really bad, but to best honest, I think its time for a little make over.  It's one thing to be consistent but this restaurant needs to catch up with its competition.  There are many many new restaurants in the valley, especially in the Scottsdale area and to the locals this can get boring.  This place hasn't changed in about 10 years, I think its time for a freshen up.   Overall, its a great place that brings back many memories from coming here over the years, and I look forward to coming back again.

MirPRgFq5pFnySBKJgBzdQ.text: People dont go to AZ88  for the service, so get over it if youre impatient waiting for a drink or your food.  Enjoy the trendy ambience or venture to the bathroom for entertainment.  Take your pick from the "He," "She," or "S/He" bathrooms.  Yes, this restuarant/bar moonlights as a gay hangout but who cares.  No one in Scottsdale apparently because word has spread even through the heterosexual community that this is a great hangout.  SUPER strong drinks, casual atmosphere despite the trendy attitude, and great American cusine make for the perfect combo.    My favorite is the AZ88 chicken sandwhich, which is a spicy chicken with blue cheese on a bun with the best waffle fries EVER.  You can also get it as a salad if youre feeling skinny.    The staff isnt the most friendly or the most prompt so put your patient pants on and suck down a drink while you wait.  You'll forget what youre waiting for.    Food is served latenight and you can walk around the park by the civic center afterwards...  Great date spot.

4cDCQlNHAnY59Bn8VtFDnA.text: Great atmosphere and fantastic food.  Try the Saint Petersburg Potatoes  with smoked salmon (they are like Jewish nachos).  Good drink and wine menu and secret wall bathrooms.  I highly recommend stopping in here if you are in Scottsdale.

bmGjCCouCy9eAh01T1wi5A.text: Every time I am in the Phoenix area, I have to come here. HAVE TO. I am not trendy, I am not hip, I am not with it and yet I feel so cool when I walk in to this streamlined coolly lit, dj playing place.   Why must I come here? They make an excellent mai tai (my obsession) that is the perfect amount of sweet and tangy. They have Pimm's cups too, which I also adore, especially after a long sweltering day of sitting by the pool. (I know, life is rough!)  The food is super excellent as well. I love the dipping fries with the three sauces and the gallette appetizers. I dream about their perfectly executed cobb salad. Seriously, it's that good. And recently, my friend got their burger and I discovered that TOO was amazing! You seriously can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The staff is really friendly and on top of it. I've been here on really busy Friday nights and super quiet Tuesday evenings and am always treated with the utmost respect and care.   Its been a great place for groups (6+) or for just a romantic duo. It's really cool and classy without being pretentious, uppity or trying too hard. Seems unlike the rest of the Scottsdale cougar scene and more laid back. I really enjoy it here and am already dying for another cobb salad.

J8IzJL0o-H7Kk-cejcb3QQ.text: okay, am I just way too picky?  Am I just bitter and taking it out on restaurants?  I'd like to think not.....But is there not a cook in town who will actually cook a burger med rare when you ask them to?  Oh they'll say they will, but was that a little smirk on the waitress's face I saw as she turned to enter my order?  AZ88 is known for their awesome burgers.  Got mine with cheese and mushrooms and was assured by the amicable and super foxy young bartender that it would be cooked exactly to my specifications.  mwah mwah mwaaaaaaah......It was well done....again!   I've been duped again!  I will not eat a well done burger that I just paid 12 bucks for, no matter how dreamy the bartender's eyes and kinda dirty but still sexy hair is.  This is an outrage!  Are there others who get as bummed out by an overcooked burger as I do?  I will risk the salmonella or cryptospiridium or whatever, just to have a juicy burg, yo....Is there anybody with me?

LQm3pzkGsfU8Fsh5wvrr3A.text: This is a very cool place and I love it here.  As others have said, it's been around "forever" (I think it started in 1988 hence the name) and has kept up the with the times nicely. Still a classy place to get a martini or a gourmet burger.  It's hip without being pretentious.  The fact that he has survived over the years in Scottsdale where trends change monthly speaks volumes.

zWX4A_TgxLiildHIy4En0A.text: I have been coming to AZ 88 for years now!  I can not come to Phoenix and not come here.  Great atmosphere, great food and drinks!  One of the best cheeseburgers I have ever had (The Cheeseburger).  Another great item on the menu is the Hot Pepper Chicken!  AMAZING!

nCzEodJibDHoYBagMz9LBg.text: Ate at AZ88 in January with two friends and loved it! We are from Chicago so being able to sit outside and eat dinner in winter was an added bonus! We started off with the dipping fries for an appetizer and the buffalo bleu cheese dipping sauce was hands down our favorite! If you're a buffalo wings fan, try it. Promise you will not be disappointed! For our entrees, two of us had the AZ88 chicken. We swapped fries on the side with grilled veggies - and HOLY COW - were they generous on that! I've never had a place give me so many veggies when I asked for no fries and I was very impressed! The chicken sandwich was delicious and had so much flavor. I wished I lived in the Scottsdale area because I would be a weekly visitor! Side Note -- my friend's initials are AZ and he is born in 1988 so it was extremely fitting for us to dine here on our trip! When we are back in Phoenix -- a stop here is an absolute must!

nI4jzPdeYpZ2ejgZJLCR6A.text: This place was quite a nice atmosphere.  The bar gets about a 4.5 and the food about 3.5, so I ended up at 4 stars.  The bar has a good selection of drinks, and the food, while tasty, isn't anything super special.  I am in town on business and have gone to many places in Phoenix and Scottsdale and will likely return, but not before trying many more others first.    The prices for food I felt were quite reasonable given the decor and vibe and much better than a chain like Chili's or something.  The staff was nice and friendly....the scene was very "cool" feeling, although the menu kind of made me wonder if this was a burger joint trying to feel upscale or an upscale place trying to offer reasonably priced food.    All in all, I would definitely go back, as you can have a good meal and enjoy the atmosphere and decor without breaking the bank.

mIWYY-SmeGVZzWivNpV9BA.text: I had my second AZ 88 experience the other day for lunch and i must say i love it. I sat on the patio which overlooked the beautiful park. I ordered the picnic chicken sandwich with fruit. The presentation of the dish was beautiful. The sandwich was delicious although I think they could have gone a little lighter on the gorganzola cheese it overpowered the rest of the ingredients. But i took some out and it was fine. The server was a bit slow and even though his section wasn't very full he found a way of dissapearing for extended periods of time. But when he was around he was very good and polite. Overall i had another great experience there and will happily be back. If you haven't dined here definitely check it out!

trfBo504IeGytQ-3AVtRTw.text: Cool atmosphere, great patio. Nice food and drink selection with fresh ideas and ingredients. Everything I've had there was great! I like to try a new drink every time. Waiter was busy but good. I recommend going on a nice day and sitting on the patio!

FURm0wXMTeohoVJ9pV1-tg.text: Espresso Martini...and kuddos to Kyle, the bartender, who knows how to put a drink together!  This is my ideal spot when I go out.  Far from a club atmosphere but dim enough that it isn't quite a lounge.  It's a classy, chic place to enjoy a laid back evening, but still have a reason to dress up =)

_oGo0biKxsvGZCKSMTQ92Q.text: Went here for a date. We both had the bonfire chicken. It was great and large quantity. We sat outside it was a bit chilly and one of the waiters brought me a shawl.  I'd definitely go here again. The staff was very friendly as well.

TfC3XOCzI_liHNaXbrc_hw.text: Drinks are well poured and the location is nice, but finding this place for the first time takes careful planning. It's in the middle of a park inaccessible by car, which a walk is no problem unless you are handicapped or it's 112 degrees. The food was good, but not memorable with tons of sandwiches on the menu (cheap) and like 4 or 5 adult entrees to choose from. I'd return for happy hour and skip dinner.

CAs4Y4fg_NTuVVh9zjDa9Q.text: Excellent table service by Gilbert. Great atmosphere and fun, diverse menu. Love AZ 88! It's hip, trendy, classy, relaxed. The prices are reasonable and the crowd is young, relaxed and with no pretense. Thank you AZ 88 for a lovely time.

h65Lewu5Y1CLO1-sOM1OSw.text: The martini's are the excellent! I've been here a couple of times in the last month or so to meet friends for apps and drinks.  The Hell Fire chips are a fun & simple app and really compliment a great dirty martini!    On my last visit a girlfriend of mine ordered the AZ88 Chicken Sandwich, I was not hungry, but she could not finish it so she started to push it on me and I'm glad I did because it was DELICIOUS!  I ended up eating three quarters of it and have been obsessing about how delicious it was since.    There is something about the bun it was so fresh and basically bread heaven, the small pieces of chopped sauteed celery mixed with the buffalo sauce was not something I would normally look at a menu and and be like "oh, I have to have that" but it made the sandwich and I found myself picking up all the little pieces that fell of the sandwich and into the basket.  I have been CRAVING this damn chicken sandwich ever since and I am driving my boyfriend crazzzzy by begging him to go back with me so I can have it again, I may have to sneak over there by myself!!   If you go here "not hungry" order the AZ88 Chicken Sandwich and try not to finish it, and if you can't I'll take it!!  Four stars because the service was slow...20 minutes for a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Starting early

3GAZLpdj3epXrC-oAWWB2w.text: Probably one of the coolest bars in the West. Very friendly staff. Great strong drinks, expert wait staff. 30 years and still going strong. Takes on different vibes from seniors to juniors and everyone in between. A hidden gem in the valley of the sun. Their waffle fries are to die for. Upscale

3RObywWxvGwX3gP1GZ4Ppg.text: this is a hidden gem had no idea the burger here were that amazing i had the big mac burger the most amazing burger i ever had this is what mcdonalds burger is suppose to taste like it really melted in your mouth this burger just fresh and amazing ingredients. Very happy amd satisfied with the meal and also a great environment highly recommended.

-7UvuPCKdTGd3JtzZEtlwQ.text: Today was my last visit to AZ88 after many years. I always brought friends there when they would visit. Was a regular for years. Brought a friend there from out of town for burgers. Drove the long trip. It was a Tuesday about 5pm. The entire time I could not get the waitress to actually stand still at the table. Everything was said and done while she was running by waiting on someone else. We ordered two medium rare cheeseburgers with bacon. Both the same except my friend had tomato's. I wish I had taken photos. What arrived were very overdone fries that tasted like they had been under heat lamps. I snapped one in half and it snapped like a chip. It was that hard. The fruit was old and dried up looking. The burgers were raw. Not pink. Not rare. RAW. As in 100% completely uncooked on the inside. My friend picked up his burger and I thought he was going to be sick. They were cut down the middle so where is the quality control? Can you not see the burger is completely raw on the inside?  Mine was sopping wet with blood and the bun completely falling apart. Both had three completely unmelted pieces of cheese. I flagged down the waitress and explained the situation. Again she refused to actually stand still. She asked if we wanted another. Yeah I drove nearly an hour yes I'm hungry. She put in another order albeit what seemed reluctantly. My friend asked for his medium well this time. He was completely freaked out. I asked for mine medium. What showed up was not the rather large juicy burgers they normally serve that we got the first time but two burgers half the size and clearly premade and sub par cut of of meat. Plainly they were gross. I don't even know why they would have these burgers in the kitchen unless they were some sort of emergency burger in case they ran out of meat. And they still mixed up the order. I got tomato's on mine the rarer of the two but they were both over cooked near burned now. Tasteless. Disgusting. He ate his complaining the whole time that I should have cooked at home but ate it out of being starving. We hadn't eaten half the day excited for burgers. I ate half of mine and just felt sick.  The fries were better the second time but not too good. I took a bite and pushed them around the plate. Four times I asked for extra ketchup I never got. Gave up. The manager came by and was very very nice but you could tell he didn't really care and was just placating us by even listening. He asked what he could do and did I want another meal. Three times now?  No I'm good. I asked if he could just comp it. He agreed absolutely. I was so bummed because we had been looking forward to it.  I don't actually eat out a lot so when I do it's more of an experience than it is for many. I don't know who's ingenius idea it was to now serve the food on trays but it really adds to the cafeteria quality of food they are now serving. If you are going to charge these prices and market yourself as a swanky place at least give us some damn dishware.   He offered a desert on the house. My friend was going to decline but I made him get something. No way this was going to be totally wasted. He got the strawberry shortcake. It was fair. We split it. My stomach was doing flip flops but I was starving. It was very sugary and the topping tasted synthetic and it was covered in powdered sugar to boot. Why would you need to add powdered sugar to cake ice cream whipped cream and strawberry sauce?  It was putridly sweet.   I was ready to tip the waitress when while we were still eating she comes over and plops a reserved marker on the table while we are still sitting there!  We had literally just finished our last bite. That was the nail in the coffin. I was so offended by that final act I will never go back to this establishment.   We've been complaining for the past 3 hours of regret. What we got was a stomach ache and a headache from the experience. On the plus side I'm relieved that I no longer have to drive 45 minutes for my favorite burger. I'll just cook one at home.

ejC-DeYg-mY9P4bTwmP2FA.text: This easily has become my favorite restaurant in the valley. The food, service, atmosphere and building itself are fantastic. I had the Alfredo burger and wow, it was absolutely unreal. The bare tender made a fantastic pina colada and the food was just delectable. Even the bathrooms are awesome with the neon green and purple mood lighting. It made for one of the grooviest bowel movements I've ever had, I can't wait to come back to this spot.

ssulaOJ46-yvBh3l_qcuBg.text: Avoid this place. The servers are awful. The manager will argue with you for staff error. 1 star for finally adjusting the bill after 10-15 minutes of arguing. Customer service and retention is lost with this business.  We could hear the staff saying insults about other individuals in our party. Very rude and unprofessional...at least go to the back of house to make your comments.  Food was okay, nothing too memorable. But not bad.  There are other places around to venture to with much better customer service.

DQRXA72jx4Zl8-b1A4cnvg.text: Lovely, lovely patio.  Overlooking the gardens, fountains, and beautiful artwork was a nice way to wrap up the day.  Was in town for a dog show and needed to bring my boy who isn't good in hotel rooms alone.  It was a busy night, they seated us right away and I had a lovely time.  Generous martinis done right.  The other folks on the patio were chatty, so there were lots of great conversations across tables.  Highly suggest the Burger Las Brisas, a side of remoulade, and the fresh fruit was great.  Bonus points for great service that was never rushed, and they filled my dog's water dish twice.    Generally, I'm not a huge fan of being in Scottsdale, but I'd go back here without hesitation.  In fact, have recommended it to several people who had a similar positive experience to mine.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lovely patio with great company.  Appreciate that the patio is dog friendly, and in a beautiful setting

uB_23H7xq9Y4UDjmifSbrw.text: Upbeat and trendy atmosphere! It's classy during The day and great for bringing my family. At night It's like a club. The waffle fries and grilled vegetables are addicting. Shrimp ceviche is refreshing and makes a perfect, light meal. Cheese and fruit plate is always fresh and high quality. The cheeseburger is very juicy and I think they put a little butter on the meat. ;) Highly recommend this place!

_fwoZLqWKZtvEwqyMv8rCg.text: Looking for a place to check out for a late dinner, upon recommendation we decided to head to AZ 88. The menu looked promising with it's unique mix of flavors, we decided to share the bacon wrapped water chestnuts (seriously, you can always hook me with bacon wrapped anything) and I shared the Asian shrimp noodle stir fry.  The water chest nuts where disappointing, I think they were expecting the bacon flavoring to carry the dish but it was pretty lackluster. And the Asian stir fry tasted like the cook was very heavy handed in the soy sauce, it was quite salty and I'm pretty sure I downed a lot more water than I normally do for dinner. I couldn't taste much of the other ingredients' flavors because the saltiness was so overpowering.  I can see how this place brings in a lot of diners as it's right by the theatre (which hold many events over the year), but I don't think I'd come back to AZ 88, unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped water chestnuts
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Asian Stir Fry

QnwspAqybHJsEI_NF0cb6g.text: Fun drinks, great service, cool atmosphere! In my opinion AZ88 falls somewhat flat on food. I have been here multiple times and I have never been impressed with the food selection or taste. In my most recent experience, the 'flatbread' is more or less a cracker with melted cheese, the chicken on my sandwich was dry and didn't have  a lot of flavor.

kp0TT32UZPW9NeGSZ4RJnA.text: I've been coming here since I was 21 and I absolutely love this place!! I love the different art they put up on the wall every month or so. Evan is my favorite bartender he is so friendly and makes the best drinks. Can't go wrong with a strawberry margarita from here!

wDJEnaf-YdFZ8a_Eq5HQ9Q.text: Great atmosphere and service. Their Bigger Mac is amazing and their drinks are the best.

Qe8KrZHIwKXi82M9PJ-S6g.text: Such a beautiful place to hangout for late night cocktails. Old town being the destination for dining, AZ88 surely lives up to the expectations. The service was prompt. They had very good variety of handcrafted cocktails and the food was just delicious. I would certainly go back!

uoa3Pq9RZ68AgnGZrJfBoQ.text: KILLER MARTINIS!! Literally killer. They are insanely strong and insanely delicious! I don't know how many shots are in each martini, but it's enough that the night got pretty hazy after two - and I was told I ended up having almost 4. I stuck to dirty vodka martinis. They have regular, blue cheese stuffed, and garlic stuffed olives... yum!!! Overall, I thought the food was okay. The  hell's fire chips and dipping fries were delicious. My chicken calabrese sandwich was HUGE but just meh when it came to flavor. The side of steamed veggies were good. The service was great, friendly, and attentive! Overall, had a great time and would definitely come back for the martinis next time I'm in town!

Tb8vVBweccXUOlQwt27W5g.text: Took my first trip to AZ 88 last night, didn't even realize it was right in the Civic Center. Decided to go here kind of last minute when my boyfriend saw an article talking about their burgers in the newspaper.  When we first got there I was a little surprised that there wasn't a hostess. Not that they needed one, it was just unexpected for a nicer restaurant. The ambiance was pretty nice, very open setting. One downside was that some of the booth seats, and the bench in the front was kind of gross and dirty. Otherwise, everything else was clean.   I got the Portobello Mushroom sandwich and a Salty Dog to drink. Our service was great, and our food arrived in a timely matter. The food was good. My sandwich was a tad dry, but nothing a little ketchup can't fix. Also loved the potato chip-type-thing on it. Gave the sandwich a nice crunch. My drink was also enjoyable, a few more chunks of grapefruit than expected, but not bad. Also thought it was kinda funny how they served one small carrot and like a fraction of a radish with my food. Who eats raw radishes? Stole my bf's floret of broccoli to make up for it haha. The best part of my meal by far was the waffle fries. Idk what it is about fries in that shape, but they just taste so much better than regular fries!  My boyfriend got a burger that was supposed to have jalepenos on it, however, when it arrived there were no jalepenos to be seen! He told our server, and he quickly brought us a side of jalepenos. He thought his burger was good, but it was not a personal favorite.   The bathrooms here are pretty funky too. First off, they are impossible to find because theres no handle, and its only labeled at the very bottom where you can't see. The interior is covered with mirrors and the women's bathroom had pink lights everywhere. Was definitely the most interesting restaurant bathroom I've experienced so far.  The price was not too terrible for the amount of food they give you. Sad that they didn't have a happy hour though. This was a unique restaurant to try. The location was nice, and though there are a few things that lack in the restaurant, it is definitely worth making a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portobello Mushroom Sandwich

rqtt2Xintvq2VRUwf7TuoA.text: Another fine lunch @ AZ 88 ! My wife loved the Asian shrimp, while I enjoyed the AZ 88 Buffalo chicken......asked to have mine prepared w/o the bread, and had the celery served uncooked on the side ! Totally great....ask to have your AZ 88 Buffalo chicken sand " The Supreme Musical Intellect's " way .......you'll be glad you did !

03ZJYqLALrpHitSVpKmXrA.text: Very good food. I got a salad and it was very good. They added some ingredients that was not on the menu that I had to pull out. It was the buffalo salad. Service was exceptional.

vq7Ck_IOOhZKPMYUXFUtxQ.text: Great classy place to go on a date or for a birthday dinner! Drinks are expensive (not sure if they have happy hour) & food is good.  Menu has not changed since I first moved here back in '03, which isn't a bad thing (obviously it works after all these years).  Came on a Sun night for a friend's bday and it was dead, but that's ok as we were not dressed for the occasion (no dress code to my knowledge).

1F0B2OxucWHlRDtP1nXI2A.text: Came here with some girlfriends. The food and drinks were excellent! Definitely recommend the ceviche. The prices were good as well. However, the waiter over-charged our table. When confronted, he lied and said he hadn't when my friend was able to pull up her bank account on her phone which showed the incorrect charge. She then spoke to the manager as well. The manager said the charges would be fixed and brought our table a dessert to share which was nice. It took several days for the charges to be fixed on our accounts but it was all fine in the end. So the food was excellent but the lie over the bill did cause the night to be a little frustrating.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

axiHUBGRCgUTuaEGEDLK0g.text: Decor is elegant, yet inviting and interesting. Great patio when it's cooler out.  Martinis are a must, theyre kind of known for them.  I think the picnic sandwich is one of my all time fave sandwiches. So much sandwich, not to mention the sides that they pile on as well.  Staff is always friendly and attentive.

e9pRfT_1FzJcVq_5XNa4ZQ.text: Great location with nice views. The food is pricey but worth it. The waiter was attentive and friendly. I had the burger au poivre which was good as well as the espresso martini. A great place for a business or personal lunch.

XYMJeKJc3KknLSFEmPmKKg.text: If I was just rating the decor and hipness it would be 4-5 stars. I hadnt been here since 97? Back then it was packed with the young & sexy and fabulous gay crowd. umm this time (Sat night) the majority was packed with ultra hip seniors.. Im talking 50 & up. Im not talking a Luby's crowd but what you would hope grow up to become. It was like a witch had put a spell on everyone in 97 and aged them all. There was one table of highschoolers but they escaped in time before the witch got them.  As for the food.. A+ for a unique appetizer. Bacon wrapped waterchestnuts! The crunch factor was nothing but awesomeness. Although it was unique and worth a try it wasnt bursting with flavor. I had a AZ88 Cobb and I liked that I was able to pick what cheese I wanted. As for the dessert I requested the Drumstick Sundae hoping it would be like a Drumstick cone.. right? Umm nope..it was good but a Drumstick replica it was not.  The food was decent, the crowd, albeit older, was lively and interesting to say the least. I'd go back and give it another try.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. AZ88 Cobb
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped water chestnuts
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flirtini

D4C8UGovuH5ydrhf9yTCMg.text: I have been going to AZ 88 for two years now and my boyfriend has been going in for over 10+ years! We absolutely love this place! The martinis are better than any martini I've ever had! You also have to try the Hells Fire Chips! We order them every time! But I would like to point out, we were in there last night and Jemar was by far the best waiter I have ever had. Did things that stood out that no other waitress or waiter has done. Was very polite and professional. We really hope to get him again!!

DH9GidXE1gkvSFp_omOP5g.text: So the atmosphere here is unreal. Cool design for sure. Patio is rad, obviously too cold for winter, but definitely gives off a hip vibe. What I was finding myself growing more and more irritated about what the hospitality. This place is open pretty late, and that's the main reason we came here-- referred by friends. (kitchen is open until around 1 maybe? Don't quote me!) but I work in the industry and would never go into a place if they closed within the hour. Our server was so unbelievably inattentive. I watched her sit stand at the bar and talk with friends for atleast 15-20 minutes (directly in front of us) before checking up, within the first portion of our meal. We were her only table. This repeatedly happened throughout our dining experience. The difference between mediocre and great hospitality lies within how charismatic you are with your guests. I didn't feel important enough or like our experience mattered to her. Which is frustrating. I'm paying good money because I expect good service and good food. If that can't be provided at 11pm (hours before closing) then don't be open that late. That simple. Not worth wasting your money for poor service and alright food.

mPnD6xdUZClftM6canSgZA.text: First time at AZ88 and I have to say I am impressed by the food, if not the service. We dined for lunch on a cloudy Friday afternoon and the mood outside seemed to affect the mood inside. As we entered, one waitress was leaning against a wall with her head resting on the wall. It wasn't too terribly busy and there seemed to be enough staff but getting drinks in a timely manner wasn't happening.  The food, however, was worth the discomfort. I ordered "The Chicken" and was impressed with the taste and the portions. Waffle fires were tasty but the vegetable and fruit side was rather slim (one carrot, one piece of broccoli, one piece of melon and one piece of pineapple).  We'll give it another try. Hopefully the service will improve.

aUEZ2v0aH24ccFmIKdEbcA.text: If I could give 10 stars I would based on the design and atmosphere alone.   I'm from LA and was brought here by my best friend after a day at the pool. Even upon entering I was excited with the sculptures and architecture that sat and wavered outside this establishment. The inside was so artsy and cool. I have never had so much beautiful eye candy to look at before. And by the candy, I mean the modern with a touch of contemporary design. Our server was sweet and extremely efficient. She wasted no time giving us what we needed.  I ordered the  BURGER AU POIVRE. It was slathered in a peppercorn sauce. My taste buds were overwhelmed and wanted at least 2  more burgers. It also came with waffle fries. To me fries are fries, so.... The bathroom there is a treat in itself. I had to excuse myself to go to the ladies room, upon entering I ran back to the table for my camera phone. There was no way that bathroom was gonna get away without an Instagram shot slash snapchat from me. I recommend this place to anyone wanting a clean, and classy environment. I'll definitely be back.  Try it...love it...Yelp it...

0-hJIcRbY8bKSDi9iklj0A.text: AZ88 is probably my favorite restaurant/bar. The food is decently priced, the martinis are literally the BEST and the atmosphere is so welcoming! The bartenders are always friendly and the wait staff is always helpful and fun! I make it a point to come in at least once a month to see if there is a new art display up! Check it out! Try the lemon drop

EQfpa4LjiLNpL3WhBZXteQ.text: This place is awesome, great atmosphere, great food and great drinks.  Their dirty martini with bleu cheese olives was outstanding, strong, but not to the point where you taste pure vodka, and very good.  Had two of them and they did the trick, I highly recommend.  All the food was great, they had a bacon wrapped water chestnut appetizer which was fabulous.  Sounds weird, I agree, never heard of such a thing, but the water chestnuts were marinated and then wrapped in bacon and they were incredible.  Wings were also good, well cooked, big, tasty.  We split a buffalo chicken sandwich and bleu cheese burger and both were excellent, waffle fries were cooked perfectly, crispy, but not overdone.    Bill was somewhat expensive, but I think it was well worth it.  Three of us for drinks (2 martinis each) appetizers and entrees was about $150.  Not too bad, I'd definitely go back, great food.

8GnQiyo8N57F706OAUxgHA.text: This place is definitely prograssive/ritzy/modern - great place for a Scottsdale native as it has a very uppity ambiance. The bartender is friendly and serves drinks hard - which is great!

TfDZMv3vw1a8psFB95o0OQ.text: I enjoyed the Burger Au Poivre II. I enjoyed the salty dog. I thought both of those dishes were worth the price I paid. I don't know about the St. Petersburg chips, though. Those were disappointingly overwhelmed with sour cream. More lox, less sour cream please. Also, the French 75 was refreshing but pretty bland. And, the fries that came with the burger were disappointingly tasteless and dry without being crispy.

AfuQer35AxPbo0Lw50WFLw.text: We returned tonight while in Scottsdale for SF Giants spring training games. Another excellent experience very similar to last year. All that I stated in my review of 3/8/15 was experienced this year.   Richard F Santa Rosa, CA

MrnAqhLqZY7ryLe8YT-Dgw.text: I've been to AZ 88 several times for drinks and the last time I came in I finally decided to try some of the food. Me and some of my girls decided to meet here on a Friday night and we planned ahead and made reservations since this place is always packed on the weekends :-). I absolutely love the vibe in this place, with it's various art pieces throughout the space and the hidden DJ at the above the dining area it always feels lively when you walk in.  Some of us arrived a little earlier so we had drinks at the bar while the rest of our party arrived; I started with one of their delicious martini's. Once everyone had their drinks we moved to our table so we could order dinner. I decided to go for one of their chicken sandwiches and our server convinced me to add avocado and cheese to it. I was pleasantly surprised when my meal came out, the chicken sandwich was delicious, and I was immediately happy I decided to go with the server's suggestion! The waffle fries were good and crispy and I loved that they also put some pieces of fruit on the plate to balance everything out. It made me feel like I was being slightly healthy :-)  There was a total of 6 of us and everyone loved their food and drinks! Our server was awesome, she was very patient and checked on us pretty regularly; and she didn't complain when we asked if our checks could be split. This place is definitely a great place to start out the night or event to bring a date or out of town visitors, I will def. be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YRYSVx8VpbVQisAC7hfI9Q.text: There's a reason it has made it 25+ years. Ambience: fun, upscale, trendy, postmodern, coastal-city ambience, very reasonably priced comfort food, and martinis the size of the KoolAid man!    Watching the servers navigate the RHOS, girls night out crowd, and lots of folks (who would be able to recognize the discordance of my wife's Stella McCarthy purse and Kors leather jacket) with filled-to-the-brim martinis is great sport on its own.   Awesome design and Panton chairs....  Wife and friends are partial to the buffalo chicken sandwich, waffle fries, and las brisas burger.  However, Friday night at 9 pm it is not the place for a month-old baby, please learn from our mistake....  baby does display an affinity for trance music now, however.

EHsKKQKkBFzNWJL_N5EhiQ.text: I had the four seasons salad and it was good but our waiter was terrible. So slow, it took 30 mins to actually place our order and at some point our waiter left for the night and someone else took over. Maybe you should notify your guests that you're leaving. Not impressed and won't look forward to coming back!

ovgkPGp7HA-JaCDb0eLzRw.text: We found this place on yelp, like we usually do, and I must say what a bizarre little joint in the afternoon. It's off the beaten path but I think it was definitely created and designed for a night time experience which would make it off the hook; but for lunch, I felt like I was at a club in the Castro. The decor was all white with chairs on one side of the table and reclining benches on the other.  The bathrooms are an absolute mystery:  There's is the men's room, women's room and coed bathroom (probably a lot of fun at night ;).  Inside the restrooms they are entirely mirrors with little lighting except for the tvs that are on.  It's almost hard to find your way out.  My husband said there was 80s porn on in his bathroom.  I digress...The food and drinks were VERY TASTY.  We started with the Hell Chips, which would be a total superbowl favorite: homemade salty chips with blue cheese and buffalo wing sauce.  I had the bartender make me a virgin gimlet which was delicious (pregnant at the time) and my husband has something that was served in a copper cup.  Excellent mixologists.  My husband also had a delicious burger and I had a generously portioned salad that I was unable to finish.  This place is definitely quirky but great service and excellent food = 5 stars in my book.  I'll have to go back at night and when I'm not pregnant.

u66jJ0nc8dVxZhD8mk9uPQ.text: I had a virgin bloody mary that was actually fantastic.. Perfect spice...  And I had the salad with the buffalo chicken, blue cheese, and sauteed celery. The sauteed celery was a brilliant touch, loved it.   Overall, I've eaten here three or four times and haven't quite developed a craving. Perfect place to bring a date or girlfriend for drinks though.

p3siwM5OnEYDk2fM9OEu3Q.text: Robbie and Bradley made for stellar hosts this evening. Grilled veggie plate is a must have and the chocolate torte is amazing.

G8QF7cZK_PFVWCipfeZukg.text: Best patio in the valley. Right on the Civic Center Plaza. Just gorgeous on a nice night.  Excellent drinks and a bonus - food is good too!  We had a totally awesome waiter named Gilbert.  Made great drink recommendations and created a fun and inviting atmosphere. I highly recommend as a great, relaxing hangout.

tgerGDeXeVUWRGUBen5Wag.text: I've been here a couple times and enjoy it for a couple of reasons...the food/menu is not mind-blowing, but basic dishes like burgers, salad, etc. Nothing too creative or fancy. However, I like the ambiance and crowd. Very hip, very Scottsdale. Good place to people watch on a warm desert evening. Desserts are good if you like big, sweet, sugary things.

DdIdWwXYXdStiyonTKkmdg.text: I can't come to Scottsdale without going to AZ 88.  The cheese burger and the waffle fries can not be beat!  If you have room (the burger is huge) order the cheese cake from the Carnegie Deli.

Q7OFXRMZ4HZGx3CB4lHZWw.text: AZ88 is the best first date restaurant in the Valley...she'll be impressed by the trendy look and feel, while you won't have to waste a bunch of money, since it's priced so well, if the she turns out to be an idiot...

0zEDpOeVZs-b96qdz3VMLA.text: It's annoying here. I've been many times, the service is always good. But the restroom doors, hideous art pieces and boring menu are not cute anymore.

2PxfA4-woySd4lDw-Zy5jQ.text: I have been three times since moving to AZ, and the last two were ot by choice.  I have yet to leave without an awful headache from the ridiculously loud music.  It is cramped and the food is no better than what you'd order in a drive thru.  The prices are outrageous and the staff is less than 'happy'.  I don't know what AZ88 the other posters have been to yielding these great reviews, but if an awful headache and overpriced drive thru food served from unhappy cramped environments interests you, then this is your place.  I will never go again, even if forced.  Turn down the music and I may consider it...avoid!

M_7cjIKGD3HfQ1G6SyjhkA.text: Upgraded to a 4 star after going back a second time (something I'm trying to do unless I have an absolutely horrible time).  Great atmosphere, great to people watch.  The staff is friendly and attentive.  The food was good to very good, but the drinks were to die for.  Excellent selection.  Nice spot to begin or end a date.  Central location in Old Town.  Definitely a fun time.

oeE4PC9RXmljRajTrCnSkQ.text: This is a great place to go either to begin the evening with friends or at the end of the night, thanks to their late hours (midnight).  The martinis are one of the best intown and the food always good.  The only thing lacking is the service... very slow and not always attentive.  Thank goodness the atmosphere and food are so good it helps to overlook the not so service.

_0gPk0nQ4jrCLvsbC3TMpw.text: Good food, wide selection of drinks, great atmosphere.

wf47Dbq_U9l4NvbtTDPfiQ.text: I feel like I am kind of redundant to post along with the other reviews, but I wanted to add my kudos to a great restaurant. For a place that is very chic and "Scottsdale" I was pleasantly surprised at the affordability of the dinner menu. They make it up in the cocktails, of course. I had the grilled vegetables, which were wonderful. You didn't even need the dipping sauce that came with it. My husband had the AZ 88 chicken sandwich. For $8.50 it came as a huge sandwich, fries, fresh fruit and a pickle. A great recommendation if you are looking for something new and fun to do.

tL2fgde4H9xCPRQNssjVwg.text: My girlfriend recommended we go to AZ88 for my birthday dinner on Sat.Dec.11th. I was a little hesitant from looking at the website at first but decided to just go with it! What a good idea that was! About 30 people ended up showing up and AZ88 was so good at adding chairs/tables to our dinner group. We started off with celebration champagne SO GOOD! I loved it I think I had 3 glasses of it. I am a vegetarian so I was happy to see the salads and the size! I ended up taking half of it home. I had the Four Seasons Salad (A wonderful salad made with the freshest of leaf lettuce,tomato, radish sprouts, avocado, black olives, mushrooms, red onion and bell peppers. Served with your choice of Bleu Cheese, Thousand Island, Ranch, Balsamic Vinaigrette, or fat-free Raspberry Vinaigrette $8.50). My boyfriend and 2 of my other friends ordered AZ88 chicken sandwich and they all loved it. I heard they are famous for their chicken sandwiches. The prices are almost shocking seeing how much food they give you/the atmosphere. I didn't get the chance to try the strawberry shortcake but I have been told it is super delicious. Definitely will be coming back on a Friday/Saturday night. Definitely a great place to go for dinner and drinks before some late night partying :)

yAUBUSJOd0l29qE_rEHZYQ.text: Came here one night for drinks and dancing and had a blast!  The music was wonderful and the people were great!  Didn't eat here though.

N5rUM8CyP1mkSAOkTsZ6dQ.text: Went to AZ 88 recently while in Scottsdale and was not disappointed.  We sat outside at lunchtime while there was music playing in the park.  I should note that anytime I can eat outdoors (I live in Chicago so this is not a usual thing) it bumps the whole experience up for me.  The decor was pretty trendy and modern.  I must say to try out the (women's) bathroom as I thought it was pretty cool.  The service was quick (once our waiter found his way to our table) and my boyfriend and I spilt one of the sandwiches (chicken, bacon, avocado) and for 2.50 (I think) we each got our own basket with fries and fresh fruit/veggies.  I would give it a higher rating but the food was only good (maybe it was our food choice) and they put mayo on the sandwich after I asked for it to be on the side.  Also they serve a soda in a small glass bottle which is one of my pet peeves.  Just give me a normal sized soda!  Overall good experience and I would definitely recommend if you are in the Old Town area.

fhtxRadw1qn2RSwlGl4Klg.text: Haven't been here for a couple years...some things never change and for AZ-88, that not a good thing.  The menu is (still) very limited.  The wait staff doesn't engage you at all...even though the place was 3/4 empty.  The wines by the glass are the stingiest pours I've ever had - anywhere!  Don't think I'll be coming back.  There are too many other places that are trying something new and different.

bIZN3igyEbbqi5emBWiKsg.text: reasonable and delicious food - favorite is the AZ 88 salad and the bacon wrapped water chestnuts.  Burgers are also delicious, and waffle fries are not to be skipped.  Martinis are expensive but worth it!  Have never found a cosmo that can match theirs. Restaurant is beautiful and they do a great job switching up the decor but keeping it simple.

czSstfuVTizDtiR-s129Eg.text: Yum! This place has delcious food with fresh and unique ingredients. The alfredo burger is great and the ice tea is super refreshing.

hVcGOGeRHSvVAPZQoSKWBg.text: Awesome modern atmosphere in a hip part of Scottsdale. I had the AZ 88 Chicken Sandwich. So delicious!! My wife loved the picnic chicken sandwich. This isn't a dressy place, but don't go looking like a scrub. Great adult night out and perfect for out of town guests.

BgmwdCpBRTU1vRVplr1Jbw.text: I will forever lement the loss of those amazing glitter dogs. Do you think they sold them? If you know what happened to them tell me cause I want one. I hated AZ88 for no aparent reason for a long time. I tend to hate things that young hip kids who live in Scottsdale enjoy, just as a rule, so I was sure I would hate this place. I totally didn't. Part of what I loved about it was those ridiculous sparkling dogs though. Seriously the food is super delicious and I always worry myself sick about what to order cause will it be as delicious as Elsa Chicken Sandwhich? Also, how much do you love waffle cut fries? Well I don't know how much you love them, but I love them a lot. And this place is a little classier than Chik-fil-a, the only other place I know that serves waffle cut fries. Even though it is in Scottsdale and hip kids like it, it isn't even retardedly overpriced. You should probably go here if you haven't yet. Those good for check boxes remind me that the Golden Gate cake thing is beyond delicious. Order it.

tkTHWOyPhlZbvt8WV-rx2Q.text: By far my top 5 places I have to eat it when I visit my homeland, Scottsdale, AZ. I love it when people complain that this place is pretentious... why because it is the only place in AZ that is consistently great and has been running since 1988 (far longer than most places ever make it in the dale), because the wait staff is extremely competent and actually looks great and groomed? Because they actually care about the design of their restaurant and support artists and have an extremely interesting and topical rotating art installations several times a year? Or because they have the best drinks in the city, THE MOSCOW MULE IN THE COPPER MUG IS AMAZING!!!!, and the best chicken sandwich and waffle fires I have ever had. Then yes it is pretentious, and I LOVE IT. This place also rocks because they have been putting up with my mom and her friends for 20 years and their silly requests. Like, saying they want their food on a plate not in a basket, they need their diet cokes in the tallest pilsner glass with extra cups of ice, five sides of buffalo blue cheese sauce, and helping them with their strategic seating requests so that they can view every patron that enters and exits..... now come on, that is some service!

W0ezej1V24QGt7fUW_7e7Q.text: I went to AZ88 a few nights ago with a friend, and I've been sitting on this review since then, letting the thoughts and feelings percolate upstairs until I could muster the initiative to actually write something down about my experience.  AZ88 serves a variety of sandwiches, burgers and salads, along with some actual entrees and a short but appetizing list of desserts. The food seems reasonably priced for the geographic location, which isn't necessarily cheap, but hell, it's Scottsdale after all. I had the Club, which probably seems rather uninspired, but it was a tasty sandwich. The chicken was just thick enough to give it some texture and the bacon lent just enough smoky flavor to the whole thing. The tomatoes weren't too slimey or waxy, which is always a plus in this country, and it came served with a decent portion of fries. It also came with a side of what could only be described as "pointless fruit." I say this because it seemed to be the most random assortment of bland discount-bin fruit, the kind of "fruit salad" one would find at a Village Inn. Thankfully this didn't really detract from the meal, it was just extra stuff, almost like an oversized garnish (garnishes being another thing I'll never understand). The place itself was nice enough. It was dinner time in Scottsdale on a Saturday night, so we were surrounded by old people and fake tits. There were a few cougar sightings (a common occurrence in Scottsdale), which warranted hushed-tone jokes and guffaws between my friend and I. I don't get the ridiculously huge mirrors that stand imposingly against the far wall, but what do expect from a fancy establishment? All-in-all an a-ok experience. The food is good, and if you stick with a sandwich (chicken or otherwise) you can easily stay within the $10 range. Just watch out for the booze (beer seemed average; cocktails were a bit more).

E3h9wvFHz-H7X_ICAbyUCw.text: Love this place!  We always go here for a great meal before a Girls Night Out and somehow all 6 of us leave happy and full!!

zaNPR1BFbosW-r4AbKbWmg.text: We had the best bartender, his name is Weston. He was fantastic, great energy and very attentive. The Bloody Mary was out of this world. 10/10 recommend

6IxfBmCJ01bGT5bOCHUlmQ.text: Amazing martinis' so full the server's have to walk at a snail's pace to get them to your table. Burgers are awesome, waffle fries are awesome, I could go on and on. Service is always good.

if_Rn7aN1yf7tXA-qcELCw.text: My au poivre burger was so soft and delicious, but I also tried a bite of the chicken sandwich that had dragon sauce and pecans in it. I really enjoyed that bite better than my burger! The drinks were super strong. I got a last word, which was like a gin martini with lime. I love the atmosphere here. The waffle cut fries weren't my favorite, but my partner really enjoyed his fries. I look forward to trying other things here.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Au poivre burger
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Last word and salty dog behind it

5_w5G5EF89nr1PuLC8NBmw.text: This place is so Scottsdale. Stars for friendly servers and a great playlist. Cocktails are large, but not my style. The Aviation tasted like sweet water, the cosmo was meh, and the old fashioned really watery. Great for people watching, but not a cocktail destination for me.

hvnmPuxu7Rb_0yQwPgaR8Q.text: Can't say enough great stuff about this place. Great location and cool atmosphere.   I've been a vegetarian for almost ten years so I've had a lot of portobello mushroom sandwiches... theirs is seriously the best I've ever had. The bread didn't get soggy and the mushroom was hearty and fulfilling.   My boyfriend had the club sandwich and waiter said the sliced boiled eggs on top was a must. He wasn't disappointed.   Great drinks as well. Love how you get the bottle of Coke and can mix how you like it.   Will be back soon.

HW0Uw93azOWvZj5_dQPH_w.text: My husband and I split a cheese burger since we had ate before going here (we met up with some friends) also shared some appetizers we had the held fire ships, and shrimp ceviche which everything was delicious. Super cute place as well definitely will be back. We went on a Saturday so it was really busy but was totally worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

DPes4S22hG3CVqsmrZ6Rkw.text: Best martinis in downtown Scottsdale.    Food is always.    Love the chicken and tuna dishes.   All the bartenders are excellant!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best martini in old Scottsdale
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bonfire chicken

4oK_5SCawC-wh5FHYcIhjA.text: Great food. But what made the evening was our waiter Brad.  He was funny, attentive and he put a smile on our faces.  A good waiter can definitely make a good meal great!   Thx Brad

Rhy2-jhNJpJD-ckCsWZgHw.text: Seems like I found a place to have an upscale burger at 11pm on any night of the week. This place, which has been open for 40 years, is right under my nose and around the corner in Old Town. It was a weeknight after a DBacks game, but there still was a good crowd manning the bar and the tables. Not every place that survives 40 years is still good, but AZ88 delivered two very upscale burgers. The meat is delivered fresh and ground in-house and as a fancy touch they cut the burger in half for you before it reaches the table. The bigger Mac (1/2 pound) clearly tasted just like the fast food version, but better of course, and included decent waffle fries, fruit and raw veggies. The mural above the bar is also quite interesting and this place also seems to be french or french related. Either way, late night has a new home for me in the dale.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bigger Mac
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burger 1
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cut in half for me

gsPyWtJj7TTnqkccpI0ReQ.text: This place is soooo cool! Love the atmosphere and they seemed to have a nice menu selection. Also appreciate that they're open late and offer food late. They had a live dj eventho it wasn't a busy Thursday night so that was nice too.   The key lime was ultra tart. The waitress warned me that it was but it was just how I like it! My husband also enjoyed his cocktail. Only got to try a dessert but I can't wait to return, try other items, and bring out of towners to show off this cool spot. It's also great that you can walk around the park before or afterwards. Very scenic and romantic  - great place for a date nt!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the food, scenery, and artwork.
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New artwork!
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken bacon avocado with side salad and veggies. Great portions!

yNQkfV2M-e6sCBrZuUI5Jw.text: This is my first and currently only review on Yelp. I am reviewing AZ88 to inform others of the terrible customer service that I experienced here and the reason why I will not return. Anyone who asks me about AZ88 hears this story to dissuade them from going.  Dinner at AZ88 began with my waiter spilling an entire martini glass all over the front of my dress.  While waiters make mistakes, ours made no attempt to help mop the drink off of my dress until we requested additional napkins. Instead, he rudely asked, "Would you like another waiter?" while still not helping to clean the mess he created.  Eating dinner completely wet is uncomfortable enough, but when we got to the check, we found that nothing had be comped. It's a shame that AZ88 has allowed its waiters to treat guests rudely and with no regard for their needs.

tCT0NQIeQn_0P5wSZeK06w.text: I was a bit disappointed with my overall dining experience based on the look and atmosphere AZ88 is trying to showcase. The restaurant gives out a fancy vibe but is a bit confusing because you don't know if you are over dressed or under dressed once you start seeing the mix of tacky decorations (ex flowers with plastic straws). The restaurant in general is beautiful with big glass windows and nice patio that overlooks the Scottsdale Arts District. We wanted to sit outside but it was full so we dined inside (seat yourself service). Staff are dressed very formal but the theme of the restaurant screams more casual/retro with disco balls as a chandelier and neon lights to be more artsy I guess. The menu was pretty basic with burgers , salads, sandwiches, and a handful of entree dishes. We ordered the dipping fries as an appetizer which is pretty much waffle fries with 3 dipping sauces. For dinner we ordered the China Lil's Chicken sandwich which came with more waffle fries and a little fruit. The sandwich came on a basket like you were at a fast food restaurant or food truck stand. Food was just average. Our server was nice but a little slow with drinks and dropping off check. Overall AZ88 compares to food you would eat at a sports bar. Although you get the retro vibes, I think this place is stuck in the 90's. Perhaps updating to a more casual/modern environment.

nkmgKl0obOa6cu9uSc5M1Q.text: Their burgers are delicious!!! The atmosphere is awesome, good music and cool artwork in the building. My wife and I will definitely come back and try their deserts!!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4V7J0EdnWfGKoV5tOxllRw.text: The atmosphere is cool and the cocktails are unique and colorful. The patio with the civic center view is also nice, especially in the early evening. Chicken wings and waffle fries are great to start with. Then Elsa's chicken  sandwiches are to die for.

iOEY3bompKSv_Bo0nyiHFg.text: We stopped here during the Arizona Food Tour and we had the ceviche and bacon wrapped water chestnuts and they are excellent! The cocktail selection was outstanding and everyone in our group lived the martinis. The decor was modern and the service was very nice!

eLFkiBv7slGnfXxGKYv6TQ.text: Nice bar setup, Tasty food, superb service  and really hard to find location.  I got the club sandwich when I opened the box I expected an ordinary turkey sandwich with bacon, but what I got is way more than than m that.  The sandwich was great!  Extra bacon, a lot if veggies ( they put cucumber in the sandwich that alone deserved a 5 ***** ). On the side I got broccoli, pickle, fries, green stuffed olives, grapes, pineapple, My advice is to add a big sign to show people where you at.

rBdRayVt6OWiSXkKsydgpA.text: Horrible restaurant! My plate of Ahi Tuna looked like the chef just dumped handfuls of veggies, tuna, bread and tasteless potato chips on my plate. The tuna tasted fishy & was tough. Once our food was delivered our server deserted us. Someone stopped by long enough to clear our plates and empty wine glasses, but crickets after that. We never saw our server again, no one asked if we wanted to refresh our drinks or if we wanted anything more. I mentioned, as our plates were being cleared, that the tuna was not good, but again, crickets. No one cared. After a very, very long wait we finally had to get up and go find someone who would give us our bill so we could pay and leave.  We could have walked out without paying and no one would have noticed.  On top of terrible food and service the place is horribly noisy.  There are too many good food establishments in town, stay away from AZ88!

sEjH21_dxd_eVK3B-n8dMw.text: We enjoyed our dinner at AZ88 so much that we came back 2 nights later. Both times we had the bonfire chicken - once with the citrus slaw and once with the grilled veggies.   Our waiter Gabe was really personable with great recommendations. We liked the vibe inside the restaurant- especially the photo of the dolls above the bar.   The sauce that came with the grilled vegetables was delicious and we used it to dip our chicken too.

vy0AJMcV97YyNOx4iAyadw.text: Are used to come here when I was in college.  The place hasn't changed all that much maybe a little bit with the art decorations but other than that it's the same wonderful place that I remember. The burgers are just as amazing as they were years ago and the drinks are fantastic and strong. It's just the right mix of atmosphere where you don't have to be overly dressed. You can get away with jeans and a cute blouse or shirt. The employees were very attentive and the bartender made a really great Mojito. Afterwards, we walked around the premises where they have water fountains, a rose garden, duck pond and places up sit. It was such a relaxing and wonderful evening!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

phA6cTWgYkxWgrIhS9ry8A.text: I came to Scottsdale Arizona as my cross country motorcycle trip destination for Arizona Bike Week. My two friends who moved out here about three years ago took me to AZ88 for my last night in town. I had two rounds of the Orange Blossom Ale and their hot wings and fries and dipping sauces. We sat outside on their patio because it was a comfortable night air. Our server was outstanding and provided steady, prompt, attentive service. Prices were very reasonable as well. If and when I return to this area, I would certainly return here for food. AZ88 is conveniently located in old town near the park so once we were finished with dinner we browsed other local bars and shops.

M6oJc-0BnU8naQcdkqBsIA.text: Awesome place to grab a business lunch.  It's tucked away in the Scottsdale Mall near Drinkwater.  In my opinion, the best place to park is the parking garage next to the mall area.  The interior has a modern design and you just feel cool dining here.  For lunch, I like to order:  Dipping Fries, $6  Cheeseburger, $10.25  They're 2 very solid choices.  The Cheeseburger is big and fills you up.  It's also very tasty.  The Dipping Fries are delish....I only get them when I'm super hungry or if someone else is willing to split it with me, otherwise I will go back to the office with a serious case of carb coma.  The service here is awesome.  If you're here on business, the servers give you space and make sure they don't interrupt too much, but at the same time ensure that you're drink glasses are kept full.  I highly recommend.  Return Factor - 90%

bdep8YSVO0hc94XUZ4rMCg.text: Great service, drinks and of course the food! I enjoyed a cocoa cocoa cocktail with the perfect blend of sweet and sour and their grilled cheese sandwich for lunch.

hCjTcQhfLgsZ8EV5y7G2ig.text: This is a great lunch spot, or an evening out with cocktails. A very modern atmosphere, full bar and a huge outdoor patio. The food is always top quality, and the prices are very reasonable. Everything from salad entrees, great appetizers, burgers and sandwiches. You can even split sandwich/burger plates with extra waffle fries for a small fee. Overlooking a downtown Scottsdale courtyard but just far enough away from the busy traffic to be really relaxing.

Va3GvjGZBer8n_xR8RM-WQ.text: This is the archetypical Scottsdale restaurant / nightspot. In fact, if you have friends from out of town and want to give them a real sense of Scottsdale nightlife, this is place to go.  Great food, great drinks, and great people watching. Sure it can get extremely crowded, its somewhat overpriced, and many of the people look like the could be on a Bravo or E reality show, but hey, that's Scottsdale.  So get a spray tan, some Botox for your forehead, Restylane for your lips, put on your designer jeans, ladies wear your Louboutins, guys wear that watch that's bigger than my car, and head out with the beautiful people to AZ 88.   It's been going strong for over 20 years, so they must be doing something right.

q_UnjeI3zul4rddTu2gzpA.text: I've been going to AZ88 since I moved to AZ in 2009 and I've never been disappointed. The food/drinks are very consistent.  The Bonfire Chicken is my personal favorite and not far behind is the AZ88 Chicken and Grilled Cheese/Bacon Sandwich.   The service has always been great and a fun atmosphere. Week nights the music is more quiet and not as busy but Friday and Saturday nights the music is turned up and the place is usually packed.

_xSzRw1RUeqyRPS2rNvVpw.text: A great place for a night on the town!  Wonderful funky-trendy atmosphere, tasty food, enormous yummy martinis (ask for a chocolate one - you won't be sorry!).    The people-watching is excellent, the patio is lovely, and even when it's crowded, it's still a really fun place to be.  I'm not huge on the lounge/club scene, but this place is a big favorite and an excellent example of its type.  The waffe fries are yummy, the grilled vegetable plate has lots of flavor and terrific dips, the smoked salmon is lovely as is the ahi tuna salad.  I've tried a bunch if items and have never gone wrong, so take your chances with confidence.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beautiful interior.
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beautiful bar, with edgy, ever-changing art hanging above.
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Restaurant opens into a swanky patio.

E4pwtRw84o30XuTRfZLbKw.text: Great atmosphere, definitely a great place to meet people in scottsdale.  The burger is one of the better burgers to try. Nice selection of cocktails as well. portions on the smaller side.   A fun trick to play is not helping someone else find the restroom. spoiler alert: the doors are part of the wall by the bar. there is a sign on the floor instead of above like you would expect, and there is no traditional handle you just push into the wall.  There is one unisex restroom on the other side that is like a disco room on the inside.

_jqWX7bFRlPT282p5uxs-g.text: If you are looking for a good martini, this is the place.   The price can't be beat, especially in Old Town and the blue cheese stuffed olives are delicious!  The food is just as good too.  Had Elsa's chicken.  It was grilled in dragon sauce, which was slightly sweet with a hint of lemongrass.  The candied pecans on it paired perfectly with the slightly sweet sauce and the chicken was so moist.  Even the waffle fries were fantastic.   Only downside is that they don't take reservations and the wait was a bit long and bar was too packed to grab a drink while we waited.

eMrUZLZRwfUXcQ_pl667Xg.text: AZ 88 (so named since it was opened in 1988) is definitely the kind of place that you can really enjoy one time and not so much the next.
