Even though my visit was great, I can see the shortcomings.  That said, this review was for a Sunday lunch when the weather was great and the outdoor patio seating was a treat.  The patio overlooks Civic Center Plaza, trees, flowers, interesting people, and no cars.  It is kept clean and the seats are comfortable!  The food was just right for the time.  My grilled cheese sandwich came with a thick slice of perfect tomato and several slices of very tasty bacon grilled inside the sandwich and a hardboiled egg - neatly sliced -- on the side.  Add waffle fries and it made a really pleasurable meal.  My wife had the picnic chicken sandwich with real slices of cold grilled chicken and lots of it, set amidst a beautiful fruit plate.  Service was perfect as well and the price is moderate, about $10 a sandwich.  So why wouldn't you enjoy AZ 88?  Our experience was based on: 1.  Sitting on the patio 2.  Beautiful weather 3.  Wanting only a simple lunch 4.  Getting there before the rush so we could get a good table -- if was full by 12:30  If you want a more substantial meal, or something fancier, AZ 88 might not live up to your expectations.  And if you eat inside, the restaurant loses most of its charm and becomes just another comfort food place.  But I can only review what I experienced, and that was five star.

a2FDhSgE7uxJg6FXpcLSeQ.text: Unfortunately the fact that this place is tucked away makes it slip my mind when I think about going out to eat. And unfortunately everything is so good and unique that I tend to over indulge and my eyes are bigger than my belly...although my belly is catching up. I kid you not we ordered about 1 of everything off the appetizer menu, and a martini. Everything was delicious, waiter was efficient, friendly & helpful.

OqSAU74SuInixrr-_XL3og.text: Forgot how great this place is. We used to go here all the time back in our glory days of the 80's. Best wings in town. We had the pepper chicken sandwich and a Flat bread app tonight. Delish. Beware the sandwich is spicy though. A Coconut Martini and Cheese Cake actually shipped in from Ny topped off the meal. The service was spectacular all around. On a side note, I forgot how funny their bathrooms are. Ha!

WfEiURkz_1lWsohPapEYEA.text: A perpetual favorite....martinis and burgers, how perfect! Besides great, simple food...add in interesting decor and interesting people and you have an ongoing hit.

78KJeG782r3sMX8_SgY9Vw.text: Meh. The location can't be beat and the TV screens are great. 5 star for the scene...but, the food is really just average. They have some good concepts for food but the taste isn't anything exciting-- 3 star for food.

wMUTfkXpXLMniQ_xtZligA.text: They serve a drink called the Celebratory Champagne. That alone is worth 5 stars to me.   This drink is a champagne cocktail that comes with colored confetti sugar poured in the top when it arrives to your table (which makes it bubble up prettily.) That alone is worth 5 stars to me.   They stayed open later on weeknights than any other bar around my hotel during my trip to AZ, allowing me to have a drink after arriving in town. That alone is worth 5 stars to me.   The staff is beyond friendly, even remembering me on just my second trip there. That alone is worth 5 stars to me.   The patio is a lovely place to sit and enjoy the outside night air. That alone is worth 5 stars to me.   The prices were more than reasonable for the cocktails we ordered. That alone is worth 5 stars to me.  I think you get the picture.

GlScv-J30NhCFVB9xaHQ-Q.text: Pretty restaurant. Modern decor with interesting statues and art scattered throughout. Seating is comfortable and they're good at accommodating large groups.  Food is extremely bland - too simple in taste for my preference. Prices are also pretty high relative to what you're getting. I had the buffalo chicken salad, which wasn't spicy and craved flavor. It was a good portion size, but I wasn't impressed. Burger was cooked a True medium, which is good, but again, too simple in flavor. Won't be back.

dJV5bmIrCEJv0EYW_pAuAQ.text: 1st time and will return. Place is kewl. Food was great as was the service. Melissa was fantastic. Wish I could have had a Martini, they looked awesome. Maybe next visit, will definitely return.

hkQpUK0zv5_IeIJsoXy02Q.text: Outstanding atmosphere. Great food and good service. The neatest bathroom I've ever seen! Highly recommend this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fine drinks!
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A view from our seat...

S3unpYoGiRx-M6CehgVyBA.text: Here for Black Friday.  Been coming here for over 10 years. Brought my 2 friends who never been but always wanted to try. Great cocktails and the deviled chips never disappoint.  We each ordered sandwiches and it was just meh. One of my friend's found a hair in hers.  Brought it to the server's attention who said she didn't see it but could replace the bun or the entire sandwich, what would she like for her to do?  Remove the sandwich from the bill is what should have been done, as well as just replace the entire sandwich, offer something else maybe?  We split the bill evenly and I was not happy we each paid for a sandwich that our friend shouldn't have been charged initially.  I was hoping for the same great food I had experienced in the past but this wasn't the case sadly.  I will return but probably just for the appetizers and drinks strictly.

Sqg_xqTNbjmVyLcZcR7i6Q.text: Please note that most of these reviews are based on ambiance, drinks, art, apetizzers and service. When I see so many reviews that equal 4 stars I expect exceptional food. Not the case here. Food is not their strong point. It is average. Going for drinks and ambiance? 4 or 5 stars. Going as a foodie or someone where food matters? Meh.

dvmrZ2cqfUzA6Ltd3Xmeeg.text: I've been coming to AZ88 since 2000 and it continues to be one of my favorite restaurants in the Valley.  The quality of the food has never disappointed nor have the always knowledgeable bartenders.    If you like salads, the 88 offers several tasty options, with my favorite being the Cobb Salad.  The blue cheese they use on their salads and in their dressing is always excellent.  For appetizers, I recommend the Gallettes or Hell Fire Chips (excellent waffle fries!)  Their burgers and chicken sandwiches are all excellent, as is the BLT.  Plus, there aren't too many places that serve a sandwich with a side of waffle fries AND fresh fruit.  A little fresh Cantaloupe and Pineapple with a sandwich really adds to a meal and sets AZ88 apart from most bar/restaurants.  If drinks are in order, AZ 88 continues to serve up the best tasting Moscow Mule and Dark and Stormy in the Valley.  They don't have draft beer, but their bar staff is too knowledgeable to not have them make an excellent martini or mixed drink for you.  The bar area is gorgeous and runs the length of the space and provides an excellent vantage point for people watching.    *Tip 1* Planning an Old Town pub crawl and need a place to line your stomach and kick the day off?  AZ88's food is excellent and inexpensive and the drinks....one Dark and Stormy will kick off your pub crawl day in a good way.  **Tip 2** The artwork above the bar changes throughout the year, but I highly recommend you check it out during the Christmas season.  ***Tip 3*** If you're new to AZ88 or have brought someone that is, send them on an adventure to find the bathroom!!!

SQeT0-XBxT_qb5dZgAMEBA.text: So accommodating!  I coordinated a retirement cocktail party for a co-worker, Dale, Paul and Tim were really easy to work with.  We were planning 27 people on the patio but it was a cold evening and we're Arizona wimps so Tim got us set up in a very nice corner, 3 tables, close together but not too close.  Waitress was very helpful, I believe it was Melissa?  Anyway, thanks for everything it worked out great.  Would recommend again and again!

6zmnGIOlKlWMitSDOnmdSA.text: I met a friend here recently for lunch and was kind of amazed after all these years how consistent AZ 88 has remained.   I remember coming here for birthday dinners & what not YEARS ago (I'm probably talking like 10ish years ago) and it pretty much seems the same then as it is now (menu, decor, taste of food, etc), and yet despite such little change it still has a "hip" feel to it.   In the past I always used to get burgers & chicken sandwiches and they were always tasty. This time I got a club with bacon & avocado on wheat bread. It was yummy! Honestly, there wasn't necessarily anything special about it, but it was just plain good! I love the waffle fries at AZ 88 & I like that they throw in a few pieces of fruit on your plate so you feel like you're getting a few bites of something healthy with your meal.   The decor at AZ 88 is really trendy. White tables & comfortable couch-like booths. The service is good and the prices are very reasonable (especially for how much food you get). I like how they allow you to split the same sandwich with someone and just pay $3 extra for a full order of extra fries & fruit.   AZ 88 is a really fun place to come to if you want to feel like you're being "fancy' without paying a lot. Now that I've rediscovered this place I'll be back again soon!

WmROGwcXxxC7oTlGnNuuFA.text: One of then worse customer service experiences of my life.  I am in this industry and don't like to complain but it was that bad.   Long story short took over 30 minutes not exaggerating to get our first drink. Took an hour for waitress to take our food order. Forgot drinks twice and brought wrong drinks. Messed up everything literally on a 4 top that we ordered.   Ordered eagle rare on the rocks told her 3 times the order. She came back 5 minutes later asking neat or on the rocks, really?  Gm or manager on duty was like her evil twin. Clueless careless and rude. After being there for an hour and half then finally getting our food and was all wrong walked up and told him how bad the experience was and he acted big didn't truly care.   At the end of the day mistakes happen but not reacting and not caring about them is just plain disrespectful. Don't like to bash places or bitch about a place I've been before a lot and loved but when things are just this bad and no one even acts like they care is very disappointing

d8mLtw4a1YiWd-Av3jZpyA.text: Really beautiful restaurant! Was so pretty inside & out, came here late at night on a Sunday, our waiter was a bit rushed but still had good very quick service. Food was so good, i got the grilled cheese & my boyfriend got the bacon&chicken club. Both were so good & came with waffle fries. Ended the night perfectly with a super rich cheesecake. For less than $45 we got 2 meals, a beer & soda, and a cheesecake! Definitely an underrated restaurant and had a cute view of the park which made the atmosphere really nice.

5mWw55E42wQyP9ILhG4evQ.text: I'm truly confused. Visiting Phoenix and was recommended to come here. Interior and decor suggested an upscale lounge spot with attention to detail. A glance at the menu tells a different story. The food is what you'd find at a dive bar - completely uninspired and poorly executed, but with upscale prices. Cocktails were watered down and poorly mixed. Food was subpar. I really am confused. The table next to us was dressed to the nines celebrating a birthday but the food they're getting is like Red Robins. So weird.

aUpgBI6chYK2t1cUzUpcHw.text: Lovely spot, took my date there and she loved it, It was a little noisy but overall great place to take friends or a date and the bonus, outside the restaurant there is a LOVE statue, A great way to take a picture. But again lovely place, awesome burgers and the bacon is on point!!!

tTY03oefFJUQpU_ERVD-Jg.text: We have come here several times. The drinks are fabulous and fancy. The food is semi casual and priced well. The club sandwich is amazing. The atmosphere is swanky and gives you a city vibe. Our server has been the same two different times, Gilbert, and he is always friendly and attentive. The patio is great as well when the weather is nice!

2cSdlM5vBwlci_T_pxaCdw.text: Food and drinks were actually good. But literally took 45 minutes to get our drinks, and over an hour for our food. Sad to see a place with such potential fall so short because of service. It feels like they just assume that their quality out ways their horrible service.

EmJVBRxhx3ha2UpMZypMnw.text: AZ88 is one of my favorite places to go. Good service and amazing atmosphere. I was there recently on a Friday night. It was busy. The drinks we ordered took a little longer than we expected to arrive. I ordered the chicken with coleslaw. The chicken was OK but I ate all of it. I didn't care for the coleslaw so I didn't eat much of it. I will definitely be going back to try other things on the menu. If the food had been better I would've given AZ88 5 stars.

4BbcYBGStk4OVq4J14vm2Q.text: 4 stars for the beautiful exterior seating area on the park. Very cool atmosphere. Sandwiches are not cheap, but very large- and for an extra 3$ for sharing you get double the sides. Drinks seemed a bit pricey here

cjFzEOfnrSHsFV82zEGzYg.text: We met another couple here on 11/4 for drinks and something to eat.  It was very busy (but to be expected on a Saturday evening).  The bartenders were very friendly and the pours were great.  The food was good, but their menu is limited and peculiar given their location (mostly sandwiches with limited entree's).  The service was excellent.  As with most Scottsdale locations, a little over priced.  Think its a good spot for a drink or two as the pours are generous and the vibe is good.

t2uTmfJQnl18BlH8pqw_rQ.text: I've been to this restaurant twice recently for happy hour.  It is a lovely restaurant located in the Scottsdale Mall.  At my first visit I ordered the Galettes.  They were crisp but without flavor.  Some kind of salsa would have helped.  My friend had the burger which she said was good.  I visited a second time with 3 of my friends and we sat again at the bar.  We ordered a fruit plate, a cheese plate,  and cerviche.  The fruit plate was very nice.  The cerviche was basically pico de gallo with tiny shrimp, no fish.  The cheese platter had grocery store variety slices of swiss, cheddar and provolone cheese.  It did not come with bread or crackers.  For $2 a plate of plain galettes  (lavosh crackers) can be purchased.  We ordered them and they were crisp and nice, but why were they not provided with the cheese platter?  Also their water tastes strongly of our Arizona minerals.  A water filter would help.  Our group respectfully asked our bartender if we could speak with the manager.  We told our bartender that we loved the atmosphere and service at the restaurant, but were disappointed with the restaurant's food.  We made it clear to our bartender that we wanted to help the restaurant improve as we would like to return.  The manager declined to come talk to us.  We will not be returning.

aVittQpfupnNpIfEHdV-WA.text: I have never heard anyone say anything negative about this place ever! In fact we went here because everyone told us how good the burgers are. It was definitely over hyped.   For our appetizer we ordered the gallettes which are basically glorified crackers with some olive and bacon bits and melted cheese. Tomatoes are also haphazardly arranged on around the crackers and then a slice of cucumber and radish in the middle. It's really odd. There were also no caramelized onions on ours either.   I ordered the burger las brisas for my entree. The burger itself tasted really yummy, but everything else was a mess. I love spicy and am no stranger to jalapeno, but these had a funny taste and were out of this world spicy. I also really didn't like that they sort of pressed the burger. It literally disintegrated. The salsa was just chunks of tomato. There was a good amount of avocado which was nice.   I was so under whelmed by the experience, it's such a beautiful restaurant and I wanted to love it. It was over priced and didn't deliver. Plus the service was slow. I really want to come back but I just don't have a reason to!

v01LIxDKsm88K_6sc5vgYQ.text: I need to come here a lot more!  Everything I have had here is great. Bartenders are nice, kinda chic, fun yet professional.  I prefer ordering any specialty cocktail here because they are different and delicious!  Burgers have to be my favorite food items- the meat is great quality. I don't think anyone could be disappointed with their food.   Love sitting outside - beautiful patio to watch the civic center action go by.   you can't go wrong coming here!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

BsGNbFwkoDD1_Y8SutPfsQ.text: Tried this place on a date night with the wife.  Had to search for a little bit too find the place but that was ok as we liked walking in the area.    The place has a really nice vibe and I liked that the front faced a court yard.  We sat outside because the weather was nice.    I had a burger au poivre which you will like if you like pepper. I put pepper on everything so I liked it.  My wife had the az88 chicken sandwich.  (I had half and like that too).   Would go back again and recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Water chestnuts wrapped in bacon.  Um. .. bacon.
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Az 88 chicken sandwich.

6oF6DQbeNBjx6hOMMBrJSw.text: Pretty average American food restaurant. Had high hopes for this place since it is owned by the same people who own Hannys. Our server was great, and that was probably the highlight of the night. He sang, (like ACTUALLY sang in a sexy voice lol) happy birthday to someone outside..The wings were good but I wish I had known they would be all drumsticks. The chicken sandwich was a little dry. Nice drink selection and people watching. Ended up being $44 for two beers, wings, and a chicken sandwich  (both came with fries and veggies). Glad we stopped in to check it out, but unfortunately it was nothing to write home about!

lkCvCs79JEmoro-HHTV2dA.text: I've been here twice and would definitely go back again. The food/drinks and service is great. Love the decor and ambience. It is a great spot for a date or going with friends. Plus the bathroom is pretty cool.

OoaoYJutmjkBF7Kh7tRd4Q.text: If it's not broke, don't fix it. I've been coming here for about 10 years, the menu has yet to change and I'm ok with that. The place can get busy; sometimes you'll find a DJ spinning and sometimes it's just the sound of people enjoying the night while someone gets lost trying to find the bathroom doors camouflaged by white walls. I've seen this place on the worst nights and the best nights and I can honestly say that they are consistently the best place to dine in Scottsdale.  The menu is simple & inexpensive. The patio are is fantastic and the service is always great.  I am always trying new places, and at the end of the day AZ88 is my go to place.   Tip- sit outside, it's located in the art district and there's such a great vibe. Also- this is a great place to bring a date or a family of all ages. The mix of guests is what makes it amazing.

rPotdSDLsT8vHB6bOnEHxA.text: We've been coming here for a couple of decades. Visually it's  pretty location with an evolving interior. I appreciate the frequent attention to change the artwork. The service is always courteous and prompt. It's surprising how they consistently find interesting waitstaff with a wonderful demeanor.  The menu is unique. I've had the chicken sandwiches pretty much every way they make it as well as the salads and the S.S.S salmon dish. I keep going back to the China Lil's Chicken, the Hot Pepper Chicken as my two favorites with the S.S.S. a close third. The bar makes a great martini. Overall, when we're in that part of town AZ88 is always on the list of places to grab a bite. Oh, parking is very convenient, with a big structure behind AZ88.

u19cSQ2pSP185WV_UCtcUw.text: Omg, having lunch here the other day was a comedy of errors.  I was in the area and since I've always loved the decor of AZ 88 I decided to stop in here for lunch.  My order was very simple.  I ordered the BLT on wheat bread, no mayo, with sliced hard boiled egg.  The order took an enormous amount of time to arrive.  No big deal, it was a beautiful day out.  The weather was perfect, I was sitting outside, there was a Native American festival going on with music so I just relaxed and enjoyed myself.  My lunch arrives on white bread with mayo.  The server deposits the sandwich on my table then leaves to wait on someone else.  I flag him down to let him know my order was wrong.  He takes the sandwich back- tick tock, tick tock, the mouse ran up the clock AND ran back down SEVERAL times.  I was starting to feel famished.  He brings the sandwich back- it is on wheat bread- but still with MAYO.  Omg, really???  He started to take the tray back and I was so famished, I told him to just take the sandwich and leave the fruit salad/ salad and pickle (otherwise, I was going to have to gnaw on his hands!!!  I was soooo hungry!!!).  He obliged my request- 3rd time was the charm- got my sandwich as ordered.  The manager was nice- came by twice and apologized . . . although he did not give me a discount or comp me the lunch . . . hmmmm.

HvRe_q8tjkV3wR_-kXv3DQ.text: This is a very special place. The holiday tree is spectacular and the patio is fun. They are  specialists but every drink is great. The menu is freshened up and everything is fantastic. The BluBurger is my favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1bnTc05nksmhytpHiN-hMA.text: My first experience here at AZ88. My girlfriend brought me here and I wanted to have a nice quiet outdoor meal with my girlfriend and her 19 year old daughter. Very nice decor and classy feel, the food was delicious. Unfortunately a large group of 8 or 10 customers insisted on being loud and using profanity  in their drunken state. Evidently it seemed management knew these people and they were obviously complicit with their actions of being too loud and rude. Will consider again but I'm sure there are many other restaurants that are classier.

o2Avu4FVsW2EiFonvSPHyA.text: We had a delicious early dinner and drinks at AZ88 last week after sort of stumbling upon the location by accident!   It is located a little bit out of the way, so there isn't a lot of foot traffic. The views from AZ88 include the Love statue and the park, as well as some neat sculptures and art installations all around the room and outside of the lounge. It is impeccably designed insight--with minimalism-meets-art gallery inspiration, and the menu has some great choices with a good amount of variety.   My husband and I enjoyed some drinks and ended up ordering some casual food--he had a club and I had an incredible grilled cheese sandwich! The service was great and the staff was very friendly. We will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheers!
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled cheese

pn4oY0E-mOVg4PCdP1033w.text: Came to AZ88 for birthday dinner in June..it has changed somewhat. Drinks were great but costly. Food has gone downhill...environment was great. We made a reservation and table was ready within 15 minutes. Love the all white scenary and the dj. Will be back but soley for amazing cocktails.

0nEe3w_Cs543X2maDt3N2w.text: Loved the drinks. The restrooms are insanely interesting and I just love the modern interior design of this bar! It liked trying to find AZ88 because it is sort of hidden in old town. They play chill music and the setting is great for like a date.

ZIOfy9JJ2spcZaf4YdjKXA.text: I love coming here! It's located in the civic center plaza which is a super cute park with fountains and gardens. There is a large patio so you can eat outside and look over the park. There's plenty of tables indoors too so if they're busy there's never a long wait time. I love the food that always tastes fresh and is served with good sized portions.

pzYb8kLGEY3kLwGBbcXl_g.text: I've been here a handful of times throughout the years and it's always consistent. Service is always great, food is good and the atmosphere is very cool. Especially around Christmas. I had the au poivre burger with a peppercorn crusted patty, bleu cheese and bacon. Very good. The other favorites were the truck garden chicken, the Cobb salad and the club. Everyone liked their food. There were a few large parties, including us, and the staff handled them all like a champ. Really a nice lunch.

dQ6niga1iS07g9PtNUwcJg.text: Loved this place! We love experiencing new restaurants but it's so hard to eat healthfully-- az88 offered a simple protein and veggies plate (we opted for ahi tuna) and it delivered!   Great atmosphere, loved the art! Great service staff, amazing cocktails!!  We Will absolutely be back, and with friends!

AnlR5jJmRXqmNMP5pMoAeg.text: We have been going to this restaurant for 25 or 30 years and the food has always been good  And it is amazing to us  But I think it could use a little updating but then I think we go back because it has that 1980s look that we've always loved We thought our server could've been a little bit more patient since that day very many people were on the patio when we were there for lunch at the first of the week  So there was no reason for her to be rushing us or anyone else but that aside that rarely happens there  We usually get better service but will go back as we like the patio and as I said we find something we like to eat and enjoy the food and we like to support local businesses and we know the same man has owned it forever

RoCFfnIF39M1qmv19XZbHA.text: This place seems to be having an identity crisis.   I dined with about 12 people for dinner. In order to fit us all at one table, they combined three or four round tables together. This was a very odd set up which required some people to sit where the tables met which gave them really no space to put their dinner plate. There were square tables in the dining area so I am still a bit confused as to why they chose our arrangement for the seating.  The decor and ambiance was pretty nice. They had a huge tree in the middle of the restaurant made up of about 4,000 dollar bills. There were also some other interesting art pieces and sculptures around, which apparently these rotate out often.  The food came in metal trays, which seemed to confuse me with the fancier ambiance. They have everything from burgers to wings to salads to well more of American bar food but a bit more sophisticated I suppose, but not really.  Overall the time was fine because of the company. The server was pretty attentive but I am not sure if I would recommend someone to check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6n_UKNkGvdMqsTiG0zD8JA.text: Went here on a late Thursday night (like 1030) and it was popping more than I thought it would be. The crowd was pretty diverse and lively yet chilled out especially for Scottsdale. The DJ was everything. I don't know who he was I think they said his name was DJ Josh but he was playing all the jams. Totally set the vibe. The drinks were great and the bartenders were friendly. What more can you ask for. Look like most folks were there on a date so I guess it's a great date spot. Pretty affordable too. For two drinks, two shots, and a hamburger we split, it was $44. That hamburger was crazy delicious as well. It was the peppercorn burger. Try it. Passed by again the next day during lunch hour as we visitored the Scottsdale art festival next door and it looked a lot more posh and bougie. More upscale snowbird like crowd and much less diverse. I'm sure food and drink would be just as good though...

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar area

SKvfrrBKCxKW9MgtvbtXOw.text: I swore I would never be this guy.  The guy that leaves a review about service but it was so bad I have to.  It still boils my blood 4 days later!  In my 32 years on this planet I have never seen a waiter this bad. We were out celebrating a birthday as a family.  Brad the sever made SEVERAL harsh comments throughout dinner.  He was also borderline combative when my fiance didn't like her cheeseburger.  We simply didn't want it but we didn't mind paying for it either.  Instead he turned it into a big deal and loudly proclaimed he'll just pay for it out his own pocket.  Then he aggressively grabbed it off the table.    I called the restaurant to make my complaint direct.  He was nice and offered gift cards but we're good.  They shouldn't have to pay for his wrongdoi  Overall, it seemed to fall on deaf ears.  I just hope the owner reads this and maybe decides to hand out a good @ss chewing.  If I were the owner I would want to know.    Regardless the food was decent but I will never go back.

OS-rCoba4RBLgWBS0OE5rA.text: The best thing about this place is Gilbert!   My far he is the best Waiter (hopefully bartender soon, even though we will miss you out here. May be you can do a special show on the patio called "Gilbert's Truth."  He knew the ingredients of every drink by measurement; and every menu item by the size they cut.  Every time he answered a question, I was like how do you know that.   He is amazing!!!!! We are from California, Los Angeles and tonight might be our last night before driving back to Los Angeles.  We loved this experience because of Gilbert.   Management if you are reading this, please promote him to bartender because that is what he want and no, he did not ask me to write this.  It's just he is so great that I feel like advocating for him.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The best thing about this place is Gilbert!

6qHLhQuvGtMb3iC2V22hrw.text: Great place to sit and enjoy the afternoon. Pleasant outdoor patio with a nice surrounding area to gaze upon. Loved that they offered a dish with roasted veggies and your choice of protein. We went with the shrimp. It was a perfect afternoon snack with two lovely cocktails!  They served up cool cocktails that were delish! We had a Flirtini and Martini with blue cheese stuff olives and they were great.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3lbVfY6Gp7PHS8h4p3Fdrg.text: Got here by recommendation.  Fresh atmosphere.  Modern menu with classic and unusual menu.  Wait staff was friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  I had the burger with handmade chips.  Burger was a little overdone.  Tasted good.  Others had the club sandwich, and a fresh salad with salmon.  Both were well prepared and all the plates were cleaned off.  Will definitely go back.  Reasonable prices.

yx_lhSMWLTaxTBVhSt6BiA.text: I've been here many times over the years.  They have a great location on the Scottsdale Mall and it's fun to see the changes they make to the decor periodically.  The food and service are usually pretty consistent.  This last visit I had their cheeseburger.  It's a decent burger and I like their waffle fries in particular as a side.  Overall it was a decent lunch experience.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beating heart over the bar

p_NqW-p7FRHzagrw5a0nAg.text: Awesome place! Great vibe, cool decor, delicious cocktails, and friendly people. Shared the AZ88 Chicken Sandwich for the $3 upgrade and it was an incredible value, not to mention finger-licking good! The huge sandwich was served with a hefty amount of waffle fries, fruit, AND veggies. Sooooo good!!!!

wAl4uEdA-1llef2cZAGhZg.text: We came on a Saturday afternoon for a late leisurely lunch. We ordered the galette - um - more like Trader Joe's flatbread! It was certainly not a galette!  Yes, the menu stated that it was crunchy but they didn't say it was dry as the Arizona desert! We expected so much more. We were going to order entrees but changed our mind after the appetizer.  The ambiance was wonderful, the chardonnay was cold and delightful, my husband loved the spicy Bloody Mary and our waiter was sweet and attentive.   Go here for the drinks but not the food!

fz6SQbjHzN-LHKWoX7NkHg.text: Great stop in old town for a patio martini or 2!  Our server this last time was great as well!!  Will be back!

9U0j4ApVVlWsB3rovn-FeA.text: We went here solely based on the yelp reviews of their wings.... and it was a great choice! We got the platter which was $40 for 20 wings, fries and veggies. Would highly recommend this restaurant based on the atmosphere, drinks and good food!

5YnwOHU30F70e9Ugg_XCFw.text: It could be 4 stars...but I live with a student budget so I can't be a fan!. I went there to have some drinks, and their list is large. My friend's Hemingway request was not able to be fulfilled, but instead they were able to prepare something else (the name is gone) that was really good. Good service, decoration is really relaxing and with this...I finally went out to a fancy Scottsdale bar!!!

VFSZYbcpCysKCKnoijC1Ew.text: I love the drinks, especially the Moscow Mule! They have good appetizers too. Two things I dislike about AZ88: Loud music and the staff is not very friendly.

_OIx40RdTPj6FoJiWsZXaA.text: i think this place is great for not a special occasion, but say, a better night than usual... it's right in downtown scottsdale, but around the center for the arts area, so you get some hipster types along with the club types. the bar has swiveling glass panels to let lots of fresh air in. it's also very loud! they have a big patio, and this place is always packed, all during the week and even on weekends. no reservations, either. there doesn't seem to be someone helping you get seated, so it' s like you have to stare down the diners and wait for them to leave and then pounce on their chairs. the food is pretty good, and way less than you'd expect for such a hip, fancy dig. the drinks are extremely expensive though, so come with some cash, especially if you like speciatly drinks.

Bsjfhex590qKawrwamn5EA.text: consistently great food and the best drinks in town since, well, 1988. awesome space, open late, diverse crowd, educated djs and ever changing art installations.   can't wait to see what the christmas tree is this year, a True holiday tradition. past favorites include the tree made of coal that glowed red inside, the one made entirely out of high heels and the one that was hung upside down and spun around.

4YkLwgAwVXgcV5SfgHt81Q.text: I liked the atmosphere there, interior is unique, all of the walls are glass all around.  It was booming last night when we were there.   it is very loud in there so if you are looking for a quite atmosphere, this is not it. They don't seem very organized with respect to having a visible hostess, getting you seated and ordering.  It took us 15 minutes before getting menus.  Once we did get acknowledged by the server, she was attentive.   We started off with the galettes w/chopped olives, bacon, carmelized onions and some parmesean cheese w/tomato slices on the plate.  It had a smoky flavor that was really good.  Think of these like a super thin cracker.  We then had the waffle fries w/three dips.  - Two words - yum - my!  The dips were fantastic.  The menu is simple, mostly hamburgers, chicken sandwiches & salads.  The menu doesn't seem to match the atmosphere.  The burger (Au Povoire) was very good.  Beef burger, bacon, red onion on a fresh bun.  It's worth going once.  They have an awesome outside patio you can sit on as well.

h-LeFKG3Bt9mTrvsjWCbdQ.text: I've been going here for years and it never gets stale. It's almost perfect; I don't know where to begin.  * It has a DJ that's not too in-your-face (look up above the doors to the bathrooms) * It's a melting pot: you see old people here and young people. Straight and gay. Uber-trendy and Brooks Brothers. Dates, friends, families. * The drinks are stiff. * The food is great. * It's as good at midnight as it is at 11 AM. * Great outdoor seating.  Seriously, what else do they need?

aXpV0tr56Qf32PMTvEdyoA.text: Best grilled cheese ever! Great music and fun atmosphere. Don't take anyone that's homophobic.

nHZXZKE_itkTdgs8bMeXzA.text: There's something ironic about AZ88. It really is a bit of a paradox. But not neatly so. On one hand, the words that other people have used to imply the vibe of the place are fair. It really is all of those things; assuming, euphuistic, grandiose, inflated, magniloquent, pompous, showy, and sometimes downright snobbish (thank you thesaurus.com). It's in Scottsdale. People dress up to go here. Coyotes are always on the prowl. That being said, they have $7.00 sandwiches, people in khaki shorts and t-shirts sitting on plastic chairs outside in the 70 degree Phoenix winters, and mediocre service (sometimes downright slow). So, I still can't quite get my head wrapped around this place. One thing I did learn is to avoid the cocktail menu unless you're an American Express Red member. One night a friend and I ordered a martini each and our bill came to $25. With tip almost $30. Thanks but no thanks. So, this place is the yin and the yang, the best of times and the worst of times, the id and the superego. I think that you almost have to go once just to decide if you love it or hate it.

FxL7wbRsCX0brZfFgRp3MQ.text: A hipster shindig- for day and night- make your meal with THE Burger au Poivre, Cobb Salad and best made cocktails around... One of the best places for brunch!

a1506HAu9LbLWOYLmz9RIw.text: Defintely agree this place is for atmosphere and alcohol. The double AA's...not so much the food. The art piece in the middle changes every few months and the bathrooms are like walking into a mirror box. Love the large Martini's top shelf liquor and atmosphere very unlike your typical Tex/Mex/AZ eatery. Recommend getting good directions--you can't see it from the road and be wary of the area--even though Arizona is touted for outdoor living the patio can get very cold at night or sometimes sweating hot in Summer-Yes even at night.

gwrGJX5SXfc1JVLfXVW5wQ.text: We have been visiting this Valley staple for years. Never have we had a problem with the service, food or drinks. Consistency has always made this place one of my favorites.

izPdCT6pROrEc9mQGwDyQw.text: Not realizing there was a line to get into the bar (honestly, I didn't see one) six of us strolled into AZ88 for after dinner cocktails. We went straight to the bar and ordered our drinks pretty quick. Then without having to ask, we were quickly ushered into a table. It was probably because we were in the way of the servers - but who cares - Five stars for fantastic service!

Vux1T0B4X1OjCgQrp3ezGQ.text: I like the food and the prices are fair but the service is AWFUL. Even the bartender takes 10 minutes to pour a shot of vodka.

P5IlBZCftH9-cnCaHpv9Mw.text: I love AZ88! The martinis are a must, they fill the glass all the way to the top, you have to sip it before you even pick it up! ALso they have three different stuffed olives, jalapeno, almond, and bleu cheese, yummy! The food is unbelievably good, the AZ88 chicken sandwich is my absolute favorite, have been copying it at home forever! The prices for food are extremely reasonable even though the drinks are pricey but hey it's Scottsdale right? The quality of ingredients, great service, dj, and other creative touches make this place a must if you are in Scottsdale. It has survived since 1988 so yes it is GOOD! Also they serve food until midnight which is a rarity in this city...

mfXhfCjxIvFGLjG_ogludw.text: We were in Scottsdale for the Giants spring training and looking for a good restaurant for lunch. Read several reviews of AZ 88 at the mall and it sounded great but a little hesitant of the 'mall' location. We were pleasantly surprised it wasn't inside a mall but found a beautiful contemporary restaurant overlooking a park setting next to the performing arts center. It was a lovely day so we choose to sit on the patio.  The prices on the menu were so reasonable I couldn't believe it.  Sandwiches and salads and burgers plus entrees ranging from $7.50 up. I had the BLT with apple smoked bacon and my spouse had the burger. The orders came with a gourmet presentation of fruit, basket weave fries and one of the best sandwiches I have ever had.  You would think you were sitting at the Four Seasons.  The waiters were very attentive and the whole experience was so wonderful we went back the next day before leaving for home.  It was also written up in Fordors travel guide so we knew it had something going for it.  This will be a regular stop for us when we return, just an amazing classy place where you can go in casual attire. Guaranteed not to disappoint. Parking tip: park in the free covered garage on the bottom floor (not the floor you enter on) near the far end and you will be very close to the walkway and the restaurant(10 yards).

LTxYYZtlO9Hu09p_ODhuTg.text: This is a super cool, super hip bar with pretty damn good food and one of the best burgers (Au Poivre II) you'll find in Phoenix. AZ88 is a bit of an enigma, what with their super cheap food items and ridiulously expensive drink menu,  but is still a cool place to meet friends and drink booze. I love the art installations that they do, and their patio is nice as well. Check this place out the next time you're out in Old Town, it's a good time

9BU6W6KTQ7Bkve1z75jRfQ.text: Fun spot for cocktails and a light meal.  Interesting scene.

zflMYlvWdLCv60F-DoknwQ.text: I've always been happy with my meals over at AZ '88. They have an interesting take on sandwiches and blend in spicy wing sauce with a few of their dishes, so that's worth atleast two stars by itself.   The decor is creative and unorthodox, but charming in the Bird Cage sort of way. It is great for lunch, and a fun spot to people watch and drink cocktails after work.

flUNqoeRMjpUWKfeSisqdQ.text: I have been going to AZ 88 since I moved to the valley back in 2001.  I loved the service, drinks, people and ambience.  Whenever I had people in town to visit I would take them here because it was just the coolest place/scene.  The last two times I have been it seemed the scene has completely diminished.  We used to go there and people watch but now it's the most un-interesting scene,  like something you might see at Applebee's.  I'm hoping it was just a bad night even though it has been this way the last 2 times I have gone. The women's restrooms were dirty as well...one stall has zero toilet paper and the other stall looked like a kid was in there playing with the toilet paper roll. Clean it up AZ 88! I want you back!

V1podibMfpcz3Q8jhda5CA.text: The food is moderately priced and good, but the drinks are outrageously Scottsdale expensive.  I'll admit that they key lime martini was very delicious.  The Hell's Fire chips and Asian shrimp were perfect, and I would definitely recommend the food.  The lighting, more like a glow than a light, was quite awesome.  Service was pretty slow but professional.  The dj was great!  No one was wearing jeans, but there was a mixed crowd of some people in their 40's and many in their late 20's or early 30's.

nXDEJcR4WxnIppSkbZSnTw.text: I really just can't get it up for this place.  It wasn't horrible, but was also nothing exciting. It is a lovely place.  I have walked past it a few times and admired its beauty.  It is clean, and crisp and bright. Really really nice.   Also small.  Not good for groups at all.    The drinks were really good too.  I'll give 'em that for sure.  Unfortunately the food just doesn't live up to the decor. I had the Oriental grilled tuna and my husband had the burger au poirve.  Both were completely boring.   The fish was grilled fine... the sides were completely lack luster... the only thing with any hint of flavor on my plate was the wasabi.  I like it hot man, but that green devil paste was (to my complete and utter shock) the hottest wasabi I have had. I kept trying to liven up the blandness of my dish with the hell fire paste, but alas it was either too little and drowned out by the soy, or the equivalent of 100 tiny Chuck Norris' round house kicking my sinuses. I could have used little red riding hood to sniff out that just right amount she is so fond of.    My husband was equally unimpressed. I just don't see a second trip in our future.

lp-H9DdANu1SLhu4Xjf9rw.text: Went here to grab dinner with my girlfriend after a movie at Camelview. I'm not always one for swanky Scottsdale places, but it turned out to be a very pleasant experience. AZ 88 is a trendy looking place in the Scottsdale Civic Center Park with patio seating right next to an immaculate lawn and enchanting promenade.  The menu is chick-heavy and full of unique takes on classic offerings. I tried the Elsa's chicken sandwich and was not disappointed with the soy-ginger dragon sauce. My girlfriend ordered the buffalo chicken salad and we split a salmon and cream cheese on potato chips appetizer. Like I said before, enjoyable experience overall and I'm definitely planning on going back to try the other offerings on the menu.

i0RmHuaW-cg_ZhKcDdUOGQ.text: Great food , excellent service . Wait staff was very courteous and engaging . I come here once in a while, with the boss as a nice treat. Chicken cabresa sandwich is delicious, and whatever you try , you won't be disappointed !!!

6WfaANPYdCUPj8cWKj-3VQ.text: We congregated here to throw a surprise birthday get-together for our friend last weekend. Not only was the staff SUPER nice and moderately attentive, but the atmosphere was absolutely perfect and the drinks were well-poured. Prices are moderate and although I didn't have anything to eat this time, my past food experiences (the burgers!!!) have always been positive.

YK26l76-2_oIat-8WI32yg.text: I've had one of the best experiences here.  We had dinner a little early, so we were able to be immediately seated. Rebecca was our server and was the best.  She was friendly and really took care of us. They had some tequila reps there and after asking if we would be interested in tasting it, Rebecca was able to flag the reps down to make sure that they came to our table. She really went above and beyond to make sure that we were happy.  As for the food, everything was delicious. I had the Hot Pepper Chicken sandwich, which was so good. I loved the waffle fries that came with it. To drink, we both had the raspberry lemon drop martini which was absolutely amazing.   I highly recommend this place. Cool artwork on the walls, good music, delicious food, and a great atmosphere.

xi-soCWIIytB9MN-ex_04w.text: I went here for lunch the other day. I ordered a BLT and received it without bacon. Like really?! I informed the waiter who brought back the sandwich 5-10 minutes later. I re-received the "BLT" with the bread torn in pieces, with old (not fresh) bacon. Very disappointed when something as simple as a BLT can go so wrong. In addition, I still had to pay the outageous $9 for the 2 bites of a poorly made sanwich. This will be my last visit.

KqLzD4elCLP2H662v3TbTg.text: The food was delicious, but about 6 hours later I became horribly ill and realized I'd gotten a bad case of food poisoning at AZ/88. I had no breakfast before that lunch, and no dinner. The most infuriating part of this was that the manager couldn't possibly have cared less. When my husband, an M.D. called to report it, she said that no one else had called in with a complaint. So, big deal...right? It's often hard to pinpoint where food poisoning originates, but this was a very clear cut case. Shame on AZ/88 for taking the report of food poisoning by a customer and an M.D. so lightly!

Va-mujTeuV5tRNxohvRlGg.text: Liked the out of ordinary location and design of the restaurant.  The bar had some good libations with good Gin drinks infused with lavender.  The bacon and dates with radish is a good appetizer.  The buffalo chips with hot sauce and blue cheese are really executed well.  Entrees were ok, more of an app and drinks place.

SNwMhyQizBzv_h2jGbx5Cw.text: What a disaster - tried to book a birthday party in July.  Heard yes from one manager - no from another.  Unable to accommodate any size party with their current management.  Probably won't be back any time soon.

57KRfvqF8g9L9l3G-MnRng.text: The servers are awesome and the drinks actually have alcohol in them. The bartenders have beards so you know they have their !!!! together. I recommend the margarita. The food is good, too. Portions are big though so think about sharing. Their music is good and becomes great once you get a drink in you.   Only possible negative I can think of is that the atmosphere tends to be inconsistent. What I mean is that AZ-88 can either be a chill and relatively quiet spot or packed to the gills and loud. Nothing they themselves can do about it but just a warning for those who expect things to be one way or the other.

wFATTc3wMaizLYBFB-Z_JQ.text: Ready for a grown-up cocktail?  Ready for the absolute best wait and bar staff?  Here it is kids.......sure, I see the reviews on the food, so what.  The appetizers are always nice...shrimp cocktail.....waffle fries........buffalo wings (btw, surprisingly delicious!)........you're really coming here to dine?   Hmmm, well ok.  We keep it old school, nothing fancy...Manhattans......Martinis......the occasional Pimm's Cup........the ice water is nice too.........never disappoints.  Joe and Steen behind the bar make our visits worth it every time...........Paul, the man behind the curtain, makes it all happen.  We've been coming here for 10+ years..........and looking forward to another 10+ more.  If you haven't tried it, you're missing out.........just save us a couple seats at the bar.  :-)

h_Cwn-DrZTmI-1-Bph4Nuw.text: I love to go to AZ88!!!  It's a feast for both the eyes and the tastebuds.  The glass around the patio and the dangling overhead canoes (?!?) get your attention as you enter thru the outdoor space.  Even the bathrooms are worth a visit!  Art is rotated frequently.  Neon hearts might sound cheesy but looked great over the long busy bar.    Last night was perfect for al fresco and the place was packed pre-concert at nearby SCPA.  The vibe was great!  The martinis are elegant and huge.  We like to share a Cobb salad and a burger with crispy waffle fries.  The menu is simple and the food tastes and looks as good as its surroundings.  So do the patrons, all looking happy to be there.  I enjoy the combo of trendy sophistication and good simple eats.

_6VReelhtNJ5SRgq8Fl5cw.text: First time eating and drinking at az88! We loved it; Evan was our server and was not only extremely educated on the menu but so friendly and down to earth! Definitely a place to check out for a nice relaxing dinner or a date

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Loved the martinis

fJH0AtG4c50-oZYis9r92g.text: Here for happy hour last night, but no happy hour price breaks. Bill was pretty high for what we ate...but hey, it's like IN THE PARK IN OLD TOWN. You can go for a carriage ride, stroll the fountains, and eat pretty good food. Someone has to pay for that location. We started with the bacon wrapped water chestnuts, touted by all. They were different, I get it, savory and sweet. It was under $10, dip them in honey (the sweet part). They make good drinks here. Moscow Mule was spot on, copper mug and all. The Portobello sandwich was delicious, wings (all drums) delicious and both cam with really fresh waffle fries. The place is trendy, spotless, full of trendy spotless people, all seemed to be having a good time. I think this would be a great date place, because of all the things mentioned previously. Red head bartender was a great help, I didn't et her name, but she should get a raise. Came here last year with a wedding party and the service was awesome as well.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wings
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wrapped water chestnuts
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dining

3gA_3vfjGcQzfRG66StAdA.text: The food here is good, the scene is better.  One of my favorite restaurants in Old Town Scottsdale to have dinner before a night out.  AZ 88 is the kind of place that makes west valleyers hate Scottsdale.  So if you love Scottsdale, you might love this place.  I like Scottsdale, so I like this place.  AZ 88 will get you started for the night and you can check out all the dudes and chicks trying to look their best.  Kinda funny really.  The burgers are good.    For what it's worth, I considered giving this place 4 stars for about a half second.

QWhj5NOOXDvJWgE5KbaQhg.text: Came here with a few coworkers  and i already love the cocktails but the service fluctuates between time to time ! I've had mediocre service here but Taylor was the best server I've had ! Not only was she honest but very personable. When I dine I look for food and service and although I haven't tried the food here the service had varied . On behalf of the Paul Martins group , I really appreciate Taylor's efforts and eagerness to provide great services and recommendations on new cocktails !

d6Gjw1ID-zX2wyEk0OrIvA.text: Sunday night dinner for 4 without a reservation and we only waited 5-10 minutes. Ended up sitting inside which was ok.  The service wasn't good, took forever to refill waters, check on us, etc. She was friendly and knowledgeable but not attentive.  I had the Truck Garden chicken sandwich with fries which was super peppery on one of the best buns I've ever had. Others in the group had the cheeseburger, the Au Pouvrie II and the Elsas Chicken sandwich and none of us left anything on our plates.  Our group shared a strawberry shortcake for dessert that was the perfect ending to the meal.

uS8GlienJwCJTsSSreKzhg.text: Positive Vibe, enjoyed appletini, flirtini, and a shrimp ceviche. Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5buDjB9MwKWOpPWWmiBDRA.text: This place never disappoints. It's the fad to be a Sam Fox groupie (and his places are great) but this is a one of a kind, constantly fresh with museum-quality art, functional modern architecture, and live DJ playing the latest house overhead in the 2nd floor mezzanine. Amazing lighting and use of hidden men's/ladies rooms, coupled with great looking people makes this place a top 5 in the Phx/Scottsdale area. (Mr. Fox is currently thinking of his next concept and this is it...although the pink ladies room in Modern Steak was kind of awesome). Food: since the Reagan admin this place has had amazing food, signature FULL-pour drinks, and great service.  Oh yeah...much better bang got your $ than anywhere comparable...but there is no place comparable.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. PS, when you order a drink, you get your flavor of distilled delectable decadence filled. with your favorite mixer on the side.
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I&#39;ve ordered the menu and I haven&#39;t been disappointed. Simple yet sophisticated. Consistent yet fresh.
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Always keeping it fresh with new custom art on a quarterly basis. Nice selection too!

yy_H0-dF3KuTsyQlJ3HYuQ.text: Once again AZ88 meets all my needs with a variety of food options..with a creative & unique drink menu and also always the best staff..The list goes on to Delaney behind the bar and Bradley out on the floor.The food is excellent but I'm going to be honest those two gentlemen I mentioned give me more reason to come into AZ88. With staff on point and the He/She bathroom lined with mirrored tiles and lights I highly suggest making an appearance sometime soon.Sit in Bradleys section forsure..He will provide you with the customer service that your parents used to talk about.High Five to the status of stars for AZ88!!!

v6GLihqSAzlTQa1FswM3kQ.text: This place was a fun surprise! We walked in with the soundtrack to Stranger things, the place has a very cool and trippy look like you walked into a contemporary museum. They were very busy so another server picked up our table, and what a delight that we got a server named Bradley! He was very energetic and eager to help out and funny as well. The food and drinks were awesome. Martini was very strong but tasty. My friend ordered a apple martini and they offered two versions to her, hers was not as strong but not too sweet either, very good. My friends enjoyed their burgers and I got the SSS smoked salmon; a good brunch choice. Good food and drinks, most of all I enjoyed the atmosphere, would go again soon!

xdqcn4TVQizcJrsBfUOkhA.text: To be honest, my disappointment is likely due to all the hype I've heard of about this place over the years. I have friends who went here when they first turned 21 many, many years ago by this point. I love Hanny's, and I hear people comparing/contrasting the two places constantly (same owners, right?) People would say, "If you like Hanny's, you'll LOVE AZ88!" I just have never visited since I am rarely in the area, and if I'm in the area, I have strategic strikes planned -- in and out as fast as possible (or I'm visiting a friend's house.) The traffic in this area is especially heinous, so I only go there when absolutely necessary.  Recently, we stopped by the Scottsdale Museum of Contemporary Art. After, we were starving, and we couldn't decide on where to eat. I also had dental work done recently, so I was feeling especially indecisive. We had walked by AZ88 on our way in after parking in the nearby garage, but we honestly didn't even realize it. The signage is quite subtle, after all. While wandering around the area and beautiful nearby park, enjoying the beautiful weather (and deciding where to fly our newly-acquired drone that wasn't in class B airspace), we finally resigned to leaving the area and seeking out food on the way to droning.   As we passed by AZ88 once more, I checked out the interesting ink-drenched statue in the patio area and noticed the small "AZ88" wording. After a few moments of processing this information, I exclaimed "OH! It's AZ88!!!" We immediately decided that this was it. This was the place we would be eating lunch. After an eternity of contemplation and deliberation, our time had come. Our stomachs were ready.  We saw the "seat yourself" sign and precariously found a place inside. The small patio area outside was full since the weather was beautiful, but inside was nearly empty. There were maybe 2-3 other tables filled in there. Once we found a spot, we sat there for quite some time. Eventually, someone came out to see us and brought us water and menus. We didn't see them for quite some time after this.   During the Great Waiting Period, someone from the kitchen came out to bring us a carafe of water as our glasses had been empty for some time. She had noticed our empty glasses from afar and wanted to make sure we were taken care of in that department. We greatly appreciated that :) Unfortunately, we waited much longer still before being able to order. We ended up sticking with water since it had taken so long to even get a drink order in. I was going to get tea or perhaps even a cocktail, but I wasn't feeling up for more than water after the wait.  We put our food order in and waited some more. They weren't THAT busy, so we were a bit confused and frustrated with all this waiting. It wasn't a ridiculous length of time compared to horrible service we've had in the past, but it was certainly unacceptable -- and nothing at all like Hanny's on a much busier day (or even late night.) We were not sure why it was so slow, but hopefully it's not always like this. It was just a late lunch. This was not a great first impression, though, so I don't think we'll be going out of our way to visit again.  On top of that, the space was somewhat interesting, though it is definitely overshadowed by places like Hanny's these days. The bathroom was interesting and beautiful, but those who had claimed I would be blown away by it (considering I love the restrooms at Hanny's) ... well, I wasn't :) I did take a selfie in there, of course! The purple LEDs and fully mirrored mozaic-style walls were quite catching! :) However, that was really the only noteworthy experience we had there. There were some other interesting features, but overall, the interior was not that unique or fascinating. We did love a few pieces of artwork here and there, though.  The food was decent, by the way. Nothing noteworthy either way. The waffle fries were tasty, at least. I don't normally eat bacon, but I did get it this time on the sandwich I ordered... but it was mesquite smoked, I believe, which I wasn't a fan of. Just personal preference there, but it was extremely smokey, which distracted from most other flavors in the sandwich. Those waffle fries, though... they were ALMOST as good as Chick-fil-A! :P

K66xYG-8Om7pSYzvrBAoIw.text: Met some friends who were visiting from Colorado here on Saturday and had a great time!  The food was DELISH, beer tasty, atmosphere on the back patio cozy, view of the grassy area beautiful and the service on point!  Thanks, AZ88!  We'll be back!

ueZibMnmqh4dQXN7Gkb7OA.text: We love the interiors and the food but this last visit was really disappointing. We brought a friend that has never been to az88 to show his some awesome dining experience on a Thursday evening/ and our friends graduation from the medical school. It took them 30 minutes to clean all the tables around us (I was trying to wave and it wasn't very busy when we sat down) and finally got someone to come to us and bring us a glass of water (108F outside;). When we got the waiter I asked him how his day was he rolled his eyes said "busy" so we smiled/ ordered 2 appetizers (amazing water chestnut appetizer we love btw) few drinks and I got the Chinese chicken dish that happened to be a thick fillet on a burger bun. The food arrived promptly and that's fantastic/ it tasted great. I asked if I may have a knife for my chicken fillet since 1. I eat with fork and knife 2.it was super thick fillet l and hard to eat differently. Our waiter told me that this restaurant Only offers butter knives. My husband and our friend told me that they don't agree with this attitude. I have dined at the AZ88 often when I had an office nearby and the bar tender always got me a steak knife when I was eating, so I knew this waiter was just not wanting to help?!? We payed right when we saw him again/ and we went to another restaurant since it happened to be a special occasion for us and we wanted to make a beautiful memory not struggle over a thick piece of meat with a butter knife. It's not a cheap place to treat your customers poorly

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Z1DxhE2lh85OoLBmEiaAwQ.text: For martinis, there is not a better place in Arizona! Whenever I am in the mood to indulge in pure vodka concoctions, this is where I go. Be careful, two martinis will knock you on your bottom though. My favorite martini is the grapefruit cosmopolitan! It's so fresh, light and the perfect balance of sweet and tart. I always go here with a girlfriend and usually we split the martinis. Who knew you could ever do this!?!  As if the martinis aren't enough reason to go, the atmosphere is constantly changing. I love going every quarter or so to see what the decor looks like. I think my favorite was the taxi cab theme, but I also really enjoyed the diamond/crystal theme. While this may sound funny, you have to check out the bathrooms. The lighting is pink and creates a fun vibe. Be careful though, too many martinis and won't be able to figure out how to open the door.  When you go here, be prepared to spend a pretty penny on the martinis, but know you won't have better ones in this state...totally worth it!

TrHXS77XGDNk10IYUg3ZfQ.text: Second time at AZ88 and still love it as much as the first time. They've got a huge drink and food menu! And the workers are all so lovely. It's right next to the parking garage and SMoCA -- the perfect way to end (or start) a date night!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hOphI3ACrUXV0p1OP7GEIA.text: One of my favs in Arizona! I come here every year  for my birthday. I tell all of my friends about this place and how amazing the drinks are and the food :) my birthday came up again and I'm coming back for sure with more people :)

P1MhvPRmGYbfdxUAS6T8gw.text: The ambiance here is great! I had some vodka drink with flavored ice cubes that was really cool! I was supervised by the menu. They had a little bit of everything! Outdoor seating is the best here!

xvXhM71kPulBO9S1vmkmXQ.text: Great Moscow mules!  Food wasn't so bad for late night snacks. The place is actually sort of hidden, but it looks very fancy and you can sit outside. The decor is very modern. Bartender was super nice and helpful. We left Old Town Tavern because it was too busy and we wanted some food. Got in and sat at the bar, ordered a moscow mule and it was good. Decided to order some food as their kitchen was still opened.   I order the chicken something and my friend ordered the chicken wings. The chicken dish was okay. It was weird because the chicken was super thin (they probably pound it down) and had this brown sauce to it. It satisfied my late night stomach growling. The chicken was a bit dry though. The grilled veggies were awesome, you can actually taste the grillness. The side of potatoes was good, hot and fresh with a side of sourcream. My friend's chicken wings were pretty good.   Not sure if the menu at night time is the same as dinner, but we would come here again for the late night food and some good moscow mules.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wings
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken dish
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alcohol

n9y16Lr6rmshcDxPPBhJxg.text: Love coming here for drinks, food and atmosphere! Delaney the bartender is incredible and always treats us right.   Recommend for any night of the week, dj is always on point as well!   LOVE the gender neutral restroom as well.   5/5

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the artwork

_kDW1NMtXD0Ch5TjYYoeIw.text: This place is amazing. The drinks are on point, the service is great. I'll be back here!

E7i2KCMSCMFvvRgz-pYklQ.text: I remember the first time I came here in high school and thought it was so tech and cutting edge!  The atmosphere has only gotten better over the decades I've been a customer!  The service is always impeccable and the food ridiculously great!  They've always been known for the buffalo chicken and the chips but my new fav is the jalapeno chicken sandwich!  LOVE LOVE!  Another must is the grilled veggies with their special sauce!  Yummy!  The cocktails don't even need a shout out because they are SO GREAT!  The first place I ever experienced a Moscow Mule 10 years ago...if you haven't been you must go!

iSSDhv-Bl0QQl0J4-MUBEQ.text: We used to love AZ88 but the service has become so subpar and just generally "tired". We went in this afternoon for a cocktail and a snack. Server never brought us menus which we believed to be because we may have ordered prior to them being delivered. However, with the place empty and full of staff just hanging around and chatting, our drinks never arrived. 15 minutes into waiting, our snacks arrived but we left due to the enormous frustration and uninterested behavior of the staff. Extremely disappointed and perhaps, the days of the old AZ88 are bygone.

S4qyvjbkz9pnNsU2XWj4QA.text: Run down shithole that is taking up prime real Estate in Old Tonw. Went to this dump and tried their $14.00 cobb salad.  What a joke. the lettuce looked like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for 6 hours. When I asked the waitress WTF she said  lettuce is bad right now. Oh really, then how does EVERY other restaurant seem to have good lettuce?  I just had a salad Buca and it looked amazing. And before you say I'm just cheap and didn't want to pay for a $14.00 salad, I dropped $435.00 at Stockyards last weekend. This place is a sea of assholes.

NHhcII9ENeVmqLpZhCNddw.text: Went here for  dinner on Wednesday night, i really liked the place. I always thought that it looked weird and kinda threw me off, but i decided to go and i didn't regret it. The cocktails were pretty good the bartender was cool and approachable so he made us feel welcomed. The food was awesome ,got a really spicy chicken sandwich with lots of pepper,And loved it. I really liked that the sides were a mixture of fries, veggies and fruit which is something I've never seen before. Overall good spot ill b back.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sundowner and 1793 cocktails

xcLKHV7ZsjCcRWG9XS4N1w.text: This is an modern decor casual bar in the cultural area.  Fantastic service and great food.  It 11 am Sunday morning and its happening  here when no one else is even open.  Large  and long Stainless Steel Bar with black cushion from a modern open dining area hangout for those with good taste.  A must stop in AZ..  Great menu , Shrimp Cocktails, Wings, Burgers and some must check out signature plates to enjoy...  Just Do it!!

iHvVIPcq9GMIgL8x101owQ.text: I have made mutiple visits here and I am glad that someone told me to check this place out. If you want just a quick burger or a nice formal dinner this place works. The prices are better than any of the tourist traps around and right in line with most franchise restaurants. I would recomend this place to anyone. Dont forget to try their homemade desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Money Tree with a Penny Star!
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nothing like having dinner next to a $4500 Christmas money tree.

bCvRvQcUXgZyMLaDPnHM4g.text: Their cocktails are amazing!!! The patio is gorgeous. The food is just ok imo but friendly service, excellent Old Town Scottsdale location, dog friendly patio - all big pluses. The wings are good, typical American food, nothing fancy but it's always a good time, good ambiance and good people watching!

Qg9GpRWf7G_Kj7OoH_JgQg.text: The drinks and food are ALWAYS on par here. This is probably my favorite place to get a Manhatten in Scottsdale.

lWxL5i58InvcB96OtUmEOw.text: "Nothing here is homemade." - AZ88 server.   Yeah she said that. The food was alright. Overpriced. The tables are too damn tiny for four people. My lemon drop was highly flammable. It is what it is. That side salad was huge though. Good portion for $5.50 tho.

EHWH5brAmSwU25VnDdweHw.text: What can I say, this place is a Scottsdale staple.  20 years and still going strong.  I do miss their old menu (circa 1990-1995), but they have enough decently priced and varied menu selections to satisfy everyone.   This is a 'see and be seen place' with an always fun and eclectic crowd (old, young, gays, straights, dressed up, dressed down) with a DJ spinning some sweet house music on the right nights.  The drinks may seem pricey, however, they certainly don't skimp on the liquor and if you're a lightweight, you'll be flat on your ass after your second cocktail. Waitstaff can be hit or miss.

egNaiGJMH0Nd1nUsPTzoCg.text: This is my all-time favorite bar/restaurant in Scottsdale.  The drinks are expensive but they pour the best martinis in town.  They're huge, and one is like 2 in some other bars.  A server once recommended a blueberry lemon drop and it's been my favorite drink ever since.    The drinks may be spendy, but the food is relatively cheap.  I love the ceviche and the picnic chicken, but I've never had a bad meal here.  You can't beat the atmosphere with the cool patio overlooking the civic plaza...especially fun late in the day during the Culinary Festival with Mr. P-Body spinning records.  The bathrooms are super-cool (strange comment, but it's True)  Once you locate the appropriate one for your gender, you feel like you've been let in on a secret!  And, one of the best things about AZ88 is that every 6 months or so they completely change the decor and add funky art installations.  The crowd seems a bit more sophisticated than other Scottsdale places that are filled with the typical posers.  It's very gay-friendly and on Friday nights the eye candy is delicious, even if they aren't paying attention to us straight girls!  You'll find all age groups here, which ends up as a nice mix, like an interesting dinner party.

_pI1dLVUCBH1eQGOW8Ky4w.text: Love this place! Mainly because it is modeled from Elsa's on the Park in Milwaukee, WI (where I'm from).  My fav: bacon wrapped water chestnuts , and any salad or sammie and any cocktail :)   A little hard to find Scottsdale unless you already know your way around but worth the search!   PS Service could always improve here ...

iqA7JcXybst894wrJ_Djpg.text: I went to AZ 88 with a friend who was craving beef.  It was a Sunday afternoon, and we were heading to a matinee film after lunch.  Service was prompt.  We decided to split a burger and waffle fries.  Our server was very attentive.  In fact, it seemed like there were severs waiting in the wings, in case.  The iced tea was delicious.  We had no complaints.  And yes, the restroom IS all that.

6sU5qWbxz9f0hHA33MXh4A.text: Upscale atmosphere with great food and very reasonable prices!  Try the Hot Pepper Chicken - it was awesome!

NgLMjHKO8bW9LZYEhxTahw.text: I almost feel bad writing a review.  I mean, yea, I've been there several times.  But my experience has been rather limited.  It's always happy hour-ish time on the way home from work.  Since, as I've mentioned in other reviews, I'm stubborn about not drinking even one drink if I'm driving, I've only had soda.  And not wanting to spoil dinner (Mom would be so proud) I haven't eaten there either.  So, I've observed alcohol.  I've observed food.  But from experience I can tell you only that their sodas are bubbly and quickly refilled.    But to most folks, as good as their burgers are, and as yummy as their fries appeared (Kid you not, I was tempted to ask a neighboring table for a fry as they looked that good.  And that is NOT my style at all.) AZ 88 isn't a place you go for the food.  It's the look.  It's the proximity to all the other action.  It's the amazing rotating art.  It's the feeling that you are somewhere fancy and exclusive when you just walked in and grabbed a seat.  And that patio doesn't hurt either.  One of the best places to people watch.    Funny side story - first time I ever heard of the place I had a completely different picture in my head.  An older couple I knew (70's) told me about this great place they loved going to for a burger.  How fun it was, and how it was so fun and relaxed, and how all the gays went there.  Between the name and their description, I thought it was some gay neighborhood burger joint filled with knickknacks like an Applebee's.  I was one step from expecting sawdust on the floor.  Shocker when I first walked in the place, let me tell ya...

pUre1BbM9h7m6T2KdLG-Bw.text: I feel like the place is insanely pretentious.  I dunno why I get that vibe, but I do.  That said, their food is pretty damn good and isn't as expensive as you might expect considering the way they present everything.    The place is interesting I guess.  It has neat bathrooms, kind of a cool looking bar, and modern seating everywhere.  Everything is very modern, and if you're into that kind of thing, then here is your spot.    Perhaps it is just too image conscious for me.  I just don't like it.

8OHH4b4vO7GIXKrc-TYn5Q.text: Our absolute favorite place in Scottsdale!  Our criteria when we bought our house was that it was bike riding distance to AZ88!  Amazing cocktails and atmosphere.. Flirtini's are amazing tasting and will kick your butt!  Just like I like it.  Bartenders make all the drinks pretty much perfect.  Service is incredible.  Shqipa, Rachel and Amir are all amazing!  One of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I've ever had.  Try it on pumperknickel.  Cobb salad w/ havarti, MMMmmmmm!  Great ceviche and hell fire chips too!  Oh, and the golden rum cake... to die for!!!

jFn972IWSbETkwoQN4Z-pw.text: I've been in a handful of times, and last night was also no disappointment. After looking for a place to have a glass of wine late, I ended up here, as 3 or 4 other places in Old Town were either closed (Napoleon's and Tapas Papas Fritas both closed at 11 PM??? Well, Napoleon's closed forever, so I heard, but won't believe...) or dead. Citizen had a multi-course private affair they were finishing up. Kazimierz had some kind of themed jazz party going and was raucous and demanded a cover charge. But good ol' cosmopolitan-cool AZ88 was next on my list, where I had a fantastic Pinot Noir (and Tempranillo), cheese plate (their kitchen stays open till 12:30 every night), and warm and friendly convo with spot-on bartender Steen. Another bartender came in later and was relating his favorite summer drinks in a bon vivant fashion. They do have a killer Moscow Mule which is served in a copper tankard to keep it cool.   I've been coming in here, on average maybe once or twice a year since around 2007, and let me say at AZ88 the good things don't change. They still have a tantalizing food menu (they are a full boar upscale restaurant), and a drink menu that, together, rival anything else, really, in Lower Scottsdale (and in much of the Valley). Not to mention the atmosphere that for me has the perfect combination of sophistication, decor, music (4 more stars for the DJ's mellow-ambient rhythms) service, and vibe that indulges all the senses wonderfully. I'm now making this place my default destination for treating myself or a date like VIPs, as they've shown what it takes to to be among the best at what they do.

r6EKHAIcqk3ehX6jQTQZKw.text: We had a business lunch there yesterday and it was packed with the Arts festival going on. The City of Scottsdale is having an arts festival this weekend and it is very cool! We went after and there were two stages, lots of booths and even a kids area!  Back to AZ88, I guess the reason you are reading this!  There was a line to get in (although we took patio seating outside and got to sit right away). The couple in front of us had a little marital "tiff" as the wife didn't want to sit outside. The temps were in the 70's and this couple was from Wisconsin, but hey their loss was our gain!   As usual the food was excellent! I had the club sandwich with bacon and chicken.  The waffle fries (my favorite by the way) were a little skimpy but I made it work, with the huge sandwich that was served!  However on this visit, the service was not that great. One person in my party (there were three of us) asked for extra dressing with her salad, when she needed it (about 15 minutes into the meal) she finally just got up and went to ask for it. Same when we wanted the check, our waitress was nowhere to be found. Took forever to get our check and then when she never came to get our payment we just went inside.  That being said, when there is not an event happening, this place has good service, funky bathrooms (and I mean FUNKY) and free wireless! When I want a quiet "working" lunch this is the place I like to go.
