OnsH_7Kp2tzwMakgb5w3UA.text: A cool bar/restaurant very near Old Town Scottsdale, this place has lots of seating indoors and out.  Great prices and a nice ambiance with music not too loud, it's a solid choice to meet friends and hang out.  Chose the Water Chestnut/Bacon appetizer, which was awesome.  For the meal, Cobb Salad was delicious and more than enough.

IRjYqtze_VsW_3dGQKpsVA.text: Finally went back to this place years later and tried a few different dishes. Everything was excellent. I would highly recommend it and would definitely come back again.  The star of the show for me was the AZ 88 chicken sandwich lose the celery and have them add jalapenos. It was amazing.  We also got the grilled vegetables with chicken. Sounds much healthier than it actually is because it came out with quite a bit of butter on it but it was OK because it was delicious.  Also some very good wines available and we enjoyed them. Great night overall.

qLPfZjJZl90rjnZt0yJu9A.text: How can anyone not give this place five stars! AZ88 is a one of a kind jewel of a find. Love going to see the new art. Awesome place for drinks and dessert. The Golden Gate cake is a must! It is really enough for two or more, remember most things are just better shared.

IgVObspjQbS17JF42P9naA.text: Had the best Dining experience with our server Gilbert tonight! He was so friendly and knowledgeable everything he recommended from drinks to food was awesome! Definitely going back and will request Gilbert again. The vibe of the restaurant is so hip and cool! Hugs from your Earth Angel!

nnVlP-KLzF6XvUxZQ2PhiA.text: Their food was good, getting their was a nightmare. Google maps took me around the block several times. Then their signage was non existant. On the back of the building the sign may have been 1 foot by 1 foot. I told the server and he said that they get that all the time. My issue is, as a business owner, if we know something is wrong, fix it! Yes, they have good reviews but I will never go back.  The restroom was cleverly hidden in a cut out wall with Men on the bottom by the floor. When you got into the restroom it was a mirrored which was weird!

dw5H1-6g8T3XYPfMm5BBZw.text: Place has definitely gone down hill from what it used to be back in the day. The cocktails were nothing special, it seemed as they kind of just let go of what they used to be known for and that was great food and drinks. I would go back because it's close to my house but only because I like the decor and patio. Service and quality of food is just ehhhh

P31EjDwnSwQY8JWurnL6Qg.text: In LOVE. The art. The ambiance. The music. The BATHROOMS! They have a gender neutral  bathroom! I can't begin to explain or describe the appreciation I have for the concept and creation behind this place. This isn't your ordinary bar. This AZ88 is the best bar I've been to. They have such GREAT buffalo wings. I'm captivated by the statues that greet you as you walk in. Their bartender is crafty and talented. The waffle fries are better than Chikfilays. You could never regret coming to this place. Especially for late night drinks and appetizers. I couldn't wait to post this review. I feel like this place is almost like a dream. The wait staff are extremely polite and informative. I definitely plan on coming here for a birthday dinner. Thank you so much for the experience AZ88!!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar art

tEAdKw2my2HVRjhf5pqQZA.text: Love this hidden gem! Great art great drinks! Be careful you get pretty plastered on the cocktails they make a stout drink! Amazing fries! No family friendly or would suggest to elderly but fun and trendy spot.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Tje8AG4LAwYem-7SrTX1tw.text: I've been coming here since the very early 90's, and I rarely ever came here for the food, I can tell ya that.  I came here dressed to the nines with good friends to have a drink, and to admire the amazing Art installations. To people watch, flirt and *be seen*, ya dig?  Maybe catch a glimpse of a celebrity in town. (This is not a fine dining experience, if that is what you are expecting, I'd recommend the Biltmore, up the road a little, baby.)  The food reminded me of a decent corporate chain akin to perhaps a Chili's or TGIFriday's. And that's cool, because AZ88 has always been one of the very few enduring staples for adventurous Scottsdale nightlifers.  Arizonans with open minds gather here to talk the latest Art, music, culture, gossip and politics. They have always showcased incredible Art here to dazzle and mesmerize the eyes.  This is a must see for anyone visiting Scottsdale for the first time.  So if you *are visiting*, get dressed in your best, and head over any night (Saturdays about 8ish were when I usually popped in) and be prepared to experience some enchanting excitement and laid back fun at this gleaming, decadent desert Oasis.( I have a thousand memories of AZ88 and not one of them bad. (Naughty, yes, *bad*, no ;)  Remember: "Hot not humid."

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crystal Dog sculptures 2008

8SDGJ-HOcEMSgMe1807DeQ.text: I had a mixed experience at AZ88. The restaurant is beautiful and the patio is comfortable. It was very busy on a Wednesday evening. The cocktails were very good. The martinis are large and a good value. The service was attentive and friendly. The food was a mixed bag. My wife's BLT was delicious, but they could not get any pink in my burger after two tries. The manager was nice enough to take it off the bill, but I didn't get to eat anything either. The burgers were way overcooked. I had to raid the fridge when I got home.

kgsRJp4QtjUu5DdS9wagPA.text: We came here after going to the park since we knew it was close but it was hard to find! When we finally found it we realized it was worth it. The drinks are good but a bit pricey, the wait staff was friendly and the place was gorgeous. This would be a great date night for someone trying to make an impression. My main complaint was they really skimped on the salmon on my dish, such a fun concept but without the flavor of the fish it was not that great.

29qjILVospSPykxtoIRI3g.text: Came in for a late lunch and split the burger with a friend. Glad I did cuz that puppy was pretty good size and I would have eaten the whole thing. I love bacon and blue cheese burgers and especially like them when I can get them medium rare, they cooked it just right. Now this burger also has a bit of a spice to it as the patty itself had peppercorns in it (most establishments use peppercorn bacon). I would most definitely come here again as they made the perfect dirty vodka martini to compliment my burger.  Great atmosphere, good food and happy tastebuds.

wftYdY9HbjEPMPkhtun4kw.text: Chic ambiance and great drink selection. Great area with great food. Had the Moscow mule.mmmm !!

kaKiF04U0wN--ICHpXeXBg.text: The atmosphere was simply amazing!! Went there for happy hour, the drinks were on point and service was nothing less than perfect! This place was very busy but Everyone was on their game

gDfcYShARkew5QFoGRXlOQ.text: Tried their Speciality and China sandwiches. It's a nice basket selection but didn't feel any cooks speciality touch. Just a lot of chicken and nicely looking potatoes. I imagined the blue cheese to actually feel the like a strong blue cheese. But I guess blue cheese is something different in states than anywhere else. So just a place to get full and nothing else. Coffee and patio enjoyable though.

-lw69vPW7mi9zh7a2xCkQg.text: This is an upscale restaurant/bar in the heart of old town and arts district. My bf and I typically like to come here earlier in the day for happy hour before the dinner/night rush as it tends to get pretty packed. I  give it 4 stars because it can get packed and hard to find a seat esp. at the bar. Also, not all bartenders seem to make the martinis the same which is a bit disappointing. It's also pricey but you definitely get 2 for the price of one with the size of drink. They fill those glasses to the brim! Worth checking out! (Picture is featuring the espresso and key lime pie martinis)

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nfcTrds1iqktp1LyJJJZ1Q.text: We were unable to make reservations and arrived around 7pm on a Sat night, as a group of 5 adults and two children,  and were given a warm welcome along with getting seated quickly. The decor is modern with windows up to the ceiling, but with what I interpreted as a disco feel. As soon as we were seated we all realized how sweltering hot it was. Our poor server arrived with a long sleeved shirt, and tie, buttoned up to to her neck, dripping sweat. We asked if the air conditoning was broken since we were seriously debating on leaving. The children were red faced and sweating, people around us were fanning themselves and did not look comfortable. Our server tried her best to explain she "wasn't quite sure why it was so warm". I ordered a salad with seared tuna added and it was pretty tasty. Our server was clearly busy, and uncomfortably hot but provided good service. In the end we decided to have her send over the manager to see what he had to say about the air and were shocked at his response. Aparently, he stated that the normal temp runs "82-85 degrees because of the windows and AC unit they have." Say what?? This is AZ!! Maybe a poorly designed building? Overall, he tried to apologize, and comped my friends bill for their children but we were just not impressed.

Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Another friends club, he approved
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Four seasons with Ahi, tasty

oFDQb-lZ96EXb77CldkeEA.text: A friend who is a local decided on AZ88 for our recent Friday night dinner.  Beautiful place with floor to ceiling windows looking out on a spacious patio, which is where we were sat.  The joint was jumping, and close to capacity at prime time but they quickly found us a table for 6, as they don't take rezzez. It's one of those trendy type places where the staff is a tad aloof, and smiles are only for special occasions. While waiting for our table we were standing off to the side of the patio sipping our drinks, when a cocktail waitress came up in my grill with a semi-aggressive "are you smoking?" With no hesitation I replied, "yeah, smokin hot." Apparently not an occasion to offer a smile, as she just walked away without comment. I later ran into her and asked her why she thought I was smoking, and she said she thought she smelled smoke, but we shared a subdued laugh and made peace. Weird.   From the restos appearance the menu was not what I expected as it's brief on entree's and heavy on sandwiches, burgers, and salads. Some of the menu descriptions are amusing and a tad over the top, so I copied my menu choice as an example;  S.S.S.  Our smoked salmon is caught in the pristine waters of Scotland, then smoked and hand-packed at the St. James smokehouse, a stone's throw from the river. We serve it open-faced with pumpernickel bread, red onion, cream cheese, cornichons, capers, fresh-sliced radish, and a little lemon. $16.00  How could I resist? Loved every pristine water fresh bite, although I probably would have preferred rye as the pumpernickel was a little overpowering. I also ordered what I thought was a one serving size salad, and it was huge, with all ingredients farm fresh. My other dining mates enjoyed their menu selections as well.  Be sure to visit the trippy restroom, see my pic. Flashback worthy!  All in all a very good time was had, and would be happy to return, especially on a similar perfect desert evening.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Trippy!

fSZ6SJQ02saR5XjdS9Wleg.text: Had an amazing birthday dinner celebration with a coworker and small group of friends. We were initially at a large table but were easily accommodated by the server when our group size changed.  The space is absolutely beautiful and inspiring artwork is displayed. The food and drinks were great but not nearly as inspiring menu choices  as the atmosphere and art was.  We lingered for while conversing after paying the bill but our server disappeared and we decided to order desert. After waiting for a while and looking around I finally went up to the bar, requested a desert menu and took it back to the table. Still no server so I went back to the bar and requested for our table.  Otherwise the evening went pretty smooth.

BdBb48TC38A4iO-MkWga-A.text: A little disappointed in what was one of my favs! The food was delicious! Really the very best martinis in town. However.. the amazing server we had literally never got our water glasses re-filled, and he didn't engage with my guests as much as he  could have. But he was super nice. Honestly the two star loss was 100% the bathrooms. What a disappointment. The mirrors were cracked, the bathrooms were dirty and tired looking. They used to be famous for classy restroom!

uODO7ljz4LydH6rJzjZRTA.text: Great place for lunch! Good vibes! Split the az88 salad and split the ahi tuna open faced "sandwich ". The salad was delicious, however, I probably would not order the ahi tuna again as the bread it sits on is not the best choice for bread to have with it!! The house chips were delicious, could use more seasoning or salt but just dipped them into the leftover ranch dressing. The ice tea was also pretty good, although I had to keep asking for a refill as the server was not really aware I needed more or even asked I wanted more to drink. Total bill was $47 with tax for two lunches and tea. After tax and tip $30 each!!!

3wxx2Dat5KBa8CZtZCARkA.text: Delicious food! We went for my birthday, and it was awesome! We all enjoyed our meals, the drinks were good & the staff was friendly. The only compliant is that it's a little tight on spacing.

NXqqUweBejR2g5x9MX9V8Q.text: Very artistic restaurant with great Martinis, great service, and great music. I will definitely be going back to try the food that was recommended by our server.

dvhx3Zl_Nhg5AsNj9X4uIw.text: I have been wanting to come here ever since I found out it was the sister restaurant to Hanny's. My best friend took me there when I first moved here and I was totally in love. I heard this place had dope art installations and a very cool ambiance. I was underwhelmed when I saw that there were round mirrors behind the bar that reminded us of some 80's Monterey beach house. However the bar tender with the long grayish  beard made up for it. He was hilarious! He checked on us often and made a mean Tito's dirty martini. I will definitely be back, hopefully a new installation will be out. I like food, I like a good cocktail and I love art.

459H2HiHZ9ymBA5BEUxfMQ.text: Ahhh this place is just confusing to me. The ambiance screams West Hollywood nightlife but the food screams late night dive bar.   We arrived around 815 on a Friday night and were told it would be a 45 minute wait. No problem, we went to the bar for cocktails. I had the English Garden and my boyfriend had a mojito. The drinks were STRONG and delicious and the bartenders were very friendly. The cocktail menu had nothing unique though. It was your typical lemon drop, cosmopolitan, margarita, etc.   We enjoyed people watching while we sipped our cocktails and 45 minutes later we were seated. The menu reads like a sports bar. We decided to split the buffalo chicken sandwich and the Asian shrimp dish. The buffalo chicken sandwich was fine, but it was served with waffle fries and cut up melon slices. It just seemed so weird to me to be eating that while the DJ is bumping overhead. The Asian shrimp dish was just not good. It was bland, overpriced and boring.   Am I missing something? I had had this restaurant bookmarked for awhile and felt a little let down. Let me know Yelpers!

jKjwQe28bOHNzv6H6llmUg.text: Had a delicious cocktail and yummy lunch here. The atmosphere was perfect out on the patio with my puppy dog and the Scottsdale art festival was happening all around which was a nice added bonus!   The cocktail was one of the best I've ever had and my vegetables and shrimp were done perfectly   Our waiter (I wish I could remember his name!) ... was super entertaining & fun as well as knowledgeable, quick & attentive. Hope he is there again next time we visit.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mixed vegetables &amp; Shrimp - delicious!!
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Summer Solstice Martini

2WUeyrucvz2xQpnaF4VHNQ.text: Can't say enough good stuff about this place. Off the Main Street, beautiful lighting, coalesced with a dim room. Drinks, food, delicious. Anti Chi-chi. Returning hopefully soon!

WUqFTbcvAMFG5yfq2bU8Bg.text: Wow this was one of the best burgers I've had in Phoenix. I could tell the ingredients were fresh and high quality. I just got the bacon cheeseburger, but it was sooo good! I also had butterscotch cake for dessert and it was amazing too. I will definitely be back to this restaurant! Now coming back to this restaurant a year later, the burger was good but not as great as I had remembered. Also the inside is way too loud, about 85 dB consistently. Not great for talking :/

cAuclewJXHHUoSmLFsiUNw.text: Business meeting. It is tucked away and if you are not familiar with the area it can be hard to find. But once there be prepared for some awesome food and excellent atmosphere and waitstaff.  I had the grilled cheese on pumpernickel. Three kinds of cheese with tomatoes and bacon. The sandwich was definitely good and comfort food and the only thing was the bacon was very well done almost black but  was still tasty. Their iced tea had plenty of flavor as well. The place is and was hopping too as the arts festival was going on right next door.

inqZZUwne9XZKMt9xzR1kg.text: I am giving this place 3 stars because the food was fantastic, the host was so nice with attention to detail and I would dine here again because of that; however, it is some of the worst wait service I have ever experienced!   We dined here on  Saturday night (9/22), eating on the front patio and were served by Celest. If you get her RUN or at least ask for another server. She would barely say anything, walked away before finishing our orders, and no follow up on how our meals/drinks were.   It was so bad that I recieved the wrong drink and after waiting 10 minutes returned it to the bar myself.   All that being said, the bacon wrapped waterchestnuts, AZ Chicken sandwich and waffle fries were on point!

UNnI9-D2-e2cqyxYQMc6dg.text: AZ88 - you're weird.   Like, the strange transplant to your drama class that you can't quite figure out. You're weird. But, I like it.   I'll admit, it took me a second visit to appreciate AZ88. At first, I disliked everything. I felt like they were trying too hard. Like they had an identity crisis. Perhaps they do, but just like your crazy Aunt Theresa that decides to take up pole dancing at 55, you accept and love them for what they are.   AZ88 is simplistic and modern. It's a giant glass window space that feels more art exhibit than restaurant. With changing installations you never know what to expect.   The cocktail menu is fabulous. On trend. On par. And perfectly priced. You can order a giant martini for the price of a 7-11 Big Gulp (well, almost).   If you happen upon a weekend evening you'll be pleased to find a live DJ. This did me and the BF in. This smooth moving DJ was able to blend classic Mo-town with Biggie gangsta rap. And with ease. As music festival junkies-we know good music and good DJ's. And whoever was spinning last weekend needs to get signed ASAP. Dude was perfection. He probably made a few babies that night too!  Food is simple. It's ironically simple. Burgers. Chicken sandwiches. You don't really visit AZ88 for the food. It's the cocktails (massive martinis!) and legendary DJ's. I could see myself hanging here until the wee hours just chilling and enjoying the sights and sounds.   It's an experience. Understand that before you visit and your expectations will change.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Turtle cheesecake
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Celebration (sprinkles + champs)

JUOLsnmi9spJwIkThjJ_rw.text: Hello AZ88, my old friend.  It's been 15 years since I worked right next door and dined with you frequently, but you greeted me today like I've never left.  Dale still recognizes and welcomes me by name.  And gosh, you truly have the best chicken club sandwich in the entire world.   Don't ever change.  You're my favorite Scottsdale restaurant.  Sheer perfection for high quality comfort food.  I'll be back soon!

8puTo9QUXfniJFg07fvlTQ.text: If I was hungry for a burger and walked by this restaurant, I would have kept walking because it's pretty fancy looking place.  It's very retro-chic with it's big glass doors, and white bar/walls/tables/chairs...it felt like I was in the future.    With that being said, I thought their food would follow the motif.  The majority of it was simple...burgers, chicken sandwiches, and salads.  My group got some starters and I loved the bacon wrapped water chestnuts.  I knew they would be better with bacon!  Others got wings, and potato chips with hot sauce drizzled on it.  I got the Bigger Mac, which has the same ingredients of a McDonald's Big Mac, but way better. The burger came with waffle fries...score!    So it was overall a good experience, I just feel like I would eat this food at a sports bar or a pub & grille, not at a futuristic robot chamber.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burger with waffle fries
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped... something

lJQg5bavCsBXeuGiI2Pcfg.text: High design. Low cuisine. And I'm okay with that.  I don't think I've ever seen a fancier spot to get burgers, wings, and fries. And if that's what you're into, I think you can learn from my group's not-so-great experience and have a solid meal.   Burgers. Specifically, their specialty burgers. I had the au poivre burger, because I thought the addition of blue cheese and bacon in the au poivre  II might be gilding the lily. But I think this place is all about gilding the lily, so don't be afraid to go for the gusto.  The waiter was very clear about the kitchen's definitions of rare, medium rare, and medium. I ordered the one with the warm red center, not the pink red center, and certainly not the one that was half pink and half brown.   What's interesting about this place is that they slice the burgers in the kitchen, and despite being able to clearly see the au poivre burger was brown all the way though, someone still decided to send it out to me at the table.   When I made a comment, they were very apologetic, and speedy about bringing me a replacement. Still, I hate sending back food.   Let's focus on the positive.  The Hell's Fire Chips were delicious. I loved that they came with extra hot sauce on the side.   The Water Chestnuts wrapped in Nueske's bacon are fab.  The local beer list has a lot of good choices, and it's fun to try the regional brews when in a new town. Two blonde ales on the menu? Loved that. Blonde ale and burgers is my jam.  I was also a fan of the buffalo-blue cheese dip that came with the fries, and they were kind enough to bring me an additional side of it.  Other learnings?  Stick to beer instead of their oversized martinis. Large martinis get warm,  unless you drink them quickly. And if you drink these quickly, you'll end up on the floor.   The menu says to eat dessert first. Maybe we should have listened. The key lime tart sounded fantastic.  Stay away from the bonfire chicken. It came highly recommended, but it wasn't anything special.  After looking at some of the other pics on Yelp, I kind of regret not ordering the grilled vegetables with jumbo shrimp.  Find a friend who has the same taste in burgers and split one. Then you may have room to share an app and split a dessert. Serving sizes are large.   It actually seems like everything in AZ is large. Except for the people. The people look really fit. It also seems like they spend a lot of time in cars, so I have no idea how they do it. Maybe it's the heat?

1plyiyixCczhpAr08GeePw.text: Great place to grab food and drinks with a nice vibe! I'm very familiar with the Milwaukee location - Elsa's and I think this one is better.   The dipping fries are my favorite since I don't eat turkey, chicken or beef.   Great music and nice staff! Check it out if you get a chance.

FQnT6yQiPolHTWGlWWeIyw.text: I love this place! I have been coming here for ages. My favorites: Elsa's Chicken sandwich, any of their burgers, dragon chicken wings, china's little chicken sandwich, and the hot pepper chicken sandwich. The atmosphere is always fun and the art they display is very abstract but totally cool!

FhgAHo-8--equM8w5UZ41Q.text: Came here with some friends for food and drinks. Awesome experience. Joe at the bar was amazing! Very friendly and attentive. All our drinks were done right.   Food was good. We had a burger, some wings and waffle fries. Next time, I will have to try their cobb salad or grilled cheese sandwich. I was sharing with the bf and he's a burgers and wings type of guy.   The decor is interesting. Mirrors everywhere. Kind of New Yorkish. I never been to NY but I imagined this is how their lounges would be. lol. The bathroom was very interesting. My friend who frequents this place say they change the theme every few months to keep it interesting. I would say at the moment it looks very gay friendly. Especially with "Don't Ask What? Don't Tell What?" on the wall at the bar.   Location is slightly hidden. A little hard to find. Might get lost without some guidance. My friend had to come get us at the parking lot. lol.

slsbSkVMaBpYDY2Xt48W1w.text: Very cool environment. I was expecting it to be a bigger restaurant. The table style was kind of weird and it felt like everyone was all squeezing together. The bathrooms were covert and hidden. The selection of beer was decent and they had a very good variety at the bar. The food was very good. I got the cheeseburger and it was cooked very good. If this place was not so far away I would go more often

in5jbeJhz1By7WdJ0q8nUg.text: So I went to this place and I did like the vibe. Nice open space with tall windows. I got a sandwich and a beer. Food was pretty good. We sat at the bar and the bar tender was attentive and friendly(to be fair, the place was almost empty). My problem is this. My date orders a blueberry vodka and lemonade, but the bartender suggest a different drink which was blueberry vodka, lemonade, sour and some other liquor. Get the bill, $14 for this magical concoction. Are you freaking kidding me?! It's 5pm and we're the only people there and you suggest a different drink and charge me $14. Where the hell are we NYC?! What a joke. Dude, total Dbag move. Worst part is, I tipped him well because he was a nice guy, but in retrospect, I got bent over. Oh well, enjoy it cause im not coming back!

pknAMJCNg3T7YOiAxg9EFg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix/Scottsdale by far.  I have been dining at AZ88 at least once every couple months since 2001.  The thing that impresses me most is the consistency of the food.  I usually order one of a my usual sandwiches (Picnic Chicken or BLT) and every time it is delicious.  And the waffle fries are probably the best fries I've had anywhere.  They are literally to die for.  Service is always pretty good, invariably some nights when they're busy it can be slower than other nights, but overall I've never once had bad service.  There's a DJ up in the rafters and they rotate an always-interesting art display through the place every few months.  AZ88 has a great vibe and atmosphere.  It feels like it should be in Miami instead of Scottsdale, and the crowd is usually more trendy and upscale than the douchebaggery spotted elsewhere in Scottsdale.  I feel like I'm on a mini-vacation when I'm dining there. I've tried several items from the menu over the years and everything has been excellent. Drinks are the strongest in town by far.  My girl usually gets one of the martinis, which are super strong and HUGE.  I keep it simple with a mixed drink (vodka/sprite or Captain/diet) and they bring a glass full of ice and liquor and a separate small can or mini-bottle of sprite or Coke.   AZ88 will continue to be my go-to restaurant anytime friends are in town or we want to just have a relaxing enjoyable "night on the town" that is guaranteed to start off right with a great dinner.

ouPX93MzPMPBZCaS7NVGzg.text: I always said that my last meal on earth would consist of the AZ88 Chicken Sandwich and a dirty martini.  That was until I went there again the other night after a couple year hiatus.  The magic, was gone.  I was so disappointed and sad that it wasn't as memorable as I previously remember.  I will go back and try something else because I didn't have a bad experience and never have.  I recently sat at the bar and had 2 different bartenders.  Both were great and entertaining.  And, it doesn't help that they poured a strong and delicious drink.  Get a martini!!

gXKPbqDWx3xsxxlnPnYaeQ.text: I have to say, many, many years ago, I stopped at this place for dinner. I do not remember what I dine but I do remember I was not impressed. I happened to be there for lunch last week, this time with my family. Guys, did this place improve over the years, indeed!  I first noticed the menu is more on the affordable side (I do remember this place to be really expensive in the past]. Second, the  size of the portions are bigger than I remember, so you do not have to order something extra to complement your meal. And last but not least, do not miss the club sandwich. They make several variants of it and I tried at least 2. Both were fantastic. Definitively a "must go place" in Scottsdale.

BeF1RuKObsRspS3dEdGN2g.text: Just got in from an evening out, which included drinks & dinner at AZ 88. Went out with two of my boys and after deciding that it was not in the stars to drive out to DTPHX to try out Fez, I yelped some Scottsdale options and settled on AZ 88. After walking in and seating ourselves, we quickly noted a resemblance to Hanny's...a good resemblance. Plenty of (comfy) seating, mood lighting, glass and mirrors, and chill music. We sat ourselves (as noted) by the modern Christmas tree and our server came by shortly with menus.  In terms of service, our server was attentive and showed up when needed and not much more, which we didn't mind since we were in no rush and were enjoying our time there.   We started off with the galletes which, while I am not a fan of olives, I really liked. I feel like flat bread is the new "thing", and theirs is pretty good. I had the New Presbyterian to drink and L had the Bellini, both of which were yum. It took us a while to decide on our entrees, but I got the chicken & bacon club sandwich, L had the ahi tuna sandwich, and O. had the hot pepper chicken sandwich, all of which we we really liked. The fries were BOMB and I wish that more had come with my sammy :( I also liked that all sandwiches come with fruit which was also good. The sandwich was goooood, not extraordinary but above average. It was a little dry for my liking so I asked for a side of ranch which made a world of difference.   To finish it all of the three of us shared the strawberry shortcake and the super-chocolate-mousse-cake-thing. The crowd was really chill, it wasn't very packed but it was a Monday night. I can imagine how beautiful the area is in the daytime and the patio is really nice as well. For the price, it's somewhere I'd definitely come again.

gVqcgrz7P3vfXjPkGl5POw.text: AZ 88 is a Posh place to eat. We sat at the terrace, and I had the Strawberry Short cake, while my friend had the grilled cheese sandwich. The Sandwich wasn't all that, although, the cake turned some heads as it was placed on my table, btw, two neighboring tables copied my choice -yup it looked that good- oh Its delicious, too, and the strawberries, whipped cream, scoop of ice cream drenched in strawberry sauce made the cake- eating- experience  all too good for Yelping words.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry short cake

jLJiRkNiKAAokhKCMiNv1g.text: Came for dinner Saturday night and it was packed! Pretty people partying and eating the night away. This is a great starting point to begin a long night. We ended grabbing a late dinner here and yes the waffle fries are good!

Ya7UBZgF5smOn3Bv-qAG8w.text: My water glass never reached empty and that is always a sign to good and attentive wait staff.  I was actually really impressed.  Everyone was super friendly and ready and willing to help (even when I called for directions...)    I got the S.S.S. Which is a smoked salmon sandwich on pumpernickel bread.  It took awhile for it to come out and I noticed the bread felt a little crusty on top, like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for the past 30 minutes and it was on the verge of going stale.    We also ordered the House-made Chips with Blue Cheese.  Pass on these, they weren't good...  They were bad, really bad.  Not even the men at the table found them appetizing.  It seems the real winner is the grilled cheese, in fact my friend ranked it in the top 5 grilled cheese sandwiches of all time.  He just so happens to be a Grilled Cheese Connoisseur.

QAHe2JtyFIwgoY-62O3yiQ.text: I agree that the decor makes you feel like you're not in Arizona.  It made me feel like I was in New York.  In 1988.  The only thing missing were some Keith Haring posters.    It's got a kind of (dated) too-cool-for-it's-own-good vibe that tends to make me hostile.  The $14 martinis (!) didn't decrease my antipathy, nor did the tiniest four-top that I've ever seen, or at least been expected to dine at.   The waiter literally had to remove everything from our table so four dinner plates would fit.  However, the food was much better than I expected.  I ordered the grilled cheese sandwich as several people here have suggested and it was excellent.  My wife had a salad that was delicious and plentiful.  Service was friendly and charming, if a bit inept.    Bottom line, nice spot with good people watching (and the only restaurant on the Scottsdale Mall that had any customers at all on the night we were there).  Cheap food and extremely expensive drinks.

wIHRi-HmWMs6EQRIV5XeIQ.text: Great burgers and more...AZ88 has the BEST burgers around. Cooked perfectly using fresh ground beef. Their AZ88 chicken sandwich with their spicy celery sauce is also excellent. A full menu is also offered, including great salads and a lighter fare. Their waffle-fries are the best. They also offer a full bar in a trendy, fun atmosphere. Great place for casual dining, or just cocktails. We have enjoyed this restaurant for many years and it never disappoints...

C4dYzlUrX0QfT2l1tl15UQ.text: A great spot to eat, drink and potentially meet someone.  It is a bit trendy...but that's OK (as long as that's what you're looking for).  I ate at the bar and the bartender was awesome...as was the food.

7yPViFXeJORLqj-W-kmubA.text: I have to say I was a little disappointed.  Okay, I don't have to say it, but I will say it.  Had lunch here a few weeks ago when it had finally stopped raining.  Everyone seemed to be on the patio, so that's where I felt we should be to get the most out of the A Z88 experience.  The beautiful people crowd must have still been primping or sleeping, because they were nowhere to be seen.  That's fine.  I find I look much better sitting next to an ugly person anyway.  I went with the portobello mushroom sandwich, with onion, tomato, and crispy fried potatoes.  The tomatoes weren't quite ripe, and the potatoes just tasted like an over-browned potato chip.  Does anyone remember Laura Scudders crappy chips?  Kinda like that.  The waffle fries, however, were fantastic.  Usually, I'm not a fan of the waffle fry as they are usually undercooked or overcooked.  But these were just right.  I had no complaints about service, and the restaurant is nice.  I just thought the food should have been better.  I wouldn't mind giving it another shot and ordering something different though.

OCNpZ6WS4MVL3_j91KcblQ.text: Rad.  This place is simply great.  I have been there both for just the bar scene and separately for just the dining experience (It was post 21st birthday and I wan't about to get a martini, although they are superb).  Out to dinner with the family was great. Everyone loved their entrees and we all tried something different.  Getting 4 out of 4 customers at a table pleased is a feat (especially with my family).  Hands down the BURGER AU POIVRE II (with bacon and bleu cheese) is to die for. Don't even need to look at the rest of the menu.  Waffle fries and the assortment of dipping sauces is also a necessary side.    My 'drinking' experience at AZ88 is even better than my already fantastic dining experience.  Order a Manhattan and order it from Kyle.  He made is perfectly and kept filling up my glass with its remants in the shaker as I sipped it.  How great is that?!?! I also asked for an extra cherry (as always) and he gave me a WHOLE CUP OF CHERRIES.  Again, How great is that?!?! And it gets even greater.... so we all took a fancy to Kyle and asked him to create us a cocktail.  Shockingly (I know) it was great and as he listed off its constituents I was estatic to learn that he had included  ST. GERMAIN in his creation.  Ladies and gentleman, St. Germain is my FAVORIE liqueur and is used in but few cocktails.    *Sidenote - AZ88 is a supposed gay bar at night ... however on this particular Saturday it didn't seem at all like BS West and was fairly quiet... great place to actually have a conversation.  This specific Saturday might be the exception to its usual crowd and volume... I'll go back to confirm or disprove this another weekend.  :)

Kz3TNG1bUGtWN-THQUPEqw.text: I love going to AZ88 to hang out, have a cocktail, and people watch.  AZ88 is tres chic with changing art displays and live dj. I especially enjoy sitting on the patio decked out with modern white furniture overlooking SMOCA.   Food and drinks are good too. Their menu consists of salads, burgers, sandwiches. The dishes are about $8 - $10 and the servings are pretty large. The cocktails are great but pricey...completely worth it! Try their martini or mojito.

PNo1-znWGKYwiCjm9cfD7g.text: This place is so hip. The atmosphere is very cool. Neveau and fun.  It's like a high end martini bar with upscale bar food at reasonable prices. The Buffalo chicken sandwich and Hell Fire Fries are my personal favorite. The wings are also really good.  The martini's are also great and I have tried many of them. It's not easy to get into this place on weekend evenings or art walk nights. The service is decent. Mostly dependent upon who serves you. I would highly recommend this place.

ilPCxDJlNsBQcNjESutZ4w.text: After reading the rave reviews on Yelp, I was very excited to host my friend's small birthday dinner at AZ 88. Tucked in a back corridor on Scottsdale Mall Rd, our Iphone navigation took us to a parking lot a bit north of the restaurant, so we called to get directions. The host didn't know how to guide us, so she put us on hold and then apparently forgot about us. Meanwhile, we find the place on our own, no big deal, and the host is quick to put a table together for us.   Our server seemed to be in a rush the entire time, even though the place was nearly empty. We ended up placing all of our orders separately because she'd leave before everyone had a chance to order. Very odd.   I ordered a specialty drink not on the menu and it came out wonderfully; everyone was very happy with their drinks. However, I found everything to be way too overpriced. Here we are paying $12 for martinis and we get burgers in a basket with waffle fries. Just doesn't really seem to go together, which is also True for the music and artwork. Everything seems to be overdone, overpriced, yet lacking any sense of cohesion.

ae5clFPIA81-PRQguX3Sjw.text: AZ88 defies categorization.   Location? Total suck. Tucked away behind an obnoxious parking garage in the middle of *shudder* Old Town Scottsdale. Completely and totally inconvenient for Phoenicians who don't want to drive half an hour home sloshed. I know, I'm such a party pooper. Watching the other sloshed drivers run their SUVs with rooftop cargo carriers into the supporting beams is pretty amusing, though. They were Canadian, eh.  Ambiance? Schizophrenic, much like the patrons. Lots of mirrors and sleek lines, but not IKEA modern... try Miami Vice modern. Seating is generally tight and uncomfortable, and it's loud as hell. The bathrooms certainly are infamous, being all unlabeled with semitransparent doors and shit. The individual stalls are completely lined with mirrors so you can admire yourself doing your business from all angles. However, either I've lost ten pounds without realizing it or those mirrors are slimming and elongating, like those circus ones. I'd like one at home, please.  Patrons? Well, I swear to you that every single time I've gone to AZ88, there has been a bachelorette party, resplendent with plastic tiaras and squealing girls in slutty Forever 21 dresses tipsy on champagne.  Next to them, though, is a couple in their 60s who practically have $100 bills oozing from their pores. Endless examples of plastic surgery, good and bad. Gay boys in tight jeans and spray tans with huge martinis, checking their iPhones. College kids. Cougars. Children. Really. It's like an endless parade of absurdity.   Drinks? Now we're talking. You'd think a place this cheesy would have lame watered down foo foo drinks. Au contraire! The drink menu is pages long and chock full of old favorites. Rusty Nail! Brandy Alexander! Bring! It! On! The beer list is manageable but contains obscure favorites such as Chimay (in practically gallon size bottles).  Food? Vegetarians, rejoice. AZ88 has a delicious roasted vegetable plate that is big enough to provide three more meals. If you're feeling a little lacto-ovo, go for the grilled cheese (minus the bacon), stuffed full with thick slices of tomato. Really, it's just an excuse to get my paws on those scrumptious, much-ballyhooed waffle fries. The burgers look incredible and both my dad and SO (two of the pickiest, whiniest people on the planet) love them. The desserts are amazing too. I swear their hot fudge is laced with a hint of cherry. Killer.  Service? Pretty damn good, given the circumstances. Our server even scared up some BBQ for my fries, even after telling me they didn't have any. Pretty cool.  So really? Good drinks, excellent people watching, and goddamn waffle fries? No contest. Now, if we could just relocate a little closer...

-QQDaOe7ai63DE85VWZ0Xg.text: We went here for dinner and it was fine, if not anything special. I had a spinach salad and my companion had a bacon cheeseburger. Both were tasty, but nothing that will make this a place we'll remember or be rushing to return to. The atmosphere is definitely geared towards a younger, hipster crowd. There's a gigantic doll mural over the bar that is as creepy as it's supposed to be.  I do recommend the espresso martini; it was delicious.

mKwOHj2RqAY6FUCNArbkDw.text: GLACIAL SERVICE. PLAN AT LEAST 3 HOURS FOR DINNER. 20% SERVICE CHANGE SNUCK ON TO BILL.   It's like it never escaped the late 90s. I'm not sure what the big deal is. I got the signature "AZ 88 Chicken Salad" and it was... weird. Chicken was good (like a hot chicken wing) sitting in top of a bitter green salad drowning in blue cheese dressing (with mushrooms for some reason). GOOD THING I WAS HUBGRY AFTER WAITING 50 MINUTES FOR A SALAD TO ARRIVE.   The real crime was the glacial service. We counted ANOTHER FULL HOUR BETWEEN ASKING FOR THE BILL AND FINALLY SIGNING THE RECEIPT.   Holy hell. It's as if they have never heard of splitting a check before. Brought out a single bill for 8 people (why would we be paying together?) and after spending 10 minutes interviewing us on what we ordered (shouldn't they know!?) she proceeded to bring back several totally incorrect and screwed up checks. We finally told her "we'll just pay these as is and figure it out among ourselves!" because we were so desperate to leave as hour 3 in our seats we're rolling around. IT TOOK FOREVER. EVERYONE WAS YAWNING AND ITCHING TO LEAVE.   No kidding, there were seemingly-eternal 15 minute gaps (where the server was doing God-knowswhat)between every single step in the bill paying process. INSANE. IT TOOK AN HOUR.   Then, to add insult to injury, I luckily noticed the TWENTY PERCENT SERVICE CHARGE added to our checks without any notice, while still adding a "Tip" line which I had to tell my friends "don't tip! They added it already!". Very dishonest.

Hi0wgTaAyThcPu4nIg99PQ.text: Best burgers ever! Awesome people watching!! I love this place and cannot wait to return.

tSsZJR6OzFHQu1kvvAEHzw.text: While cocktails are great I'd never recommend eating here the food was beyond sub standard

VtKjJPC65vCxHUI-n408eA.text: Central location to explore other restaurants and bars in the area. Great cocktails and food selection. Nice atmosphere.

xdroAj6veq3CsHFWHjzMvQ.text: Wow what an amazing place. First time in and my bartender Andy nailed it. Never had to ask for a drink and he directed me to The best burger I've ever had. My mouth is watering just talking about it. Front to back these guys know what they are doing.

A1b_Fgz83-ZaFqh2noiP9A.text: Why would you get a martini anywhere else in the Valley?  Seriously... did you eat a lot of paint chips as a small child?  THESE are the best martinis bar none.  The bartenders are so darn good here... the glasses are huge... and instead of being 2/3 full... they fill them to the rim when served.  Yes, you have to lap the first few times like a cow drinking from a trough to get the level low enough to pick it up.  But that is expected and acceptable behavior.  Only the waiting staff has the skill level to actually transport these filled to the rim drinks.

_r_ZRmh65zjOxZNYqorVow.text: One of the worst dining experiences while in Scottsdale   Food was bland and cold.  Service was non-existent.  Definitely AVOID. Nice setting. Good for a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

txYW2sNUATMwarTaWXOzxw.text: What an eclectic, fun place to have inventive cocktails, great people watching, and tasty food! The background behind the bar changes regularly and is a piece of art. Gabriel was attentive and patient in his recommendations. Enjoyable first time experience. We will return!

A-Rg40oG_v8pps6WYFnLYQ.text: This is a good place to drink and eat, it's a good place to just come and drink.  The S.S.S - smoked salmon, open face with red onion, cream cheese, capers, on pumpernickel is sooo good it's perfect at night when you're hungry but don't want something super heavy.  I went here on an unexpected (I didn't know it was a) date one time and my um, date, got the bonfire chicken and I tried a little bite of it, and it was really good.  The black-out torte is the best death by chocolate ever, the sundaes are really good, and as for alcohol, this if my favorite place to drink mojitos in Scottsdale.   I regret not knowing what their shrimp ceviche is like.. yet.  This was also one of the earliest places in the valley that accommodated gluten free diets, I think this information is worth pointing out for those who eat gluten free.  Random side note, this place is swanky and the art hanging from the ceiling looks like  something Jean Paul Gaultier would have designed.  The bathrooms are a little trippy, neon light, mirrors.  With the mirrors, it's hard mode on heels + mojitos.

PB1ZA8hu2TnNmi39pE2lbA.text: I'm giving AZ88 five stars for their martinis and ambience! The food is nothing to write home about and therefore a little overpriced IMO, but it is definitely good, and their apps are exactly the greasy stuff you are hungry for when you've had one too many drinks (chicken wings, french fries, etc.).   I choose this place when I want a really good beverage- my drink of choice is the St. Germain. Warning, these are not your typical  "Scottsdale" frilly drinks, pretty as they may be- they'll knock you flat if you aren't careful! But I enjoy strong drinks that require you to sip, not gulp like juice. They are pricey, but they are well made of quality ingredients and go a long way.   With regards to the atmosphere, it's pretty chic for Arizona. The ultra modern, all-mirror bathrooms (and the fact that no matter how many times you have been here, you can't find them on the first try) are an endearing quirk to an otherwise very classy space. Very clean (but not stark), not over-designed and they always feature a changing art installation in the middle and sometimes behind the bar as well. I've actually never sat on the patio but the glowing overhang structure is really beautiful and a great first impression.   I can't remember a visit without a great, attentive server. Also, because I was confused before- you seat yourself and a server will find you (and they always do, promptly).   I like any excuse to go here, but I'd especially recommend it when you really want to impress a difficult-to-impress guest, an artsy friend, or a "just drinks" date. Cheers!

_tDITvShJLWumQs-tWFwKg.text: I cannot believe I just now stumbled upon this place. The ambiance is very romantic, but also hip and fun. The menu is very well sorted from deserts being featured on the first page and entrees in the back.  Their cocktail menu is also amazing. I had been craving a dirty martini and finally got one last night and was very pleased.  Although the service was very slow, I am still not going to let that ruin my overall experience as the food and drinks topped my expectations.   Will be coming back soon

cf61fjjKPfjfScX0cCc0FA.text: This place has been here for 20 years. They do a very good job at their food and drinks. I really like their hamburgers and chicken sandwiches plus they have great waffle fries. Their main dishes are excellent as well.

E1G8q0CkrNrTfoAb6uUNeQ.text: Just the best. Worth the cost in ambiance, quality, and service. Long time customer and will always recommend!

_sOSUESfbdCaTAYgpymHvw.text: We hadn't been here for a while, and stopped in for a pre-concert meal. My wife said the Cosmo was the best she's ever had. The burger au Poivre was excellent. Service was good. My wife was also very happy with her dinner. Overall a great experience.

KcojD6hw9H764kRnMS4eQA.text: The ambiance has a lounge feel. The mixologists are super friendly, on top of drinks, personable, and the drinks themselves tasted spectacular. The decor inside is pretty neat. I didn't eat there but the waffle fries smelled amazing and looked tasty. They have indoor and outdoor seating. The bathroom are trendy and very clean. I had a chocolate martini and my boyfriend had a Manhattan. He said it was the best tasting Manhattan he's had. I also got a Tom Collins which was made perfect.

8-iXFWpBOAZR7OKPyQ_B-w.text: Excellent drinks, appetizers, bartender (Chris), servers.  This place is amazing in every aspect!

jExZMcaX-_FrHaNUtgw2rw.text: My husband and I were excited to give AZ88 a try before the show we were seeing at the Scottsdale Performing Arts Center. They don't take reservations so we decided to arrive early to get an outdoor seat. There was none available so we opted for a table close to the window. We were seated about 4:50PM. The show we were going to see started at 7:30PM.  Not sure if they were having an "off night" but the service was BEYOND slow. We didn't leave the restaurant until 7:20PM.  When our waiter was at the table, he was very nice but he took forever to get questions answered and forgot to bring us our hot sauce.   We started off by ordering 2 appetizers and a bottle of wine. The appetizers arrived at the table before the wine. Ironically we felt we were going to be rushed because of this. The water chestnuts were great; the shrimp cocktail was nothing to write home about. The fries were also great.   As for cocktails, we both ordered the English Garden and it was terrible! It was supposed to be comprised of St. Germain elder-flower liqueur, Hendricks gin, and fresh cucumber. I tasted absolutely no elder-flower liqueur. It tasted like gin with poorly muddled cucumbers and had a very gritty texture; not worth $30 bucks for the pair. The waiter noticed we hardly touched them; when we said they weren't up to par he apologized, removed the 3/4 full martini glasses from the table, and nothing was done after this.  At around 6:15PM, we placed an order for the Golden Gate Cake, an Espresso Martini and a coffee with a Bailey's kicker. They did not arrive at our table until 7:00PM and they forgot cream and sugar for the coffee. Since our show was starting in just 30 minutes, we were hardly able to enjoy our drinks. My husband was able to flag down someone and ask for cream and sugar for his coffee but by 7:15PM, they still failed to bring it. At this point he had already poured the Bailey's into the coffee but it was still so black and bitter that he wasn't able to drink it. The dessert was described as a butter rum cake but it was super dry and just tasted like pound cake that was a few days too old. The Espresso Martini was redeeming but not quite enough to make us want to come back. We were hoping this would be our permanent before show destination but between the slow service and poor drinks, we will be looking for another place in Old Town.

lKPvUCjyhFEOAFt5q5wgPA.text: I would give a 4 for the experience, but 3 for food which is most important. Outdoor patio is cute and we were lucky enough to be there when live music was being played. Food was good, not great. We had the au poivre II burger and the AZ88 chicken sandwich. Enjoyed the burger more than the chicken sandwich. Many raved about the chicken sandwich which is why we tried but we didn't find it to be anything special.

-PVBEODNLEhDyqKlL1R-mg.text: Always a good time. Always good executed food.  About 15$ to $20 for a meal but dang it's tasty.  Martinis are filled to the brim.  So bring a DD or a stealthy driver (not recommended but for reals)

gagFGu-4T-R5HIW42uvQKA.text: Had an awesome dinner. Our server was AMAZING (I forgot his name). We sat on the patio and had a great view of the nice pavilion. We started with Hell's Fire Chips. These were prepared as stated, the bleu cheese was a little strong for those of us at the table. We ordered entrees, 2 cheeseburgers, 1 hamburger and the AZ88 chicken sandwich. Mf9cGAMtfay-C993FeijWA.text: The drinks at this place are ABSURD. In the best way possible. They top each glass to the brim, and highly-trained wait staff will bring them to you with skill and poise, that it's a show in of itself watching your drink come to you.   One time, a waiter I had accidentally splashed some of my Vesper Martini on the table while trying to set it down. I didn't think anything of it - hell if it were me trying to deliver that thing, I'd probably spill most of it! But he came back not even 3 minutes later with another shot glass full of martini to top me off! Great service. I also love the food - it's like high-end comfort foods that are great to enjoy while you're getting a good buzz going.   Great vibe. Great location. Great drinks. Enjoy!

w6NrC91wXoS00GZ8vXaoMQ.text: My new favorite Scottsdale sexy bar/eatery. I moved to OldTowne 4 months ago and quickly realized it was a tourist trap. However, AZ88 gives you a local feel, cute outdoor seating, friendly bartenders. I want to take everyone there who visits me. I can't wait until the weather gets warm and I can stroll home after two of their martinis :)

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. St. Germaine

hHMbf9LNsUWnVsx-lVkpNw.text: I enjoy each visit to AZ88 because the staff is amazing at accommodating even the most unsure of guests. I have dietary restrictions that are somewhat simple to navigate but they always go the extra mile and have plenty of options that are, in my opinion, all very appetizing and diverse. They also provide a large and eclectic amount of drinks and in a very interesting but beautiful atmosphere depending on what time of day you go. Day or night, I recommend to visit.

lp_K7S87b878D0g_gtssfw.text: How have I not wrote a review on AZ88 yet? I love this place!   Another reviewer wrote, "The ambiance screams West Hollywood nightlife but the food screams late night dive bar." This is almost spot on! I would say that the ambiance and drinks scream South Beach Miami nightlife and food is your hometown's sports bar. It's unusual but, to me, it works!  The decor changes pretty regularly and is always cool and artistic. I love coming in to see what they have displayed above the bar. And I always visit during the holidays because they create an interesting decorative Christmas tree. One year it was made out of money! This past year it was made of safety pins.  The drink menu is heavy on the cocktails. I'm normally more of a wine and beer sort of gal, but I make an exception when I come here and I usually order a lemon drop. Beware, the drinks are strong!   While the drinks are very fancy, the food is pretty casual. Lots of sandwich and burger options. I love the waffle fries and they have a couple different dipping sauces (blue cheese, remoulade, spicy ketchup). If you are eating healthier, I like the grilled vegetables dish. It's just a bunch of different veggies with a teriyaki sauce. It sounds simple but they mange to make vegetables taste much better than they do when I make them at home.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Money Christmas Tree. December 2017.

BsgzAHqR_qgR4KkRC0_xlg.text: I really enjoy this spot.  The patio seating is great with views of the park.  The indoor seating is also nice especially when the exterior doors are all wide open making indoor and outdoor blend together.  The food is very good.  Try the bacon wrapped water chestnuts they are so good.  The AZ88 Buffalo Chicken sandwich is the bomb (literally because it's so spicy hot).  The burgers are good.  Drinks are very good, talented bar staff.  I recommended a Greyhound with an upgraded vodka of your choice (unless you like Smirnoff).  Fresh squeezed grapefruit juice is used in the Greyhound.  Beer selection is just ok.  The music is a great mix of lounge music and classic pop.  The artwork inside is always changing and interesting.  The bar used to be mixed crowd on Saturday nights, just keep an open mind and and you will be fine.  Worth a visit to AZ88, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped water chestnuts, mother lode tower station IPA, bloody mary, on the outdoor patio.
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating next to the park

nyCsdXii_nOpx9B--6yxRA.text: Walking up to AZ88 I wasn't sure if I was visiting a modern art museum or a restaurant. Tall and prominent glass windows and high ceilings give the interior a bright feel while the sculpture garden, visible through them, brings the outdoors in. I thought I was in for a real treat.   An open and modern restaurant like this should surely have a fresh menu, but alas, that was not the case. A page of starters, comprised mostly of dishes based on fries or chips, was followed by burgers, salads, chicken sandwiches and a few entrees, all of which were fairly predictable and common place. If I'm being completely honest, I was actually caught off guard by the menu.   I ended up ordering the Burger Au Poivre II which has Burgundy red onionsauce, blue cheese and thick cut bacon. I liked the note on top of the burger section that mentioned the butcher shop they'd been buying from for years and that helped me decide. Ultimately the burger came out medium, but it was still flavorful and juicy, so I let it slide. The waffle fries were impeccably crispsnf the fresh fruit and veg garnish was a nice touch.  Almost as shocked as when I saw the bartender with the blowout sporting Rayban esque sunnies with yellow lenses behind the bar. That shock was topped by the waitress who was super friendly, but in that weird diner waitress kinda way, with the accent to boot. Again, pleasant, got all the details, took great care of us, but just a bit more brash and congenial than the atmosphere would suggest.   I will say I was impressed they had a cocktail menu with a large wine and beer list. The cocktails were also basic and predictable, but the prices were fair because the spirits chosen were good, not great.   After we'd ordered and eaten I took note of the other diners in the room and it stated to make sense. Most looked like older folks who enjoyed cruising through this area and had been dining here for years. That again helped explained a lot for me.  You won't have a bad meal here. You won't be blown away. Prices are slightly higher due to the area.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

23k5QTcOFXNKB8xmgpIvBA.text: Our server Christina was awesome. Great sayings and some of the best burgers in the valley. Particularly the burger Apouive II

vT_IjkvdpwaBI-k0ITWlNg.text: I had the Gluten free Chicken Calabases, no waffle fries, no bell pepper, no bun. Chicken was a little dry, could have used a little sauce, or au jus. My husband had the Honey Jalapeno Chicken, opted for a small garden salad in place of waffle fries or veggies. I added a couple jalapenos to my chicken and it was good.  Good tasting chicken and grilled mushrooms and onions. Would have preferred grilled veggies. Fruit was good.

Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gluten free Chicken Calabases, no waffle fries, no bell pepper.

msawLK6nUno6pahLBByb9g.text: Don't know why this place has such good reviews as tonight we had the worst experience here. The only saving grace was the server, she tried but the experience was made and broken by the general manager. We arrived on a Saturday evening where we were sat promptly by a nice manager. However, the place was so hot. Literally, everyone was toweling off the face and body as they were sweating. The poor servers have to wear button down shirts and when asked said the ac wasn't working well tonight. In addition, "the managers were aware but said this is what it is". I had my children with me, so I was not impressed with the fact that they didn't advertise that either the ac was broken as the server said. Or the other claim, that according to the manager "they run the air conditioner at 82-85 degrees due to the ac unit and the windows they have". That infuriated me after sitting there waiting for the food to come out which was "meh". To have him tell us that as an explanation and act like that wasn't an issue for your patrons was unacceptable. This restaurant literally was so loud, we couldn't hear each other practically which was another issue for us. It was 7:30 on a Saturday so fix the ac and turn the music down. This isn't a club. When the servers are sweating through the clothes it's an issue. Also when the "manager" tries to quiet you when asked these pointed questions, that's not impressive either. When he said I want to cover your check, I said no I'll pay it as the server did nothing wrong and the food was okay. The fact it was hot the entire meal was the issue. With a manager like this, I hope the owner can figure out how to tighten the reins as this place is not the restaurant that we were advertised by friends in the area. We will not be back and will be sure to share the experience with others as it's not okay to not have ac in Arizona during the summer. I gave them two stars as the server was doing her best and the drink at the bar was a good experience. Can't give them a 3 as it was a sweltering hot box.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Literally looked like they are trying to be a club? Kind of tacky.

Even though we came in shortly before closing, he was still so friendly about serving us. Half the fun of coming to AZ88, is knowing you're getting an amazing drink with beautiful craftsmanship, Evan definitely couldn't have done it better! I am sad to end the bday tradition here but I will be moving to a restaurant who can accommodate a large group

HwY-7O5H3fFsLC5pih0Usw.text: Ok, so we just h add porn to eat here because they are open late and had a good selection. They are differently attempted to be a swanky little spot. This place was dead but it was interesting all the lights were off and the had a bunch of disco balls lit up in center of room. It was cute. However, what I hated was the bench/half table the back of bench has alot of give and you're basically laying down. I had the grilled cheese it was so good and the waffle fries are great. I ordered the spicey ketchup.  It's so good. My husband got a burger he really liked it. The other two people got the tuna. Everyone one seemed to enjoy.

SJtN_65wb6ot6YLasm1Lng.text: Best martinis! I feel like their menu used to be bigger for martinis, but I could be wrong. I know they'll make anything you want, so if you have something in mind not listed I know they'll make it!  The food is good too! Always happy with everything I've ordered, even if it's just a salad!   I love sitting outside here at night, but the inside is cool and modern!   Overall, it's great! The staff has always been friendly and kind:)

lpfhWyCY8TNXvTHDtpGNBg.text: I am giving this three stars- there are reasons to give it 5 and reasons to give it 1, so I'll split the difference. This is a great place to go for lunch on any day. If you are out with someone you might be bored of, or have some other reason you would rather not speak to your date, this is also a great place for dinner and drinks. If you love people watching, this is a great place. If you would love to pick up a third person... The food is good, the service is good, the atmosphere is good. So what bothers me? I have been going to this place for years and they still do not offer a veggie burger. In truth, the place is not very veggie friendly. I could forgive that if I wasn't informed by the waitress that their grilled veggies are cooked in CHICKEN STOCK. My suggestion? Offer a gardenburger option for your burgers, and please put an asterisk next to your grilled veggies pointing out that they are not a vegetarian option (or make them vegetarian). I'll be back since my family and friends love this joint, but I will ask (nicely) for a veggie burger every time :)

eBZXfssJ6Yw4TMVfw00m7g.text: I remember when this place opened in 1988 -- it was sleek, served great drinks and eats. I've been back once or twice since then, and it never seems to disappoint.

PuW7sMdXDdmIxQaT5bTD9Q.text: I grew up in Arizona, and this place came of age at about the same time I did.  I remember it being the height of 80s style in the late 80s and early 90s.  They always had steak tartare on the menu and it always went perfectly with a stiff Martini.  But then I graduated from ASU, moved away and forgot about it.  Over the holidays, while visiting family, I thought it would be cool to take a walk down memory lane.  While they've undergone some subtle changes, they still seem completely in the moment.  Our meal went like this:  Apps Galettes: Simple flat bread topped with bacon, carmelized onions, olives and parmagiano.  The menu calls it as it is: Very simple, yet so much more.  Hell's Fire Chips: Homemade potato chips topped with melted gorgonzola & Arizona Gunslinger chili sauce.  I've already ordered some of this sauce online so I can replicate this dish at home accurately.  Think of it as a creative, middle-brow Superbowl party dish.  Main Plates Burgers for everyone!  We were all in the mood for burgers, and AZ 88 has that angle covered.  I had the Au Poive II.  This is an amazing burg!  The patty is covered in peppercorns, grilled, and then basted in a burgandy reduction.  The "II" part amounts to a topping of melted gorgonzola and thick applewood smoked bacon.  This is an absolutely amazing assemblage.  My father-in-law had the Au Poive, my mother-in-law a straight-up cheeseburger and my wife had the Las Brisas.  If you're not going to have the Au Poive I or II, go for the Brisas: Jalepenos, jack, avocados and a wee bit of salsa.  Phoenix is one of only a handful of places where these type of burger doesn't seem cheesy, so take advantage of it while you're there!  This place is still a bar at heart, so the drinks were solid.  They carry Chopin, so they get bonus points in my book.  Plus,  it was served cold but not watered down.  This is becoming an increasing rarity, so I was pleasantly surprised.   I hesitated to give them 4 stars, but considering the wonderful meal and the sense of place and history I feel better about it.  Looking for a bit of adolescent nostalgia, or just a slightly edgy burger joint/bar off the beaten path near Old Town Scottsdale?  You can do MUCH worse than to stop off at AZ 88.

Qp6nYQmYwShQCK37oBjGpg.text: I love this place!! It has not changes for 20 years!!! Crazy I know.   The story behind this fantastic little martini/restaurant bar is that it is owned by Karl Kopps from Milwaukee, WI and it has sister bar in Milwaukee that is called Elsa's. Both have the same vibe and menus. What's interesting is that the artwork rotates from place to place and keeps the vibe changing.   I highly recommend the burger!  Yes, I said BURGER... as in Hamburger!  It's awesome. Therefore, kick back and savor a martini while chilling to good tunes and munching on a hand-packed piece of Americana!   The bottom line: if your looking for a chic little place that always has a a great vibe. Than this is your spot.   PS. Be prepared to wait for a table or come early as they so get packed!!

m-Ozhs3WYoj8gk1wtRaETQ.text: My boyfriend and I were excited to go to AZ88 because of all the rave reviews, and we weren't disappointed!  The food was great - no complaints there.  I had the AZ88 chicken. It was very flavorful and a bit messy. but that's ok. My boyfriend had the grilled cheese and it was awesome. We both loved the waffle fries (and I really, really love fries) and the fruit and veggies were also good!  My boyfriend ordered a black & tan, which they couldn't make, so he settled for a Guinness.  I ordered the celebration champagne, which was  great! Although the fizz spilled all over the table leaving a sticky mess.  The only real gripe I have with AZ88 is that our IDs were checked 3 times.  Once at the door, again at the table, and a third time with a second form at the manager's request. Kind of annoying (my boyfriend and I are 23).

rTx8dg886H6RxzowSK9Weg.text: For those of you who have dined atop the Space Needle in Seattle, I compare AZ 88 to that....the food isn't all that, but the ambiance and atmosphere is so incredibly fun and alluring, I suppose you don't really care and will continue to come back? (hence 1 star added to an otherwise 3 star rating based on food alone)  I've been here a few times, and EVERY single time, I seem to always get a mediocre (nicely presented, though!) dish. This past weekend though, I have to say the hostess went above and beyond for our large 13 person party. We were worried we wouldn't be able to get a table (don't accept reservations), but she said that whenever we were ready, she would figure something out. Only 3 of our party had arrived, and she still seated us (sometimes rare) outside on the patio and brought the females shawls in case it got too chilly (now that truly wow'd me).   Too bad she wasn't our server. He fell a lil short on our scale. When I asked him which specialty martini he suggested (they have no menu) he said they could make anything. I further pried, but he only answered with "Well, we're a martini bar, anything is good." 1st off, if I'm asking you a specific question, it ain't thaaaat hard to give me 1-2 options, at least to just humor me. Whatever :) I figured if they were a True martini bar, they probably had some fun options, which is why I didn't want to order the classic cosmo or flirtini.  The service was super slow all night. I have to blame that on the fact that we were a large party and maybe he thought we wanted time to ourselves to socialize? Still, I think it is best to cater to your tables more efficiently no matter the size.  Ok meal. Ok drink (oh, i got the praised Key Lime martini..so-so). Great music. I'll keep on returnin.

b7O3TeEH2dH9lkNb0dqWzA.text: In Short:  Too chic for its own good, food is ok, ambiance is unique: for good or worse.  I went here on a whim because frankly the place looks frekin cool.  The atmosphere is always happening and lots of  good looking people just hanging around.  It's definitely chic and unique, but it feels like that's where things go wrong.    The day I went the music was really loud, it was pretty good selection but it was way too loud.  I had a hard time hearing my friends, I felt like az88 was more of a bar pretending to be a restaurant.  The interior decorations had a Liberace on crack feeling (life sized rhinestone studded dogs???).  The drink menu was great and imaginative, I tried a couple of cocktails.  The food was ok, nothing to write home about but nothing to complain either.  Portions was on the smaller side for the price.  They had a chocolate tart that was pretty amazing, the highlight of my evening.  I might go there again just for that.  I think this is a great place to go have a drink and hangout, not much of a restaurant, it's just too much attention on everything else and not enough about the food.

y-csfL9wKISJNyfnR1NveA.text: I originally went to this place because it was listed some where online, maybe on here for happy hour.  They do not actually have happy hour.  I ordered a salad which was good, can't really screw those up to much.  I also ordered a Bellini which was awesome but pretty over priced.  I probably would not go here again with friends but maybe with a date.

B4kCa2vzoVia77PA8nhdFA.text: One of my fav place in AZ with great food and atmosphere.  If you like something light but flavorful try "Elsa's Sandwich"  : )

zFlsZJ-bThRPn88GpOsnFg.text: Hard to find the location. If your directions take you to 1st street like ours did, park in the shaded structure, and walk west toward drinkwater blvd. It's near the performing arts center.  We were worried about being under dressed, but only until a group came in wearing exercise clothes!  I ordered a chicken sandwich with honey and jalapenos. The ingredients blended together very nicely. My husband ordered a burger with peppercorn, bleu cheese, bacon, and a special sauce. It was also delicious. His only complaint was that it was a bit heavy on the peppercorn.  Portions were huge. I ate just over half a sandwich. Prices were fair. Our meal was under $30, including tax.  Make sure you visit the restrooms. The decor and architecture are really neat!

LZ7wz-XnT5Jtm4oIrF2ETQ.text: Five Stars is awarded for great food and its atmosphere.  A half star is taken away for service, I haven't seen much teamwork or extra hands to assist the waiters.   The total experience at AZ 88 is hip and relaxing I love to bring people from out of town to this Scottsdale spot.  Different art work is featured here and has been recognized by magazines like 944. I love a large menu that serves food till 12:30 AM 7 days a week.  For the ladies, don't pass up the martinis here, from presentation to execution, perfect.  I come here for the best burgers in AZ.  Sirloin steak is used and there is a great selection to choose from.   I enjoy the St. Petersburg potato appetizer, its a smoked salmon dish.     AZ 88 is known for being a gay bar but I don't think its an official spot.

Sb8_8eXNgzdH9hwYqWkc1g.text: I love AZ 88.  This is a good place to take out of town guests because it's cool and different, and right in the heart of the Scottsdale Civic Center area.  The decor is great inside and outside, from the bar, to the dining areas, to the restrooms.    The Hot Pepper Chicken sandwich is the best, IMHO, although I've also tried the salads and some of the other chicken sandwiches.  Gotta love the waffle fries.  The pickle, raw veggies, and fresh fruits also in the basket really do round out the meal.  It's disappointing that there's not much on the dessert menu for the raging chocoholic in me, but the Golden Gate Cake was admittedly not bad, as non-chocolate desserts go.   Expect to pay the same amount for your entree and your drink -- it all evens out.  The girly martinis are delicious.  I'm also a huge fan of the Pimm's cup.   As far as the crowd/scene, I really wouldn't worry about it too much - the waitstaff is always very welcoming and everyone is just there to have a good time.

ljqyeEw8t4IunQFjKVal0A.text: I think I went on a bad night because I'd say that normally the service here is a lot better than I described in my last review. They also changed the decor again.   I've since been back and was reminded that a good time can be had here. I do like the reclining couch seating and it's in a good location. I just think 2 stars was a little harsh.

nPpm6aidaDzkN0mZlU3fPg.text: Beautiful view. Lovely surroundings overlooking the Scottsdale Center for the Arts, where lots of outdoor festivals take place. Decent food. Nice relaxing music in the background. Nice patio. If you don't mind a staff with attitude, then you'll love this place. (ahem... welcome to Snottsdale.) Questions like "Temperature?" when ordering a burger as opposed to "How would you like that done?" leave the guest translating waiter's meanings. Personally I appreciate waiters who are there to ensure you are comfortable and pleased with the dining experience. After working 10+ years in the hotel business I know what I am talking about. Oh and even locating the restrooms proves to have attitude. Guests must pay attention to the gender identifiers which are way at the bottom of the door softly illuminated. And inside the mirrors were at every angle and odd lighting showing far more than I need to see. Gheeezzz! There are so many other choices where I can spend my money... I think I will chose a friendlier place next time. homepage.mac.com/az88/Si...

KucPzHfDNFFfoG75b3C5sA.text: Love this place!  We eat here ever year when we come to Scottsdale.  Nice location with a beautiful view overlooking the Scottsdale Civic Center mall, with comfortable patio and indoor seating.  Food is great (I love the portobello sandwich), service is wonderful, and the manager goes from table to table to make sure his customers are  satisfied.  It looks and feels like an expensive upscale restaurant, but the prices are reasonable.  Highly recommended.

oWzAiHBlxub1eC4EufKZLw.text: Group of us sat down to enjoy a meal at this place.  I've heard nothing but splendid reviews from close friends.   Immediately after we were seated, a WT-waiter barked, "What do you want?"  ...Later in the evening, same waiter snarled, "NO" after being asked for a refill.    Having to correct the narcissistic waiter's etiquette, twice... I ask for a manager... but still got inferior service, even from the meek supervisor.  Food was so-so, at best....  Libations are overpriced...     Never going back.
