This restaurant/nightspot has been a subject of lore. At this place the martinis are big and kickin and for an evening you can feel simply beautiful and sexy. The music is pumpin with sick beats by their dj upstairs. There's an art piece in the center that exudes sex...iness. And the bar reminds you of how this LA-esque place is here in our turf but Scottsdale is not Phoenix, it's a bit of San Diego, a bit of Santa Monica, a bit of the Marina in San Fran. And you realize that its handsome men with handsome men and hot women with sexy ladies and everything in between. This is the place for gay men and women, and straight allies.   The drinks are delish, and exquisite, here a glass of something with bubbles just makes sense, couple it with a martini or two with shaker makes sense. And their burger au poivre just messes with the senses... it's overwhelming and so good! This place is contemporary chic. Not ikea chic like its hot cousin FEZ in our cenpho which in my opinion is attaining landmark status on central. This place celebrates the hotness of the old town crowd. So if ever I want a late night place, and want to see and be the scene. I head over with some hot teases and have a fun time. hope to see you there one night, just wink.

uggOhYZPA7wnXe2zOCI0Xg.text: Great spot.  Always a good vibe, food is consistently good, and drinks are tasty and strong.  When we have out-of-town guests, this is where we go.  You can't beat the price, quality, and vibe.  One of my favorite all-around Phoenix/Scottsdale restaurants.  Try the AZ88 Chicken Sandwich , Asian Shrimp, Summer Soltice Martini, and the chips and dip.

aC_4HbWEbv8eESeERMrI_A.text: This is a great late night lounge. The food is not what their strong points are but their St.Petersburg fires and hellfires are also the bomb...

B2MrxaLpWju2v8g4nVZxJQ.text: I've been here quite a few times over the years- sometimes for dinner, sometimes for drinks and sometimes for both.  It's a really cool place to people watch and the food is pretty good- not great- but good.  They do have some specialty martinis and the desserts are awesome. Try the strawberry shortcake or cheesecake- you'll thank me after, trust me! Just watch out for the strange man that dresses like JLo.  Seriously. I've seen him there twice, he's always alone and wearing supertight pants, a sparkly belt, kicky boots and an extremely tight top.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

BNMMf9-FkG1ck4UAhlA_sg.text: This is my favorite place in old town to hang out at. It's modern and sheik, and the food is always good. There was only one time out of some 50 or 60 where I had bad service, but the manager saw it and took care of several items on the bill and offered me a free dessert. The bar sells cigarettes which is sort of cool, and the atmosphere is nice besides occasional Scottsdale snobs. Overall, this place is unbeatable for a cool night out in Old Town.

NOtZGo6AM6vraUn8Kkizag.text: I like this place.  I don't get a chance to go very often but every time I go it's always good.  I always have the Seared Tuna.  Great place to sit outside and eat when it is cooler.

9BX-IygdJUl0wr9aPpPcjQ.text: AZ 88 is a great date location.  The atmosphere is excellent - always an artistic display, usually great music.  If my parents ever make it out here from Wisconsin, I'm definitely taking them to AZ 88.  The view of the Scottsdale mall is really cool, and the proximity to a number of the "old" Old Town bars is really convenient.  The food is reasonably priced, with most sandwiches and dishes right around $10.  They have a good sized bar selection, with some really interesting imported beers.  I would absolutely recommend the AZ 88 sandwich if you enjoy buffalo sauce, and it's really hard for me to not order the little crackers with onions and bacon on them (even despite disliking bacon!).

g7U07ajgVtNODwgnI10zaQ.text: AZ 88 is really great at everything it does.    Burger was one of the best I've had in a long time... get it with all the cheeses, you won't be disappointed.  I like the classy drinks, but I would only go here to have a few drinks... not for a night out on the town or anything.  Place is great to go to have great food and classy drinks, good conversation.

cEFOIaxxO6sc6zc9DxNyLg.text: The bleu cheese burger is delicious, and the martinis are HUGE and so, so good.  It's definitely a people-watching spot, although I'm not much of a people watcher... I roll with a group who travels loud and proud, so no doubt, we were being watched and judged alike.  But I did feel like most people there were watching, judging, liking, hating, etc., but if you're partying in Scottsdale, you should expect no less.  Eh, still a good time had by all, as we staggered out drunk asses over to the Mondrian down the road to continue our drunken shenanigans.

aNaeWruRUPGokNPFP2_8og.text: az88 is the place to go if you love grilled cheese sandwiches. i like mine on wheat, and double up the raw veggies instead of fries. melty cheese, tomato & thick slices of bacon round out this american classic. now why would you go to a hip modern bar/restaurant and order a grilled cheese? ok order up a cocktail/beverage or two or three.   order up a mound of their wings to share (and bring someone who will clean up that cartilige for ya! suck the bone clean). or you can be greedy and keep it all to yourself. all of the burgers and sandwiches and salads are pretty much delicious, so you cant go wrong here.  finish up with their strawberry shortcake. you will be pleased. ice cream. whip cream. strawberries. what's not to like?  the interior decor changes a few times during the year. eat/drink here  every so often just to check what they have up their sleeves.

U0KkPDJLq6xUP-MpHyuRBQ.text: On my first ever visit to Phoenix and not being a local, I think we stumbled across one of the locals favorite destination places. Tucked behind a parking garage and a plaza across from the Performing Arts Center in Scottsdale, this place was worth the hunt to find.  The outdoor patio and the immaculate artistic interior which changes monthly won us over.  I will have to give it four stars however as the dinner food didn't seem to match the minimalist interior. I would definitely consider this a lunch or a cock tailing locale.

UmxpW_C9-l_DkNGyOsEoQg.text: "I dig this place."  Halfway through our night at AZ88 that's what my husband turned to me and said and I couldn't help but agree.  We went on a Thursday night and it was rather empty, there were several open tables during the entire time we were there.  We went for drinks and we were not disappointed.  I finally found a place here that can make a good mojito!  Woohoo!  I watched the bartender make it himself, sans pre-mix, and he muddled the mint in front of my very eyes.  I saw the Champagne Celebration on the menu but worried it would be too sweet so I opted to have a Kir Royale.  The bartender suggested the Celebration and assured me it wouldn't be too sweet so I ordered it.  It was fantastic!  It was one of the prettiest drinks I've ever had, with colored rock sugar sprinkled on top (which gives it a ever so faint cotton candy aftertaste) and it is basically a mix of a Kir Royale and a Bellini.  My husband asked for  suggestion and was told the Side Car, which he found too sweet and came with a sugar rimmed glass. He then moved to a tried and True Bombay Sapphire martini that was well made and his glass was poured so full that we could clearly see the meniscus on the top.  (And I'm sure we were the only people in the place that knew what a meniscus was...)  The bartender was a little slow in making one of my drinks so he comped it for us which I appreciated.  I wasn't bothered by it because he was the only bartender and clearly could have used help as he had to prepare all the drinks for the bar and the tables.  We didn't order dinner food but I plan on returning with my BFF in two weeks for dinner.  The food is insanely inexpensive, its cheaper than at Chili's!  The atmosphere is great, it's very trendy and upbeat yet still understated.  (It reminds me of 28 Degrees in Boston except with a white motif and not blue)  We did order dessert, the Golden Gate Cake in honor of my little sister who just moved to San Fran this week. (Love you A!) and it was amazingly yummy.    The place is fairly casual really, most folks were wearing their best mall duds from Express so it wasn't overly dressy at all.  In fact, there was a guy in a Budweiser trucker hat that he clearly got for free somewhere. (I will not get into my feelings on trucker hats, Budweiser trucker hats or free hats....)  My husband was in shorts and a t-shirt and he felt fine.  (Plenty of guys came in wearing flip flops...yet another thing I won't get into!)  The crowd was fairly diverse which was nice.    One last thought.  Yes, the bathrooms were cool but it was certainly not the coolest I've ever seen.  (I find that frosting glass or water effects really take bathrooms to a new level.)  One of the stalls in the women's bathroom was lacking tp and the other was dangerously close to that.  There were also kind of messy and smelled faintly of sewage.    I am definitely planning on returning, its nice and out of the way, relaxed and inexpensive. What more could you want?

YYmBiGmUyVLXOhYKhGG27w.text: Always great. Always hip. Moscow Mule is my favorite drink and my girl likes the Caramel Apple Martini--always served to the brim. Hell's Fire Chips are fantastic too, with extra AZ Gunslinger sauce.

6sCMZMQ1BaidEHzY_okRZg.text: A True GEM in Old Town !! I have taken friends there on several occasion's and have ALWAYS had a great time !! Never-mind the great food , the ambiance is awesome , I could hang out there all night . A swanky place next to the Mondrian , within walking distance of all the bars and clubs. KUDOS !!!

RlXoOaBMR9c7tSEhW-DOPQ.text: I LOVE AZ88! This place is amazing and what makes it even more amazing is my favorite server REBECCA! She always ends up being our server every time we go in and I'm always so happy! She is awesome! Super nice and funny, also she is on top of everything and thinks of things the table needs before even asking! My boyfriend and I had our first date there and just went again yesterday for our two year anniversary and Rebecca brought us a piece of cheese cake with two candles on it!! So sweet! I always recommend AZ88 to all  my clients (Im a Hairstylist in scottsdale) looking for an awesome place to eat and get a killer martini with blue cheese stuffed olives!!  I always make sure to tell them to sit in Rebecca's section because she's awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mmt-UtO2mXk39YvXFGBwUQ.text: I've Come here numerous times and never been disappointed. Food and drinks are always on point with an upbeat atmosphere.

pyhwQl9zQQfL8THh24EzsA.text: First time going here and this place is amazing.  The atmosphere is to die for.  Everything was perfect.  Had a peppercorn chicken sandwich and it was the best chicken sandwich I have ever had.   I will for sure be coming back here to eat!

OnVP5uSXGC5M8W3mKTevfw.text: The location and decor are wonderful. We enjoyed a great view of the lawn of the Civic Center. The food was even good though a little pricey. Our waiter was very rude though and we had to ask another waiter for tea refills and we got our own to go boxes. Not sure if he was mad that we weren't ordering cocktails or what. Very strange experience overall though it seemed other patrons were being taken care of.

UT-huh5kHZ7pfd38YpUQBw.text: I love this place.  I had visited AZ 88 a few times this summer and will go again after the holidays.  This place becomes busy and is obviously the spot to be late night to have a few snacks, drinks of course and to relax.  This is not a lounge you where must dress to the 9's, I have visited in a pair of jeans, low cut top and a  great pair heels and was happy to grab my fav mojito and burger.    Oh try the blue cheese and hot sauce chips.  It sounds as a strange combo but wowzers was it tasty.  I had never known I could like hot sauce as much. LOL.  If you are a martini fan, try their extra dry dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives.  It's sooo good.  But be careful, they go down rather smooth and quickly.  Before you realize you have had 2 or more.  You know what they say??  Two or more and you hit the floor.  I stopped at 1, ok ok 1 and a half.  Enjoy!

YslTPqy3fuQdy8a3w1j6jw.text: I love bringing friends and out of town guests to AZ88. It has such an excellent vibe, stiff drinks, mouthwatering food, and great beats. I always start with a dirty martini and older the Hell Fries. Every bite is special! After dinner, I go for round two and order the espresso martini.  Now, lets not forget about all the talk about the secret bathrooms. Basically push the door and enter at your own risk! You will see angles of yourself you've never seen before. It's always great laughter to see what your guests say about their experience.   A must go to for date night or night out with loved ones.

xSVYUFDkZCQtkXKlsxmpYQ.text: Kick -ass food! Try the burger or nachos. All drinks are outstanding & staff is very friendly and accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cosmo:)

eHop4CfXttZ_yGMZzum-jQ.text: First review for AZ88, however, by far not my first time there nor my last. So let me tell you some History. In the 1950's Elsa Kopp founded Kopp's Custard Stand in Milwaukee, WI after her husband Karl Kopp developed Parkinson's. By the 1960's it was a popular Milwaukee staple. Elsa's son Karl Kopp is now the owner of Kopp's as well as Elsa's on the Park, located in downtown Milwaukee across the street from Cathedral Square Park, Bar 89 in SoHo NYC (which unfortunately is now closed) and AZ88, Scottsdale, AZ. AZ88 is named after the State of residence and the year it was opened. AZ88 as well as the other two restaurants are knew for the somewhat avant garde art work installations in the mostly white walled interiors. They all have similar menus and offer similar pricing and upscale cocktails. They are all similar styles with a bar on onside of the restaurant with high ceilings, white washed walls and contemporary furniture. I have only been to Elsa's On The Park a couple of times but it was the least pretentious. You will more likely spot a celeb or well know locals at AZ88. AZ88 and Bar 89 are both frequented by the gay community. One New York restaurant review described Bar 89, palatial as a Grecian Bathhouse with unisex stalls. You will find AZ88 has a his, a hers and a his/hers restroom. DJ music from above and floor to ceiling windows that also over look a park at the Scottsdale Civic Plaza. Just go for cocktails or sit and eat inside or on the patio. It can get busy nights and weekends, they do not take reservations. Of course I love the AZ88 chicken sandwich with waffle cut fries and fruit, the AZ88 Chicken salad and the Tuna Nicoise salad. Actually all the sandwiches are good. The martinis are excellent. They have a wide range of liquor and offer a variety of top shelf. So, if you prefer a Johnny Walker Blue or the high end Louis XIII de Remy Martin Cognac (they do have a bottle, I was there few days ago) you will not be disappointed. Or just get a Grey Goose Martini dry and up, I promise they don't use vermouth unless you ask for it. If you want to beat the crowds and avoid the pushing and shoving at the bar go during the afternoon on a Sunday. Also if you get a chance stop into a Kopp's kopps.com

jXdqtlSOLWR0b_mWrJJwkA.text: Love this place. always open late night... for AZ its awesome bc everything closes here when it gets dark. Love the St. Petersberg chips, gota tryem

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wings
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. St. Petersberg Chips

ErjuDhwcV3U8k2Kp3qngXg.text: Everyone seems to love it here. I can't help but find it a bit too full of itself for it's own good. The food is always good, the drinks are fine. I just feel like I'm an extra in an episode of A-List Scottsdale or Real Houswives of Scottsdale whenever I eat there.  I did love the Christmas tree this year though.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Christmas Tree, 2011

ZULIZiop-ywco20PFIqZ0w.text: This is one of my favorite places to frequent in Old Town. It has one of the best patios in the area and hosts a modern decor. The staff is usually top notch and the food is great. The menu prices seem pretty expensive, especially for drinks. But if you order a liquor with soda they give you a full glass of whatever liquor you ordered along with a bottle of the soda of your choice. So even though it may seem pricey, you're getting at least three drinks worth compared to other bars. I've been a patron of AZ 88 since I was a kid, and have never had an experience that deterred me from going back.

liwqQaf7QGbPsla3kf4iag.text: Still a place that is unacceptable in my book--especially when a server there goes out of their way to message me privately on Yelp to complain about my punctuation, and signing off--every so "sincerely" i might add, with: " love the B*tchy waitress from AZ88.  Way to keep it classy over there.....

MfFotRghCbWfwj64cQ0V_w.text: These hacks couldn't make a cocktail if their lives depended on it.  They're arrogant and can't back it up.  The mojito was disgusting, with sad overworked mint.  The Sazerac was an abomination.  They shook it resulting in an over diluted drink, then added a squeeze of a lemon wedge instead of a twist of lemon peel.

jJAEU4ZPVPyoYUjKPGKOeQ.text: I came here for dinner and drinks, and everything was FABULOUS. The food was great. I recommend the Elsa sandwich. Some of the martinis for the table came out faster than others, but they were worth the wait. The ambience was very chic, and the art on the wall was pretty cool. The restaurant has a he, a she and a he/she bathroom which were all very cool.

Lee_weFmKyHeUb6Sv774QA.text: Decided to try this place since I was going to an event close by and the review were great.  First, trying to get a table was odd. It took too long for the host to greet us. And there was a woman in front of me who had been waiting longer. It was just really odd. I've never walked into a place that asks you to wait to be seated and NO One is there to assist you with arranging that seating.  The food tastes good, but really over priced for what you are getting. And the seating was pretty cramped. My table got bumped a couple times because it was pretty busy.   I probably wouldn't come here again considering I could make anything on there menu in my own home, and the quality would be just as good. It's just very basic.

sdCF2NaBg3NzJMu74nRFgQ.text: Arrived early with another couple to get a seat prior to a concert.  Seated with no problem.  Drink order was taken.  10 minutes later the waitress returned and said she forgot what we wanted.  Gave it again and then ordered food.  Dishes were served not as ordered, items forgotten.  The potatoes were cold and tasted like they were made last week.. When bill arrived it was all wrong.  The place was overcrowded and so noisy that you had to shout to be heard across the table.  It was a real zoo.  Last time at this place.  Poor service and mediocre food.

X9q7FG14sIJJ0uNsPLTjyA.text: Love hanging out here on the wknd! Its always crowded, reminds me of Ferndale or Royal Oak crowds back home in Michigan. Great vibe, for the white outdoor patio and the loud music gives off a Miami-South Beach theme. Unfortunately, the dirty martinis are a hit or miss. The food isn't something you want to eat prior to a night on the town (wknd). It's ok as far as food or drinks go, but it's a classier crowd then the normal El Hefe OT College Bar crowd-thank goodness! Sooooo that is what keeps me coming back. A must try at least once, and I love the great location!

lTVUpgVuwLJfAmXCxtuxMw.text: Applitinis will mess you up, ask me how I know. Jesus was my copilot after I drank tinis.....drink & drank

x15SdswvndRGZpBsaY54lw.text: The bartenders are the nicest people. I could hang out at the bar all night. DJ is awesome and the Lemon Drop martinis are the best in Scottsdale.  Simple but delicious food. I recommend the Las Brisas burger...so good.  Good for groups and a nice place to start your night before you hit the town.  Luckily we went on a night were the crowd was not out of control because this joint can get pretty busy and crowded.  You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vOx6Zo46O5nVS6NbnyI01g.text: The place looked REALLY REALLY nice. I like the bathroom the most, very cool looking.  The staff there didnt' know how to crack a smile though.  All the waiters and waitress seemed very somber and serious, not once did a see a smile during the 2 hour lunch that I was there.    Food wise was also just O-k, I had a burger and the criss-cut fries, but the fries looked better than it tasted.  I expected the fries to have a nice crunch, but it turned out soft and slightly salty.  =/ Boo, they really looked good too.  The burger though was pretty nice, so i'll give them that.   Overall, if it wasn't for the nice decorations of the restaurant, I would not come back.

OE2Mx_797s52sC1EYsxvLw.text: GREAT Club sandwich, the best in town.   The service is slow, but that's part of the AZ88 culture.   I recommend highly for dates, casual dining (with time to spare), and cocktails.  The patio overlooks a park, it's quite nice

kq6twCL2F9qA27MJXfCzxw.text: Great food and great atmosphere, thats what I say about AZ88.  Their sandwiches (in particular the AZ88 chicken sandwich) is one of my favorites.  You can also split the sandwich for $2.50 and you each get your own sides, and half is still plenty of food.  They have a great selection of wines and drinks.  They change the artwork on the wall behind the bar and on the ceiling every couple of months, which is an interesting touch.  They also have an excellent patio!  This is a great place to go for some drinks with friends, or to indulge in their wonderful food.

teIBUmar0Hq1QR4-UnJL0w.text: This one is tough.  It's clearly a popular place and was packed at 700 pm on a Saturday when we went.  The food itself was good, not spectacular but worthwhile.  The ambiance was odd.  I felt like many people there thought they just came from a broadway play in new york and stopped by to have a sandwich and glass of wine.  It's just a little stuffy for my liking but it reminded me that we had actually been there 2 or 3 years before.  Didn't know the name before because we went there late night before and stumbled upon it with a group.  We went there because of Yelp but probably won't go back unless it's for late night food.  The dipping waffle fries, bacon wrapped chesnuts, and jalapeno chicken sandwich were all good.  However, the waffle fries at Chik Fil La are just as good.  The chicken sandwich was tasty but we could make it at home and it would be just as good.  Ultimately, we all go out for good food, atmosphere, people watching, and to socialize.  You can get all of things here for sure.  I would personally rather go to any number of other places in Scottsdale or Phoenix though.  BTW, our waitress really did a nice job and tried very hard to be responsive.  Again, that counts for something.

ZlhPc4zXDZipyiYNsDe8lQ.text: If you guys like the atmosphere here at AZ88 then you'll fall in love with the Mondrian! Everything at the Mondrian is mostly white and gives a relaxing yet swanky vibe! AZ88 is a nice place but if I had to make a choice I would head over to the Mondrian.

2juewXfhLGxhV3-V9MvXdA.text: Went here for lunch with 3 other people.  We walked in at 1:15 and were seated immediately outside at the front of the restaurant on a beautiful day.  The restaurant is beautiful and unique and is worth taking a good look at regardless of where you are seated.  Even the rest rooms are worth a visit.  We had a great lunch here.  My friends had the spinach salad and one of the other salads and they really enjoyed them. I had the Chicken Picnic Sandwich and it was outstanding--big sandwich with lots of chicken, gorgonzola, pears, lettuce on a slice of pumpernickel and a slice of white bread.  It came with a large portion of fresh fruit.  Additionally, the waitress was really good.  She was attentive, very informative, and friendly.  I will go back next time I am in Scottsdale possibly for dinner.

BS65vEX4CjUW4t_geBCl7A.text: Food and drinks were outstanding! Ambiance is incredible. The art was so intriguing. Evan was our bartender/server and he was great, perfect menu knowledge of both the food and cocktail list. Definitely coming back soon.

ibkEG0kDPe5sEgP-4ekGAg.text: We headed to AZ 88 after a long day and I was ready for some delicious food, and some relaxing. It was a little hard to find the entrance to the place, but seeing as it was about 90 seconds walk from the hotel I wasn't complaining!  The decor is very modern minimalist, and the patio was lovely - perfect for a warm Fall evening. Our server was friendly and attentive all evening, she never intruded on conversation but seemed to find the perfect moment to jump in and see how we were doing. I ordered the Garden Truck Chicken Sandwich with extra avocado (how could I not? I'm a sucker for avocado...) which came with waffle fries and fruit. The sandwich was super delicious, and the avocado took it to the next level. The vegetables were fresh and added a great crunch to the sandwich, and the chicken was well cooked. I can never resist waffle fries, but I thought the fruit was a bit of a weird choice; it just didn't seem to fit with the rest of the dish.  I had a local IPA with my sandwich, which was very good! I would have liked a little more assistance in choosing my beer from the server, but I can't complain - I'm a local beer fiend, and I can't blame other people for not knowing every in and out of their local beer scene!  The proximity to the hotel, and the pleasant time we had will definitely have me coming back to AZ 88 - I've gotta try some of those cocktails!

CBZlY1baP04-67QJW-c5Ug.text: Update time! I've had the pleasure of enjoying a cocktail or two at AZ 88, but hadn't eaten there until last night. Word on the street is their chicken sandwiches are where it's at- it's True folks! My Four-Peaks Kilt Lifter paired perfectly with the Garden Truck chicken sandwich- super juicy lemon and peppercorn crusted chicken with cucumbers, radish and mayo- add avocado. And those waffle fries! A must with a side of ranch. Service is friendly, attentive and timely. Best of all, this place is a hop skip and jump from the Saguaro hotel.

-aWThp3XYjhXuydLbkoGCg.text: Stopped in here on my bday for some drinks which happened to be Memorial Day, so we had the entire place to ourselves which was perfect. This place is just sexi, sexi, sexi !!  Cuddling in a private intimate booth, Rose Martini and champagne bubbles led to kisses and photos and an insanely delicious butterscotch dessert with a candle for wish making all while taking in tasteful cool music and surroundings.  We will be back when I'm not on a liquid diet to really give the food a tasting.   Ladies: We all love "bathroom pics" and this place has a pink bathroom with mirrors galore. I had a field day in here by myself- totally random photo shoot paradise

pjC9PdDaXDnMesci42E5Pg.text: My fiancee and I came here for a late-night dinner.  I had heard good things about AZ88 and was excited to give it a try.  The place is very hip and full of the attractive Scottsdale crowd, even at 10pm on a weeknight.  We didn't go an adventure with the drinks, just a tap beer and some wine, both of which were good.  We started with the St Petersburg potatoes.  I had not read any reviews on them, but they sounded intriguing.  They were waaaaay better than I was anticipating.  There were not just fried potatoes with some smoked salmon thrown on them.  There were quite a few flavors and texturing that worked very well together.    My fiancee got the chicken sandwich grilled in butter and I got the AZ88 chicken salad.  I thoroughly enjoyed mine.  The buffalo sauce was very strong but being a lover of chicken wings I did not mind at all.  The girl wasn't too crazy about her sandwich saying that it was too buttery.  We will definitely be back to try some more options.

qZH2SRuJl-fxSOSwYQTygQ.text: Took my Mom & Sis here the day before Thanksgivibg who were visiting out of town and we all had a blast! The food was Delish and the drinks were Devine! One of my favorite restuarants in scottsdale! Such a cool atmosphere, ambiance and great service! Love everything about this place. The wings, AZ88 chicken sandwich, and Ceaser salad are some of our favs!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Xmas Tree &amp; Decor sets the mood for Romantic Date Nights!
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. AZ Chicken Sandwich &amp; Fries are to die for
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Old Fashioned &amp; coconut Martini!

VjS96JhefwSXqRNoBMYptg.text: We were going to the Center for Performing Arts in Scottsdale and happened into AZ88 an hour and a half before showtime.  It was pretty full, but the maitre de pulled a table from outside (it was 101 degrees) and set it up by the window so that we would make the show.  Our service was excellent for dinner.  The Burger au poivre was outstanding!  My wife had a salad that was crlsp and tasty.  We were served with time to spare but no one tried to push us out to turn the table.  The room is "energetic" but conversation was quite comfortable.  I highly recommend this restaurant when you are in Old Towne.

BDaHCbQ_wbDiqn7O7eq16g.text: This place has superb cocktails and a decent dinner menu. It's a little expensive so I'd recommend only visiting during a special occasion.

ql9ue9PoQmxsNNfSmmHg7Q.text: AZ 88 is a great spot in Scottsdale for cool vibes and a cool atmosphere.  It is located at the Scottsdale Civic Center and the patio over looks the Scottsdale Center for the Arts.  If you are looking for a good patio in the area, definitely check it out.    The menu is good, tries to be interesting but it's just variations of appetizers, salads and chicken sandwiches.  It's a casual menu with an upscale twist which is nice for the area.  The prices are pretty reasonable also.  Salads and Sandwiches are $12-$14 and the portions are a good size.  The  drink menu is also very impressive with tons of wines, rums, and craft beers to choose from.  We started with the house made chips with lox and cream cheese on top.  Huge portion but I think they forgot half the lox.  Interesting dish but I probably won't order it again.  I had the AZ 88 salad for dinner which was great!  It's a chopped salad with grilled buffalo chicken on top.  The sandwiches come with waffle fries which is always a plus in my book!

pv7DF0ECJ-pVD0MVn_a9Yg.text: We were looking for a dog friendly restaurant, and happened upon AZ 88. They are wonderful! They brought out a bowl of water for our puppy, and the staff fawned over her - which we loved!   They were all very friendly, and service was top notch!   The food was wonderful as well. I ordered one of their salads, and it was delicious! We enjoyed everything about this place, and will definitely be back!!

AR2mkSXkN_cYNJqcO5LGzw.text: AZ88 is upscale & trendy with an excellent vibe. Very bright and open area which lends itself to a great atmosphere, that and dining with fabulous friends is a definite bonus! Although service for our large group was slow, even with calling ahead they seemed a bit overwhelmed trying to accommodate us all.  I had their amazing hot pepper chicken sandwich, marinated in lime juice, drizzled in honey and topped with spicy jalapenos, practically perfect with waffle fries and a fresh mix of bite size fruit & vegetables.(if for nothing else but to add color to the plate) I'm looking forward to returning and trying the hell fire chips & AZ 88 chicken sandwich, so many tasty bites to choose from. However I did get to delight in a bite of of melt in your mouth strawberry cheesecake, I think I heard angels singing or perhaps that was my tipsy fellow patrons, either way it was a bite of heaven!  AZ 88 is a must try, a place to see and be seen(no doubt an eye opening experience in the facilities, you'll have to see for yourself) and definitely place to return!

aVXs4VVVe-JYfMMJxQF_tw.text: This place was tucked back facing a park of some sort and an awesome LOVE statue. The atmosphere was awesome and candles were every where. We went on a Sunday night and it was pretty quiet. Service was great and they were all super friendly.   FOOD!   I had The Chicken sandwich and added bacon and cheese. Twas good, needed a little flavor, but the honey mustard helped.   We also had the grilled cheese, twas tasty and very cheesy.   I had an Old Fashioned, and man o man, IT WAS BOMB! It is hard to find a place that even knows what an Old Fashioned is, let alone make a good one. Don Draper would approve.   Had a sundae....not so bomb....just you average sundae...flavorless whip cream.   Cheesecake was pretty good.   Prices were pretty awesome for the atmosphere it provides. They could charge more for the location and atmosphere.   It is easy to get lost. Most GPS take you to a parking garage...park in there and exit out of the NE corner. On your right will be a Mexican restaurant and AZ 88 is on your left.

uc0RDDBYjK7U85r0WNK0PQ.text: Great food, cool trendy place and atmosphere. The drinks were all amazing and the martinis were actually full to the brim! Will definitely be back!

yliDfIxesjTF8aMlRxjpkQ.text: Wow!!!  I love this place.   I have just discovered it has the best burger I have ever had too!  "Burger Au Poivre Ii," is bold and complete in flavor, my mouth is watering as I write this review.  Eating this burger is almost like the first time you eat thai food.  It is a combination of flavors that you didn't expect, but it is so perfect, that it becomes your new favorite.  The "Burger Au Poivre Ii" does have bleu cheese on it, so if you are not a stout pallet, perhaps you should pick something lighter.      I also drank an English Garden with my burger, if in case it happened to be the combination which induced the state of epicurean nirvana from which I am writing.

iYZa9--1l4B5c51OfDsrFw.text: I truly did not give this place the full access to impress me. I did not have the Burger Au Poivre II, nor did I order the Thai Chicken Salad that seemed fantastic - I merely drank and enjoyed service and company.   While the service didn't impress, the company did. And so did the overall ambiance. This is a nice place and I do intend to come back here and start an evening. But when I was here the service had quite a bit to ask for. Maybe it was busy, and they were understaffed for the evening - but that is hardly my assumption to make. But with that part of my evaluation flawed, the overall impression is still a good and lasting one.  Another kudos to the awesome bathrooms. Adorable as a memento, terrible when one is buzzed and tries to focus in a hallucinogenic turquoise light while needing to pee.   Soon I will explore thy menu, AZ88 - don't let me down.

boj4clk9J16nTPoLWnCUpw.text: I went here for dinner and drinks with my husband and sister-in-law last weekend and we had a great time. The three of us sat outside and that's what I'd recommend for anyone visiting AZ 88. The atmosphere is much more relaxed and less sterile than the interior dining area.   We ordered the ceviche as an appetizer and it was delicious. Being from Florida,  I'm sort of a ceviche snob. It wasn't the best I've ever had but it was very good and I'd definitely order it again. The homemade tortilla chips really elevated the dish to another level. They were the perfect texture. They started very crispy but softened just the right amount when piled with ceviche.   My husband and sister-in-law ordered the grilled cheese and both of them liked it. I didn't try any of it...because neither offered me a bite. I guess that it was too good to share! I had the cobb salad and it was fresh and tasty. The bleu cheese dressing was good and the crispy bacon was perfectly cooked.   The best part was, by far, the drinks. I ordered a Moscow Mule and it came in a copper mug. It's always supposed to be served like this but so many places around here cut corners and serve it in a glass. The acid from the limes has to react with the copper mug in order to create the True flavor of a Moscow Mule and I really appreciated their attention to detail. Also, I was surprised that the drinks weren't more expensive. They were by no means cheap but I just expected them to be a lot more at a place like this.  If I had to say anything negative it would be about the bathrooms. Don't get me wrong, they were clean and well-kept but the doors were confusing. They had changing lights under the doors and everything was glass. It was confusing...especially after several drinks. Is it too much to ask for a picture of a man or woman on the appropriate bathroom door?

lNx6Hv2957NFqTOZajUPqQ.text: It's swanky in a not very swanky area.  On the bright side there's a large parking garage by it so parking isn't a hassle.  The menu is pretty much like lunch - salad, burgers, and chicken sandwiches.  I tried AZ88 burger with waffle fries.  Not bad, nothing special.  I probably won't make an effort to go back.

mq-ppNNskU3LYVDN7Ri4zA.text: Hmm I have been to AZ88 more than twice. Weird that it doesn't show a review from me either. At any rate, I love the atmosphere of this place. Music pumping, conversations flowing, martinis overflowing, food is delicious and the waiters are fabulous. Getting a seat can be tricky so come early or you will be waiting in the wings looking at everyone else enjoying their martinis (which they really do fill to the brim and I spill every.single.time.withou....) It is also a place to see and be seen (as I have observed on my numerous times, quite funny actually) You won't be disappointed!

hW62XLVMZ3osSmVnr8os-g.text: Great atmosphere and martinis filled to the brim. Prices are fair. Go to the bathroom-it's quite the experience!

sFc_gipsj89ATl3ZkgPNvg.text: Talk about a chill yet upscale place for a bite and some drinks. I have been here a few times. Always love the ambiance. Always love the service. Burger Au Poivre II is my fav thing on the menu! I get it most ever time I am here. Peppery, bacony, bleu cheesy, and burgundy saucy...   Getting so hungry for this burger now!!!  I love the top shelf liquors too! I usually have a light rum with a ginger beer. Light and sunny love in the house!   If you have not been here, please go. Invite me along. Its been a while. And now I am starving.

g9O-M-OWJrc5jGiXEP1b0A.text: Lovely, dog friendly outdoor patio and courteous service. Enjoyed my two martinis (generously sized) and a juicy, savory burger. Who says I can't drink martinis with a burger? Booo yah

XMYsE_vQhAw1klTmvUKZUA.text: We enjoyed our food and sitting out on the patio and even had a fine waiter but our drinks took far too long. The restaurant wasn't even full and we got our drinks about a minute before our food. I ordered a second drink at that time figuring the bar was backed up and got it with the bill. Unacceptable.

X1qJfTSwSbJlb8xlaGFhVw.text: The drinks here are really good and stronggggg! For apps we had the cracker pizza, shrimp ceviche (really good!), and some wings that weren't good at all lol. They only gave us drumsticks for some reason. Is that normal? Oh but I like that they have the option to split burgers or sandwiches for an additional $3 and you both get double the sides. Can't say I love the waffle fries here, they should be a little more crisp. It gets sooooo crowded and loud here, if you come on a weekend more than likely you'll have people squeezing behind your chair to get to their table or the bathroom. Speaking of which, WHY are the bathroom doors so heavy???!!!

NX4jKrtkK1KwmK3RwcSlXQ.text: From the atrocious tin-foil resembling decor to the disgusting food AZ-88 is not a good pick. The cheesy jazz music played in the restaurant gave me a pounding headache during the experience and lasted throughout the rest of the day. Again, and hour and a half of my life I will never get back. The Falsely advertised "grilled vegetables " showed more similarities to a bag of microwave Birdseye vegetables than a good entree. They also lacked the knowledge on how to make fries that could be enjoyed by people that did not have silver hair. On my ride back to the hotel I had several episodes where my pants filled with a furious river of diarrhea. The last thing that I have to notify you about is the extremely inappropriate bathroom situation,  my eight-year-old came running out crying after watching videos called perversion for profit he is now in therapy for PTSD!!!

BUg5Bro6MMNKzVXcHleqWg.text: If you want an interesting choice of martinis in a beautiful and provocative setting, come here.  The food is very good and I've never had a bad meal;  Specifically, I recommend the Flirtini, which is a berry martini.  It's sweet, so if you don't want a sweet taste, try the classic.  It's good, too.  I also have enjoyed almost every sandwich on the menu and many appetizers - all excellent.    The ambiance is creative and interesting.  When I was there last, a giant human eye exhibit flickered above the bar.  Really, who else does this?  It's fantastic.

9o6_qRAHEgjaYfGbkPuNZg.text: Food was fresh and amazing!!! Our waitress Marielle was incredibly kind and welcoming, so kudos to her! My boyfriend and I will definitely back!

zev7R6KRSLvo8_TMWZvIUA.text: Love this place.  Delaney is fabulous love the BLT come here every time I m in Scottsdale

kTyHRHMEsrteDHfBfY1ffQ.text: We walked in and we were greeted by a wonderfully nice gentleman.... who ended up seating us after a short wait! The bar tenders and the gentleman who sat us were so friendly and kind! I will say that I think other people had a wonderful dining experience. Unfortunately we did not share that same experience, our server said no more than 30 words to us.  This is even after he forgot our appetizer that we ordered immediately after being sat. We understand mistakes happen but there wasn't much of apology and certainly no trying to rectify the situation... needless to say don't sit in Chris's section!

QUV9rKtjskrQhrZEWVlEfQ.text: Have to say I have never been treated so well in a restaurant by a manager and server. We had a group of girls out for bachelorette party and we realized while waiting for our food that our reservation for escape the room was actually in 20 minutes instead of the hour we thought we had. We asked the server if it was possible to cancel our order and she said she would check with manager. Dale the manager came out and told us the food was just getting ready to come out. He graciously took the majority of the food off our bill but packed the food for us to take with. The food was incredible even as we were walking as quickly as we could. Thanks so much to dale and Diane for their generosity. It actually ended up being the highlight of our night.

YBfcoutN-OhBBYBaOa9UWA.text: This is supposed to be upscale and trendy place.  The service is horrible and the food is not that great.  I could get much better quality food at Jason's Deli for half the price.  Oh and those recliner seats are horrible.  I certainly would not recommend it at all.

THSMnUYa0LWa6sI3Ej102Q.text: Our hamburger was delicious, and the fries were crisp.  The best thing, though, was the service.  Bradley was engaging and accommodating, and he really knows his 80s pop bands!  We had fun testing each other's knowledge.

L0lnL1LzD5Bz6ExCGA53oQ.text: I've been to this establishment 3 times. The first time was as an invite to a birthday gathering. The other two times were on purpose...sadly. I do like to take visitors who like to drink alcohol here. It is definitely the place to go in old town Scottsdale for cocktails and general debauchery. The food is pretty terrible. Chefy sandwiches aren't really that chefy. Honestly, you can get same sandwich at a Corner Bakery or the like. I generally loathe Scottsdale. This place has a really nice ambience. The service is pretty poor. I wouldn't recommend it unless you're looking do drink $15+ per drink and need to show off a new outfit to people who are so superficial they might actually care about what you threw on your back.

OYohIq0WdMJ-eMNwYfETLA.text: Fabulous restaurant in Old town. They had a Christmas tree made of dollar bills at Christmas time which was gorgeous. It was packed but service was good. Since orders were taking long our drinks were on the house. We stopped in for dessert and got the key lime pie which was amazing but everything on the menu looked good so I am excited to go back and try more!!

knZGOS-w1VLhWO7MUeQ35Q.text: It was a over priced marginal bar trying to be more than it is. I guess my review was a little short so here we go.  This place is a over priced  nothing.  It sucked, the server was very good but the manager was a douch bag.

DHbgbOep02wzmbtNr5sYiw.text: My go to for the best club sandwich in town!   Visit AZ88 for great service, a fun and funky atmosphere, and incredible food. Their menu is unique and has options for every tastebud. My personal favorite is the club sandwich with chicken, bacon, and avocado. The serving sizes are generous and come with fries, fruit, and vegetables. Other great options are the burger, wings, housemade chips, and salads. Everything I have tried here has been excellent.   If you are hungry in old town don't miss this place!

eBEYErgbgFPphj0ISoNlYw.text: AZ88 is our favorite dessert + martini date night spot! Their desserts are huge and martinis are amazing! The drinks are a little pricey but totally worth it. It is perfectly located in the Scottsdale Civic Center Park with a modern vibe, perfect for throwing on your favorite LBD {little black dress} and having a romantic evening with your sweetie! ...Or a fancy girls' night with your ladies! {I always recommend AZ88 for a Bachelorette party stop!} I also love their patio when the weather is nice {& If there is live music in the park, that is a total plus!}   Favorite Desserts:  Strawberry Shortcake -- INSANE!!!! My favorite.  Turtle Sundae  Golden Gate Cake   Favorite Cocktails:  Saint Germain Martini- French Elderflower Liqueur, Grey Goose La Poire & champagne, served with citrus peel  English Garden Martini- Elderflower Liqueur, Hendrick's Gin, Cucumber Moscow Mule

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Turtle Sundae + English Garden Martini!
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. AZ88 Strawberry Shortcake is off the charts!!

EvXLOSBOJkh_LbYV7ORhKg.text: Went here with soccer team (kids and parents). Sat outside in February. Weather was perfect. Food was great. The moms loved the martinis. The kids walked around outside the restaurant while we could see them from the patio.   This is probably not a place for kids (too trendy), but we were fine being placed outside. The doors to the restrooms are interesting. The white doors blend into the walls. Only the words on the very bottom tell you it's a bathroom. Unique.

bDxg6lWfyRif_W74riX0Sg.text: When in Scottsdale, visiting my wife's family... we always make sure to head to AZ88.  AZ88 has been around for awhile but always has a crowd.  The atmosphere is very minimal but interesting with a regularly changing ceiling center piece throughout the year.  The outdoor seating is very pleasant (not in the summer) especially when the concerts in the park are happening.  The drinks are always good but the martinis are wonderful.  They are quite large and the bartenders fill them to the rim.  It is fun to watch the staff deliver the martinis without spilling a drop.  I have tried most things on the menu but the AZ88 Chicken Sandwich is the one to try first.  Simply... excellent!  Interesting note: They have a sister restaurant in Milwaukee called Elsa's on the Park.  Another great place to go if and when you are in Milwaukee.

uazhzJD2BKIjKzHVtmCm_g.text: In town visiting and love trying new places. Throughly impressed such a great environment for a mid twenties up age group. Tables a little small our server forgot about us a couple times but we managed to entertain ourselves  but overall a great experience. Food was tasteful and drinks were just right.   Add note. The host gentleman at the front was phenomenal.

9nFTJh8kON5zRDvDATtpTQ.text: I have been to Az88 many times with my boyfriend the food is always deliciouse and the staff attentive , We always irder the burger au pavoir II and the chicken sandwich both are wonderfull.  In addition we always order double vodkas  the drinks are poured well and the ambiance is lovely thank you to the lovely staff at Az88 you truly make our date nights wonderfull

nE4V-yzcySBAbhb1du_T1Q.text: This place is trendy, but very welcoming. It doesn't have the usual big sign outside, so if it is your first time there at for first you may miss it, but just look for the white chairs outside, and the pumping music. Once inside you're immediately greeted by a high energy guy with glasses. I was sat right away & our waiter was great. Bradley was on point and he made it a smooth experience. Food was good. We made it an affair complete with dessert. Overall I enjoyed it and looking forward to be back.

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I cannot describe how moist but rich this cake was.
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A grown up lox

ycW0R3Y46rKas2s-ZYiJKg.text: Went in on an afternoon.  Great service from Patricia and the kitchen was quick with the food.  Burger was fantastic.  The art on the wall behind the bar wasn't as fabulous as previous installations, but it's still got some neat stuff to look at.  Definitely something different and I would like to go back to try the dessert and drinks.

k1gQBKHXKEeQXIdKEos8Uw.text: Great food and outdoor patio in Scottsdale! Treat yourself to a delicious AZ88 burger. You won't be disappointed! Cheers!

YPFk3zcx197aAr2RHdj3GQ.text: This place is awesome! I've now been here twice, this time was for my long time friend's birthday who came into town, and it wowed me yet again. To start, the decor is just lovely! The outside seating area is what draws you in, I don't know what to call them but the illuminated kayak boat-looking sculptures that hang overhead are just gorgeous! Looking at them from underneath is cool but when you look at them from outside the restaurant it's a masterpiece! The inside as well does not disappoint, with the ever changing wall behind the bar to the cool bathrooms and floor to ceiling glass walls, this place is definitely here to impress the eye! And I love the music that they play here. Location is perfect, it's around so many things in Old Town Scottsdale I'm sure if you're strolling by it's not hard to miss!   The customer service is 5/5. Our waiter was super nice, he started us out with some water without us having to ask, which is a sign of great customer service from the beginning in my opinion. He constantly checked back with us to see if we needed anything and was helpful with suggesting things on the menu.  Food was outstanding. Appetizers were plentiful sizes in itself, entrees were well worth every bite. My company got the appetizer wings and it came with waffle fries, it was such a big serving to be just an appetizer! I'm not much of an alcohol drinker but my company let me try what they got, the Moscato was really smooth and tasted great! The prices are definitely reasonable for what you get. Only bummers were that they don't have many veg friendly options and they don't offer anything for birthdays.  Overall, this place is super swanky and hip, from the customer service to the vibe, ambiance and decor. It's hard to find anything that I didn't like here!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I love the crystals on the tables! Birthday boy in the background!
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great interior!
Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cool bathroom!

Cg7ohfA6Zr_O-1Bl_KpexQ.text: Great place! Has a very upscale vibe with a relaxed lifestyle atmosphere. Inside the building has huge glass walls making the room very well lit. The ambience was just the right level. Not to quiet, but not overly loud.   Ladies had some summer solstice Martinis, guys had Tito's on the rocks and and dog fish head IPA.  The 7353 chicken club is yumm it has a few ways you can make it. I had the mouthwatering burger ala pourve ll. I loved every last bite.  Cheers and enjoy

vCqab7XI0I1CRFHLrpI69w.text: Arrived very late on Friday night and they were still serving food at 11:30pm. Very friendly waiter and nice atmosphere. Was within walking distance of our hotel. Hilton Garden Inn. Beautiful weather for a late night walk.

MhAk_CfnaANe6H1IXCVlqA.text: We had a lovely late lunch here. The food was delicious. The patio overlooks a park and the staff were very attentive and friendly. Their burgers are to die for!

iG8mcDcYCnMbZiEa6JaKfA.text: AZ 88....nicely done! This jewel is tucked away down art ally in Scottsdale. The environment is nice along with the theme.  For dinner, we were greeted by Christian. Through the entire meal, Christian did an excellent job! Simply put, the chicken sambos are on point! Cocktails were also nicely done! They have one hell of an old fashion!   For dessert, you can't go wrong with the Golden Gate Cake. By far a quality way to end the experience!  Service was good and ambiance was to match. Overall, totally worth your time, appetite and money! Recommend 100%

epNQodrbnkV6IEYYujwrng.text: This is definitely one of my favorite places in Old Town! I love the atmosphere, there is a new art installation each month.   The food is good, my favorite dish (so far) is the BLT. An added plus is that waffle fries and fruit come with every sandwich. For dessert you absolutely have to get the Golden Gate cake. It's pretty decadent but I promise you won't be disappointed. It comes with whipped cream and butterscotch. Pro Tip: Try to get a little of everything in each bite.  Each time I go my experience is made magical because of the server Chris. He absolutely gives the best service and I know that he'll never disappoint. Thank you Chris for making every meal more than great!

L2Vq0qqsM3z0XQlQwrBlOA.text: This is an amazing late night spot! We decided to give it a try last week since their kitchen is open late. It ended up being exactly what we were looking for! Very open feel, friendly service, super fresh food, some champagne, and the best tunes. If you are looking for a date spot, AZ/88 is perfect. A great lounge feel and we liked that it was tucked away a little bit. Hope to be back soon!!

Although I enjoyed the music it was a pretty loud place and hard to hear each other/the server at times but still made for an enjoyable environment.

uhZuaKcL5GezTWJXNGLcOg.text: Hidden gem. Love the food, the music, the interior design, the vibe, and the amazing cocktails. Great servers, interesting clientele, an overall winner.

x-K1hpuX4Tx6zSqVf78dLg.text: We had an amazing first visit to the fantastic AZ88. The Scottsdale trip advisor highly recommended going there, he was absolutely spot on. I thought the advisor said Crazy88 at first (from the Quentin Tarrantino film). Rebecca, our lovely server was brilliant. We had the Cobb and Cesar salads, followed by the chocolate mouse cake, which were all sublime. We can't wait to visit Old Town Scottsdale and AZ88 again. xx

kM4a4bhBO7zG1G2c50PplA.text: Ordered food to go. Was told 40 minutes. Okay. I understand lunch rush and all. Gave them and extra 10 before arriving. Sat near the bar for an extra 30 minutes. After the bartender told me for the 3rd time my food wasn't ready- I left. I don't care how busy it is there is no reason for 1 chicken sandwich to take that long

FT7-nNVgyw-qzV25Z9H0-Q.text: Fun atmosphere, great music, really good food, bartenders are on point, our server Casey was legit, and I highly recommend it!

ppgYxtK922rUf83EcUNs0Q.text: AZ 88 is located in old town Scottsdale, located right next to the Scottsdale Performance Center. Super cute Trendy establishment, dog friendly on the patio.  Food; Got the flatbread appetizer which was seasoned perfectly and mighty tasty.  The wine was delicious.  Service; Server was friendly and outgoing.

rJzZfPQrADKgJemL0AJ5Pw.text: AZ88 in Scottsdale is the sister restaurant of Hanny's in downtown Phoenix. You guessed it, it opened in Arizona in 1988. I have been coming here since 1995 when I heard about it from my college roommate.  I have been a loyal customer ever since!  It is located in the Scottsdale Mall right by Scottsdale Center for the Arts in a large open floor plan modern building. It hasn't changed at all since I started going there in 1995 and it really doesn't need to. Simple works! Occasionally they will have an art installation that will be up for a few months.   Service is always great. Especially from a young woman named Shqipe (yes I spelled it right) that I always request. She has been taking care of me at AZ88 for years and is the best!   Let's talk about the important things, the food and drinks. Cocktails are all pretty amazing. They have a large drink menu with just about anything you can think of. Their specialty is the martinis but their cocktails are fantastic as well. One of my favorite cocktails is the champagne celebration...Champagne, chambord and peach schnapps mixed together and topped off with sugar sprinkles. Delicious!   Martinis are served in a large hand blown glass and are filled to the rim. The martinis are not cheap here though, average is $15, but well worth it.   AZ88's food is wonderful. They have great appetizers, great sandwiches, salads, amazing burgers and entrees. I always order the gallettes to start which is a flat bread sprinkled with bacon, sauteed onion, black olives and Parmesan cheese. Amazing! The chicken and bacon club is another one of my favs. I also really enjoy the AZ88 chicken salad which is basically a cobb salad with sliced buffalo chicken breast. Hot and spicy. Yaaaas! Everything they have has a uniqueness.   This review would be pages long if I kept going. Bottom line, I have not had a bad thing here ever!   Check out AZ88, you will be glad you did!  It's usually pretty busy every day of the week, Friday and Saturday though it's pretty packed so be prepared. They do not take reservations unless you have a large party but you have to call to discuss arrangements.    Enjoy!

Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gallettes! Delicious!

yL2i0uaOuBYVR7on4iPNyA.text: First time here. Went last night before a concert   We had a table of four , two of whom had been here before.  Probably the worst meal ever.  Everyone returned their dishes. I had heard such great things about this place and was totally disappointed. Never again.

nKwTzHzLSHwgyExwFIWSPg.text: Might be the best meal we had while in Scottsdale.   Fun, trendy spot.  Great staff. Excellent and friendly service.   Loved it.

7qjhLLMkUy5evT0PGu01Uw.text: The place definitely has atmosphere. The decor is great. Came in here for a quick snack and the experience was good. Ordered the St. Petersburg which is basically chips topped with cucumber, beats, cream cheese and salmon (although it could have used more salmon). It tasted fine, and the "Hot Dog" drink was not bad either.  Prices are up there a bit, but what do you expect from Scottsdale? I say it's a good place to come in for a drink or quick bite. Other than that, their menu seems to be sandwiches, burgers, and a few plates.  Definitely a place to stop by if you are on a night out with friends and you want that posh experience!

photos.caption: Photo of AZ88 - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon over potatoes

dsYt-iWmQK32NagtM8ILQw.text: The AZ 88 chicken sandwich without the blue cheese is my favorite sandwich in the whole world! The spicy sauce, the celery, just delicious. I like that the sandwiches come with fresh fruit and the most delicious french fries I've ever had.  If I had to have a last meal, I would choose the sandwich!

8Ny-japk6A7g_FyM5ptNzA.text: A friend of mine recommended this place a spot to head before going over to Scottsdale stadium. I was considering the Moose bar as a sportier alternative but I'm glad I picked to go here. I got there before my friend did, so I seated myself outside on the patio. You have a nice view of the farmer's market and a music stage. Too bad the music was terrible. The patio seating also has this cool glass rectangular prism things surrounding it.  Anyhow, I ordered an old fashioned cocktail. Pretty tasty. I ordered the chicken calabrese which came with the waffle fries. The sandwich was soooo good. It had 2 juicy chicken breasts and bell pepper and onions. It was delicious. My friend enjoyed his Caesar salad. I would definitely come back here for brunch.

pLDLhz4laNAA09Zgelol8A.text: I love this place. It has a Very hip vibe, plus awesome martinis.  The service is very good too, being that this is in the center of old town, that says a lot ! The burgers are amazing.

ulaxQxZJH9Q21eiI64EVQA.text: Great food, great atmosphere, great service.. You can tell the staff cares about their patrons... management is perceptive and knows what works.

p8Fq9e0MRCX0ChWzjCxfZA.text: Went to inquire about a dinner for around 20 to 25 people. Was blatantly told they don't do that in possibly the rudest way ever by the not-busy in the slightest manager. Not only will there be no dinner here, I will also be making a request that all 120 people traveling to Scottsdale from Los Angeles, Boston, New York, and out of country do not eat here while they are in town as they will likely just be met with brusque attitude and the worst customer service possible.

2aZuDhpN-X9I8Sl5OnttHw.text: Great spot for outdoor dining in an elegant setting overlooking Scottsdale Fine Arts Center park. Upscale "bar food", wide selection, full bar.

snSdOg4DAqYCaJHnmpLMUA.text: I haven't been to AZ88 in ages. My husband and I used to go there years ago and order martinis with those awesome blue cheese potato chips. I had lunch there with a colleague today. What a disappointment!  The place looks old and run down. The service was awful, even with our plan to get there after 1 p.m., after the lunch rush (if there even was one). After we seated ourselves (weird), it took forever for the server to come take our order. The bacon on my BLT was super fatty and the lettuce on the sandwich and in the garnish was super wilted. The fruit wasn't ripe, so it was hard and tasted sour (except for the grapes, which were mushy). My lunch partner offered me some potato chips, which were soft and stale. We didn't realize we had no silverware or napkins until after the server brought us our lunch and left. She never came back, so I had to get up and find someone to bring them to us. LBNL, we waited too long for the check. Finished with AZ88. Definitely not what it used to be...

Ex-ELCPGZ7MnrNrzPNnYvQ.text: I stumbled upon AZ 88 last January when in Scottsdale after a friend had recommended it.   The restaurant is smack dab in the middle of some public park which was sort of cool and had a large outdoor patio that was great for al fresco dining. The ambiance was nice - clean, contemporary, open setting. We had to wait a bit for a table outside so we sat at the bar for a cocktail...many were these martinis large and stiff!  Once seated we enjoyed some crudite and then proceeded to order some tasty burgers (I had been told that was what you had to get there). They were pretty impressive burgers, not going to lie.  The bathrooms here are a trip. They were confusing to find (no handles, the only indication that it is a bathroom was some small marking at the bottom of the door, etc.). The interiors are covered with mirrors with colored lights everywhere. It was sort of hard to figure out where the urinal, sinks, etc. were. Was definitely the most interesting restaurant bathrooms I've ever experienced.  The prices weren't too bad, and overall it was a great place to stop int he area.

l57ASfL0DyFksw4Fs4SHcA.text: Hidden gem. Randomly found this place and was presently surprised. Very odd decor works for here. Felt like I was in the Betelgeuse house.   Best cocktail bar in Old Town by far.

53c2KrgUjvZEtxIFpvSowA.text: You know I wasn't a big fan of this place at first. I'm not much for Scottsdale thousandaires so I turned my nose up to this place before I even have it a chance. Thank goodness it didn't flood or I would've drowned too. This place is small inside and it can get a little warm but there's a patio so when the weathers right it's pretty pristine. The bathrooms are pretty crazy and definitely worth checking out so make sure you have to go sometime in between your visit. Enjoy the peep show videos in the unisex bathroom.  As far as appetizers go, we get the potato skins/fries with the salmon. It's pretty legit. I heard the drinks are good here especially the martinis. It's not on the menu but if you ask for a mango martini it will definitely not let you down. The espresso martini is probably a second runner-up to it. Every entree we've gotten have been extremely delectable.  I tried 2 different plates and 4 different burgers and haven't been let down yet. I still cry and whine when everybody says they want to come here because I have to keep up my image, but I definitely like this place. For the time being I'll keep allowing myself to get dragged here

gfh5QL6WzjD5kS9xKlquDg.text: Hosted a luncheon here today and everyone loved their meal. The salads were fresh. I ordered a plate of grilled vegetables and it was a ton of food! We were nursing martinis and our server, Gilbert, brought us fresh cold glasses after a bit. Such a nice touch! Really enjoyed the art -- there was a new installation for Valentine's Day that is a projection of a beating heart, projected onto a hole in the wall. So cool. Great patio and views and ambiance. Loved this pla

zWndCTFTRPnxudrIN2Ao-w.text: this is another one of those "scene" restaurants from the variety of dining patrons to the interesting take on comfy food. i.e. grilled cheese. OMG. it is great. And the crowd tends to be younger, hip, waiting for something at Scottsdale center for the Performing Arts. Sitting outside is also fun. Another trademark is trying to find the bathroom entrance in the mirrored wall. I know it sounds kinky but it is fun.
